description: Everything I ordered here is good and the best honey walnut pawn.  Been here many,many times+years.  Want good Chinese food,come here!!!
author: Lan C.

description: Loved the food and  they were so nice. The chicken wing were delish! Just moved to SF and this place es also clean!
author: Zuly G.

description: Very pleasant to eat in, not just a place for takeout! Complementary tea too! Loved the won ton soup. Only took about 5 mins for the food to come. Great spot for late night too
author: Lily T.

description: Great food at a decent price. Got the sweet and sour pork, a side of rice and the chicken chow mein to share with a friend and it's more than enough food for the both of us.
author: Sierra S.

description:
Lets be honest. There is a reason this place is always empty. The food is tasteless, the service is poor, and they have a $20 minimum for credit cards. $20, really?! 

I've been here once and I don't plan on returning. My hard earned money is better spend elsewhere.
author: Justin S.

description:
Meatless chicken is great, my girlfriend and I are huge fans of this vegetarian friendly Chinese restaurant. Delivery has been consistently fast and the food tasty. The fake meet does tend to arrive in a singular mass but stirring it up with a serving spoon does the trick. I'd appreciate a complimentary white rice thrown in with the meal but even that is fairly cheap if I remember to order it. 

I give it 5 stars because they live up to my expectations and I enjoy their food every time.
author: Riley B.

description:
I ordered delivery from here once and got the Chow Fun with pork (specifically bbq pork, although the menu online did not mention that) and the Kung Pao Fried Rice (medium spice). 

Delivery time was fast!

We loved the Kung Pao Fried Rice! Imagine your typical fried rice but with kung pao chicken, bell pepper and peanuts and mushrooms. The Chow Fun was O.K. It has a good amount of veggies (mostly bean sprouts). Kind of disappointed the meat was bbq pork... I would've chosen a different meat if I knew.

Would order again for the Kung Pao Fried Rice!
author: Lilian C.

description:
Delivery estimated 30 minutes.  It's been an hour and 15 minutes and it's still not here. I called twice and they keep saying 10 minutes. There is no Chinese food worth waiting an hour and a half for. 

I could have walked to Safeway, bought food, cooked and eaten it by now. Very frustrating
author: Max P.

description:
I was craving Chinese food and this place really hit the spot. The prices aren't cheap like in Chinatown but the service was great and the serving sizes were super generous. The restaurant is nice and clean too.

We got the broccoli beef ($11) which had this addicting, delicious sauce. The garlic eggplant ($10) had great texture and strong garlic flavor. I loved it. The beef fried rice ($9) was the perfect comfort food. It's all pretty salty though so make sure to drink plenty of tea or water.

I definitely enjoyed my meal. Huge plus that they were extremely quick with getting the food to our table. We had barely just ordered and already had the food in front of us!
author: Linda X.

description:
I ordered a delivery last night. A metal piece came out from Sesame chicken.
Chow mein is bad as well.
author: Jeiko S.

description:
20 minimum for credit card is a total scam. Food is uninspired to barely having taste. This is supposed to be Hunan? But the menu says Mandarin instead. Confused. 



Been here twice. That's enough. Chicken corn soup had neither chicken nor corn in it and a weird mash of vegetables with egg flower. Drunken beef had tasty vegetables but grayish beef. Maybe vegetarian options are better?
author: Tim P.

description: Finally found the best Mongolian Beef in the city. After our favorite restaurant closed last year it was difficult looking for a restaurant with the similar taste of cooking.  This is definitely the one that hits the spot. If you are looking for a good Hunan food, this is the place.  Try the sesame chicken as well.  The place is very clean as well
author: JJ M.

description:
I've been there twice with a large group of people and they handled the service suspiciously fast. Food was tasty, nothing special, but I guess it's a good price/quality ratio.

Their brown rice is somehow tasteless. Portions are really big, so there is usually plenty to take home after a dinner. They have a couple of specials, which are quite original. Other than that it's a standard Chinese food choice of different meats + sauces.
author: Jakub S.

description: I can't get enough of this place! Their wonton soup is amazing and has so many fresh vegetables in it. The five flavor chicken is ridiculously good!
author: Mickey A.

description: I love this place it has the best salt and pepper fried rock cod the Szechuan beef delicious prawn fried rice amazing this will be my go-to place all the time... just had this for dinner yummy yum yum
author: Lorellie S.

description: The General Tsos meatless chicken is TERRIBLE. The "meatless" part is an awful rubbery texture and the outside is a strange, gelatinous coating that makes the whole thing stick together in one block. The sauce is watery thin, and the taste is not remotely General Tsos. I will not order from here ever again.
author: Chanda G.

description: Their Szechuan chicken is a unique and flavorful take on the Hunan classic. Sesame Chicken is not the best I have had, but it's far from the worst. Pick up orders are dutifully packed, and made quick. It's not the absolute best Chinese food in San Francisco, but when you have that craving for Americanized Chinese food, it will scratch that itch. They serve beer and have a TV that is usually playing a sports game.
author: Kevin M.

description: I order lunch here for quite frequently, and they always are very friendly and quick. They have so many vegetarian options. I especially love their veggie rolls and veggie potstickers.
author: Nicole W.

description: Ordered delivery today. Food was good, but found an egg shel the size of a quarter in the veggie fried rice. Also none of the dishes come with white rice? Glad we ordered a separate fried Rice or we wouldn't have had rice for our entrees. The orange chicken wasn't good, soft sponges texture.  My Kung Pao chicken however was really tasty. Fortune cookies were stale.
author: Christy B.

description:
This place should get zero stars as it is one of the worst businesses in town.  They keep cats in their restaurant.  Unsanitary to say the least.  I have been several times because I work nearby and it is the only chinese restaurant.. the employees are rude and the food is bad.  The last time I went they refused to let me order chow
mein for lunch instead of rice or to even let me order a side of chow mein... unbelievable.  I don't know why this place is still in business
author: Jon I.

description: Totally solid -- they are my go-to place for _fast_ delivery. Great variety and quality, I've been ordering from Yum Yum for years.
author: David P.

description: Ordered the Mongolian Beef and Salt and Pepper wings for delivery.  The Mongolian beef didn't look right (missing the typical looking sauce and covered in black pepper) and I could tell the wings were going to be soggy. The beef tasted like they dumped an entire pepper shaker into it and I could only manage 3 bites before I threw it out.  The salt and pepper wings should have just been called pepper wings, they weren't crunchy at all, and they were mostly fat.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Terrible!!
Uninspired, relatively tasteless food served cold with an unmitigated nasty attitude. I virtually never rate based on cost -  Here I must say it es especially expensive to have an unpleasant lunch plate. 
They get one star as the default -- I give them a second star for not physically assaulting me, otherwise I have no good reason for star #2. 
Avoid!!
author: Jesse Clifford A.

description: I ordered take out from my car before driving over. It was ready in 10 minutes. No wait. Right on time. This chef was fast, they got the order right, the portions were slightly larger than I imagined and the service was professional. It's clean the inside. Not modern or fancy, just simple. The food sells itself and the prices are more reasonable than other restaurants nearby.
author: Caroline C.

description:
Sometimes when I go for a lunch break and get a craving for Chinese food, I can get a little desperate and come here for the Chinese fix.  But every time I come to order the lunch special, the food comes out a little too fast, which makes me wonder...do they have an industrial microwave to reheat things in a jiffy?

Don't come here anymore because my aging digestive system can't handle the MSG anymore.
author: Bailey N.

description:
I LOVE this places Sesame Chicken!! It is to me, hands down, the best around. The meat has a nice batter around it, its nice and crispy and so flavorful and they don't give you tiny little pieces like some restaurants. You get nice full chunks of chicken. 

Sesame Chicken lunch special is the only thing I order from here so cant review much else food wise but give it a try, I bet you'll enjoy it! The service is super fast as well. 

SIDE NOTE: They did change their payment policy so if you want to dine in, I believe you must spend a minimum of $20.00 if you are going to pay with CREDIT/DEBIT card.
author: Sara C.

description: I ordered delivery from these guys last night and it was some of the best chinese food I've ever had. The five flavor chicken was amazing. The salty, spicy,crispy pork spareribs were TO DIE FOR!!! The chow fun was very good and the eggs rolls were so fresh and tasty I couldn't get enough. Definitely worth the price. Only issue I had was the delivery driver wouldn't find a place to park and deliver the food to my hotel room. Other than that, YUM YUM is RIGHT!!
author: Melissa E.

description:
Food is agreeable and good value, but not very much going on flavor-wise.

We had buddha bowl, genera tsao's chicken, steamed veggies, and chow fun. The chicken was disappointing, but the veggie options were pretty good.
author: Wolf R.

description:
Faster than fast food!!

Incredibly quick, ordered and not 7 minutes later 4 of the 8 dishes were out. Not long after the remaining dishes appeared. 

Quick, delicious vegetarian options with vegetarian "meat", would love to eat again!
author: Joshua L.

description:
Go-to chinese food delivery spot. They're fast, consistent, cheap, and really delicious. 

Dim sum is on point. Always order the Orange chicken, sesame chicken, green onion pancakes, crab rangoons, and walnut prawns. Want something different? The orange prawns are pretty rad too.
author: Wendy K.

description: Am still a fan of Yum Yum Hunan. I just tried their Salt & Pepper Rock Cod the other day, and it was great. Will definitely be ordering that again! Also, their Prawn Fried Rice is always Excellent (notice that capital "E"... I did that on purpose!). I often come here for this alone! Always a pleasure to order from Yum Yum!
author: Eric H.

description: Ordered food with requests that were ignored and got sick from the food having the wrong protein because of it.  Wont be ordering again.
author: Lindsay F.

description:
I have no idea because after dumping a few bucks in the parking meter then hiking down the block only to discover they are having kitchen problems
So it cost me to find out they won't be opening soon
author: Jim D.

description: Steve and his crew are awesome.  I always order the basil chicken white meat but I also have had most of all the other entrees.  The Kung poa fried rice is delicious and they can make it as hot as you like.  I have good to this place since Valencia street and it's still Great!!! Gets crowded during lunchtime.
author: Pam P.

description:
I went there a few years ago,some one took over,and food quality went down,i went there today  the food quality was still  not good,white rice was not good it was only ok,i got shrimp with egg over rice,too much salt in the egg and only 5 shrimp,bok choy underneath,egg was over cooked and hard shrimp was chewy,
service was fast but unfriendly,prices were very high for lunch $12 plus tax,i usually pay $6.50-$8.50 for the same dish,elsewhere ,they need to leave out the salt in the egg and bring prices down,i should probably give it a 2 star but I will stick to 3
author: cc c.

description: This is my favorite Chinese food in the city. The 5 flavor chicken is very unique and I haven't found anything else like it! The service is wonderful and service is quick.
author: Julie M.

description: My family has been ordering from Yum Yum for years, my mother loves the war wonton and I love the chow fun. The food is always hot fresh and delicious and the time is always shorter than estimated.
author: Nikko E.

description:
Ordered via eat24. The entire food had a rotten and moldy taste to it. Had to call eat24 and ask for a refund still waiting for their call. Will NEVER order from this place again! Spent $65 on rotten food! 

The restaurant refused to give me a refund stating that there is nothing wrong with the food. This is unbelievable! They hung up on me when I called.I had to go over there and let them taste it themselves. He just took pictures and told me that the food is good and he doesn't have to give me a refund. Eat24 gave me a $10 credit saying that they can't refund me unless the restaurant approved the refund. Are you kidding me? What is your job here than Eat24? How are you protecting your customers from this scum places? I'm never ordering food via this app ever again. You can get expired and slimy food from places and Eat24 does not do anything about it! Unbelievable !
author: Ana V.

description: Enjoyed the sweet and sour chicken with fried rice lunch special. Very good! $20 minimum for credit cards tho
author: Jennifer S.

description: Chinese food with all your favorites. They were super fast and nice. I loved the appetizers and chicken.  Some of the fried stuff was a little too bready, but hit the spot.
author: Andy S.

description:
Great for take-out/ delivery. Also, if you order over $25 worth of food, you get a free lo mein or fried rice (but you have to order over the phone; no free stuff if you order online due to take rates from the websites). 

Highly recommend:
- vegetable fried rice (not too oily and has lots of veggies in it, including zucchini!)
- crispy salt and pepper black cod
- mongolian beef (tasty with sautéed onions)
- chicken with green beans (v. generous with the green beans)
author: Amelia C.

description: I walked and the guy behind the counter did not even greet me, nor gave me a menu I had to grab my own. When he finally did speak to me he auto matically said "to go" WOW!!!! I said no for here. I sat down and as i'm looking through the menu he's standing over me as if was upset that I was taking so long. I wasn't even offered water! So then finally found something off of their over priced menu and asked what all comes with the lunch special? He then picks up the phone and calls another person they were delivery food too!!!! Omg did this just happend? I was beyond upset . I walked out and said you're rude im NOT giving you a dime of my money. NO THANKS! HORRIBLE SERVICE AND RUDE. DO NOT EAT HERE
author: Taleia T.

description:
We just ordered delivery from here and after a couple bites I had to eat cereal for dinner.

THE worst Chinese food. I got the general tso's chicken, but it wasn't chicken. Maybe 3% was chicken; the other 97% was some sort of grossly fried bread. BF's "chicken" dish was made of the same nasty mystery mixture.

The shrimp dumplings we got were good, but oh my googoo, not worth ordering from here if the actual entrees aren't edible.
author: Michele P.

description:
BLEH!!!!

This was the worst delivery Chinese Food I've ever had in the city. Everything was cold and even the fortune cookie was stale. They forgot our appetizer and had to deliver them later (also cold). 

The General Chicken was pretty bad as far as taste. 

Ordered here because it had high ratings which really is confusing how that happened.
author: Stacy Y.

description: Hands down favorite Chinese or Hunan or whatever it's called in sf. Fresh food! Chicken chow mein is always so fresh and yummy! Not greasy like most places. Five flavor chicken is yummy orange chicken, I need to try more things but it is pretty pricy. Kung pao fried rice?? Yummm must try next time.
author: Sydney W.

description: Great delivery from these guys! Love the ribs, pork fried rice, Royal pork is great as well. Deep fried prawns, egg rolls! These guys are faster if you call them instead of using some delivery app...
author: Kirk M.

description:
Tried to get Henry's Hunan to deliver to the Haight...NO GO ;-(
Yum Yum was the back up.  Food not as good as HH, but very delicious.
author: Kurt H.

description:
Perfect take out. Generous portions, well prepared, good flavor. The standards are exactly as you expect them to be and their house specialties deliver a bit of variety from the standard fare. Most of the online services only list the standard items, so when you get delivery, save the menu so you can order some of the other stuff. 

They are a house staple, we order from them at least a couple of times a month. The delivery people are always friendly and quick. We call them directly as they are very nice to deal with.
author: L E.

description: We ordered on the Yelp app: crispy noodles, Orange chicken and steamed rice. We were at the SPCA and they delivered with in less than 30 minutes! Everything was delicious!
author: Izzyjenn K.

description:
Great food for a great price! No complaints at all! I was told the delivery would take an hour but it arrived in 25 minutes! All the food was still hot and not greasy. 

The delivery guy was so friendly and the man who took my order on the phone didn't attempt to rush me off the phone like other places. 

All in all great place for cheap food and huge portions. Will definitely return!
author: Katerina Y.

description: They're pretty good. The prices have been going up, but the quality of the food has not gone up to match it.
author: Corinne K.

description: Ordered take-out from here and it was okay. The lemon chicken was good. The seafood chow fun for the price was not that great. Kinda bland. Had to add chili & soy sauce for flavor. Its conveniently located to where I'm staying temporarily so it worked out but I'm sure there's better spots to satisfy the Chinese food craving.
author: Aracely S.

description:
I've only had delivery from Yum Yum and I've been pleased every time. They are timely, their website is easy to use and they are always very courteous at the door.

The egg rolls and fried rice are great. The king pao fried rice is interesting, and I thought it was a fun dish. The hot and sour soup is a little on the bland side, but decent. I've liked all of the vegetable dishes I've ordered.

My go-to neighborhood Chinese delivery.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Go here if you want fried batter with orange chicken sauce.  There is a reason why I haven't been back to this place in over a year, although I work a few doors down. But I had a craving for Chinese food.  Big disappointment.  They are worse than ever now.
author: chari b.

description:
Ordered on the yelp app and it arrived in 20 still hot. Delivery guy was friendly and the bbq pork fried rice is good. General chicken has good flavor (if you like spicy, medium tasted pretty mild) gets points added for coming with broccoli but deducted cuz I feel like the pieces of chicken were 70% breading but that's not surprising.

For quick, hot delivery i would order from here again.
author: Siobhan T.

description: This place is great. My dad, sister and I were tired and hungry at CMPC in the waiting room at the Critical Care unit. My dad said he wanted Mongolian beef so I searched Yelp and found Yum Yum. The Mongolian beef had the perfect amount of spices and the beef was cooked to perfection. The delivery was fast and the driver came into the hospital and waited for me in the lobby downstairs. I'm sure he would have came up to the waiting room where we were at but I told the man on the phone to have them call me and I would meet them down there in the main lobby. They were fast and the food was super hot. Convenient and delicious. It left us wanting more. I will definitely order again.
author: Dema S.

description: Very nice Chinese restaurant with great prices. I had the vegetarian Kung pow. Delicious!
author: Mark L.

description:
I ordered delivery from here through Eat24.com last night. It was nice to see some comments mostly mixed about the food. For around $30 we got broccoli beef, chicken fried rice, and I tried to get pork chow mein subbed for shrimp chow mein but it came as pork.

The food was filling. Pretty greasy. I'm not a chow mein fan and this place didn't change that. The food was serviceable. I'd probably order from here again.

I like that they are not the standard take out boxes and they are plastic with a lid so they are easy to refrigerate. It came with 2 soy sauce packets and 2 fortune cookies. My girlfriend got the cookie with no fortune in it. LOL.
author: Marty J.

description: Love this place. Food is always very flavorful and delivery to my place is fast (about 20min). Love the Mongolian Lamb, orange chicken and sesame beef.
author: Dennis M.

description:
My go to chinese delivery now!


Have ordered twice, and both times the food was very good, and with prompt delivery. Highlights: crab rangoon, five spice chicken, walnut prawns. Pretty good: kung pao fried rice, vegetable rolls, green onion pancake. Questionable: minced chicken lettuce cups. Taste was good if you dump all the sauces they include on it, but every once in a while in the minced chicken, you'd get that too chewy, tendony bite. Not big pieces, but just those little bites that make you think twice about what you just ate. 

Also, we've ordered a couple entrees at once and not gotten the free stuff everyone else is raving about. How do I get on that??
author: Sarah B.

description:
My husband and I order out from Yum Yum's probably 1-2 times a month and we love it! 

Delivery is usually 20-30 minutes, and the delivery man is always friendly. The portions are huge, we always have leftovers. 

They usually throw in egg rolls for us too. Fried Rice & Chicken, Lo Mein & Orange Chicken are our favorites, with some wontons. 

Super yummy, cheap, and friendly. We love it!
author: Suzy G.

description:
Oh, Yelp. When will you finally install the ever requested half star ratings? 3.5 stars

Ordered delivery with a $15 minimum, cheaper than most delivery prices! Came on time (40 minutes) with a very nice delivery man. 

The prices are fair for the portion you get (pretty big). I ordered meatless orange chicken with "spicy" heat and vegetable pot stickers. The veg pot stickers tastes OK (they seldom ever do, at any restaurant.. not sure why I was hoping this would be any different), and didn't get soggy from the car ride at all. The meatless orange chicken was a bit mushy and soft, not from the car ride. I think that's just how their meatless chicken is. A little salty, but enjoyable with rice. 

Of course... as a vegetarian, I appreciate the nice variety of vegetable and meatless "meat" dishes! 

Overall, affordable place, quick service, and decent food. Nothing impressive, but still a good option for cheap delivery. Would order again if I felt like vegetarian chinese.
author: Jacquelyn T.

description: The food was just OK. I thought the bill was a bit high for the flavor/quality and I was also a bit annoyed with the $20 credit card minimum (and the fliers up to remind you basically all over the restaurant).
author: Hanna L.

description: Delish take out Chinese. Don't understand the criticism, it's def a local Chinese place and not a fine dinning experience, but when held to the standards of neighborhood take out it's the best take out chinese I've ever lived near too.
author: Julia M.

description:
I love this place. It is definitely NOT the best Chinese food in San Francisco but I really like the food and it is in my neighborhood.

I have eaten Yum Yum at least 30+ times and I have only had delivery. Ordering online is very easy and the food shows up in about 15 - 20 mins.

My favorites are 
Szechuan String Beans $7.95
Lemon Meatless Chicken $8.95
Sesame Meatless Chicken $8.95
Prawn Fried Rice $9.95
Vegetable Chow Mein $7.95

In summary, the prices are good, the portions are generous, delivery is super fast and the food is hot and delicious.

If you are super picky about your Chinese food maybe this is not the place for you.
author: Cat A.

description: Very disappointed food was not up to par. , food usually great, excellence, not TN today
author: Gloria J.

description: Worst won ton soup ever. Cashier insisted on adding chicken and veggie to the order and charged even $10 with no receipt. When i got the soup it had 3 won tons. I wanted won ton soup but i got veggie soup with 3 wontons. I drove back to the restaurant and returned my order.
author: Dulguun N.

description:
Very appropriate name, because while the boy&I were eating, I was definitely saying "yum yum!" Hah. Kinda.

We were in the area, when hit with a sudden craving for Chow Mein, so we yelped the nearest place to us, and we got Yum Yum Hunan! Yummy cheap food. Huuuuuge portions. We took our food to go, but the atmosphere was pretty nice [observations from the 5 min I spent in there.] Less than $12 for huge portions of chow mein&chow fun. Yummm :)

Will definitely come back next time I'm in the area :) I need to try their entrees!
author: Amy L.

description: Yum yum is yummy. I order from them all the time. Never had a bad meal and always get it quick. Had a great year long experience getting delivered excellent food no matter what I have ordered. Great job Yum Yum Hunan.
author: Justine P.

description:
Oddly enough, it's extremely difficult to find a go-to chinese delivery place in San Francisco, specifically that delivers to our apartment in pac heights. This place is quick, free delivery with a reasonable minimum (I refuse to pay a delivery charge), and from my perspective of chinese food tastes average/above-average. That hits most of my marks.

Had this place have any competition, I might be a little tougher of a grade. Although I'm putting down a 4, the overall reviews of a 3.5 is probably more accurate.
author: Casey A.

description:
Fast delivery but tasteless food with hair in it. Gross. 

I got the kung pao chicken lunch and some other things and was very excited because the reviews on here are great. The food came quickly which was nice but that the only good thing. My kung pao lunch had a nasty hair in it (see picture). Yuck!

I did not try anything else. Kudos to eat24 who rock and gave me a full refund. Never again yum yum. No way.
author: dr r.

description: Yum Yum Indeed, fresh fast and good. this is down the street from my office and i see it quickly going into my lunch rotation
author: Jillian C.

description: Fast delivery, but the food was extremely mediocre. I didn't even eat all of it, and I'm pretty tolerant of bad quality when I'm starving/hungover like I was that day. Honestly if you're questioning whether or not to eat here... Just don't. Plenty other places in the city.
author: Kaitlin R.

description: Holy cow!! They give plenty for delivery!! Delivery came less than 30 mins! My new favorite take out place for sure!
author: Gel C.

description:
SECRET TIP: use the online system to find what you want and then call in the order over the phone - It's cheaper!

Best chow fun in town! Absolutely to die for, just the right noodles, perfectly dressed, the vegetable is my favorite. Orange chicken is a perfect mix of American and traditional style. The soups are delicious, I recommend the wonton soup. 

Only downside (hence the 4 stars) would be the online order system. I often use the online system as a convenience and end up having to call in my order after I place it online because the system closes out when you try to complete and place your order. BUT upon calling in the order my total is usually $5-$10 cheaper than the online system. Delivery is good but takes about 45 mins
author: Tyler K.

description: The most arrogant and inconsiderate place. We clearly ordered vegetarian food for delivery and even mentioned it a few times. But the dish had chicken. We confirmed with our friends and called them back, but they didn't even admit. Infact they were rude to us and said that they were SURE there wasn't any chicken. Vegetarians, never order or eat from here.
author: Namrata J.

description:
This used to be my good-to because of the proximity to my place. This was sometimes a bi-weekly affair. I feel that the quality of this Americanized Chinese is above average. 

My favorite is the string bean chicken because the string beans are soft and cooked but not over oily. Their meats seemed a cut above some of the other local spots. Service is quick but not always the friendliest
author: Lauren K.

description:
this place is appropriately named because their food is yum yum. the ingredients taste fresher and look higher quality than comparable chinese delivery restaurants. the guy who answers the phone is always super friendly and very accommodating of my hatred of bell peppers. and they deliver to my house even though i live fairly far away. what's not to love?!

some of my favorite dishes are the chicken chow fun with black bean sauce (... with no peppers), the kung pao chicken, and the potstickers. bonus: if you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice.

yum yum, enjoy!
author: Connie S.

description:
This is actually the best delivery Chinese food we've gotten in San Francisco. They were easy to order from (and do have the buy 3 entrees, get a free chow mein or fried rice deal on), and we could substtute a couple of items in the appetizer combo and get cashew chicken for dinner, even though it was only on the lunch menu.

While I don't agree with the reviews that say the food is not greasy, I will say there are a lot more vegetables than are commonly found in delivery Chinese food here, which is great. The cashew chicken had plenty of broccoli, zucchini, and other vegetables scattered throughout. The mongolian beef was probably my least favorite - the beef was flavored all right with pepper, but the meat itself was not the best quality. The mu shu pork was quite nice with a good mix of julienned vegetables. The vegetable eggrolls arrived still surprisingly crisp, and the crab rangoon was more flavorful than I would have expected due to chives in the mix. The pot stickers were definitely the worst part of the whole meal - they weren't seared very well and the interior was a sodden mess. But otherwise, everything was quite good - I'd order from here again.
author: Lisa K.

description: Good, reliable, and fast when it comes to delivery. I do like the order online option as long as your are paying online. If you have to pay in store it is a bit of a hassle to place an order over $20 for cash but I can definitely understand having their phone line completely occupied with phone orders. I'm glad they partnered with Eat24 to fulfill orders.
author: Daniel W.

description:
Hands down the worst Chinese food I have had in San Francisco.

General Tso chicken was bland and had way too much breading.

The staff was nice and  brought the food quickly. But the quality was just too low.
author: Chris T.

description:
It's good take out. They are fast on delivery. 

The fried rice is full of goodness that you can see. My kids ate it and it had veggies and egg. So I am happy. 

Other items ordered: 
- Chicken Basil - good. Spice it up your way. Just let them know.
- Hong kong noodle combo - good. This comes with crispy noodles. Check out the picture and you will want to order this one.
- Beef Broccoli - good. Just look at the pictures i posted.
- Buddha delight - good. If you like the clear glass noodles, then you will like this dish. It has wood ear mushrooms, fried tofu, and various veggies.
- Szechuan string beans - okay. But if you order it, I will eat it again.
author: Van T.

description: Fast delivery, we ordered the beef chow fun, green beans, and scallion pancake. Beef chow fun was okay, not very much flavor, green beans were okay too. Scallion pancakes were good. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who wanted anything I ordered. Maybe other items on the menu are more fla
author: E B.

description:
This place us right by my job so needless to say I eat takeout/dine in at least once a week! Their dim sum isn't the best in SF but it makes for a quick fix mid week. 

I usually order their Veggie LoMain and it is awesome! Always crispy veggies and just enough noodles.  

I give it 4 stars b/c they only will let you use credit card on orders $10 or more
author: Jessica B.

description: My co-workers talked me into Chinese today.  Not typically my first choice for lunch but it was actually really good. We ordered take out and ate at work. The Mongolian beef with veggies was tasty and satisfying. I would eat here again.
author: David S.

description: Solid Chinese food delivery option.
author: Tal M.

description: The go-to Chinese delivery spot in Lower Pac Heights. If you are in the mood for Chinese takeout, this fits the bill perfectly. In one of the lower points for our house, they once delivered to us although we're just a block away...thanks for that.
author: Ron A.

description: I called in to place an order for delivery and the guy told me he didn't want my delivery order (2 miles away) because it's too busy. The previous call to this restaurant they told me they are cash only.
author: HankNine C.

description:
Some of the best Chinese I have had. Great for vegetarians.

Came to Yum Yum for a GrubWithUs dinner last night. The place was a ghost town, but the food was anything but. I gather this place gets a lot of its business from take-out and delivery service.

The dinner we had was completely vegetarian and there were more than enough choices.

Recommend:
Salt & pepper tofu
Vegetarian Orange Chicken
Veggie Pot-stickers

Will return soon!
author: Jana C.

description:
I'll refrain from the obvious pun on the name. 

We got delivery from Yum Yum the other night at a suggestion from a friend. We ordered the green beans and chicken, meatless sesame chicken, and a side of rice. GrubHub said they didn't deliver from Pac Heights to the Tendernob, but on the other hand, Seamless said they did (or the other way around, I can't remember). Delivery was neither fast nor slow, but did come within the time span given (within a 10 minute window and they hit it, I was impressed). 

My sesame chicken was ordered mild but Hunan being Hunan, it had a good kick to it. Be warned if you're sensitive to hot spices (if you are, what are you doing ordering Hunan anyways?)  

Delicious delicious food! It was hard not to eat all of it in one sitting (there was a lot!)  Fortunately lots of leftovers for work the next day!

Yum yum!

(You knew it had to be said)
author: Cassandra J.

description: Ordered delivery which was fast. Sesame/orange chicken was pretty soggy, wouldn't order again. Chow fun was good but pretty basic and a little too greasy.
author: Emily S.

description: the general tsao chicken watery and bland ..the  broccoli was ok but it made the rest of the dish super wet and meh. the crab rangoon and egg rolls were good,but the pork spareribs were waaaaaay too salty and nearly inedible. a c+ At best
author: Jack B.

description: I currently am laying in bed experiencing food poisoning from the "chicken" I ate from my first order from this restaurant. I had orange chicken and it had so much weird breading on it and wasn't crispy at all, and the chicken didn't taste like chicken. Everyone else got veggie dishes and they were ok, so I'm guessing it was the gross chicken.
author: Phoenix W.

description:
I'm from Sacramento, where the chinese food choices are limited. Went here with a group of people and i LOVED the food.

1) Mushu noodles, vegetarian - absolutely phenomenal, my favorite dish. Get that plum sauce in there!
2) Lemon chicken - essentially a huge chicken nugget with tangy lemon sauce on top. I liked it, but the crowd I was with was busy munching on other items
3) Mongolian Lamb - great sauce, lamb was tasty but it was my least favorite dish
4) Green beans & shrimp - my second favorite - the sauce on the green beans was amazing!

I would definitely come back here... vegetarians and non vegetarians, everyone enjoyed!
author: Ed P.

description:
I like to try new places and the menu looked good enough.

All night we had hot flashes and not good at all the next day.

We ordered the scallops with broccoli, mongolian beef and hot and sour soup. The soup was good everything else was sloppy with sauce and really spicy. 

That could of been part of the hot flashes but either way..it wasnt for me.

I wouldnt order take out from here again. I should of listened to everyone's reviews. 

They were really friendly on the phone and when they dropped off the food.
author: farah b.

description:
The food here is prepared very quickly, has great flavours and is very fresh. I have eaten here five times and have not yet been disappointed. They seem to do a great deal of take away versus dining in.  I have never had a challenge getting seated and enjoy the quiet atmosphere.

Every dish tried has been very nice. Great prices and large quantities.
author: Ian P.
Brian J.

description: Decent food, but nothing special, and the prices are high for what you get. Chicken salad, for example, is now $10. The much better chicken salad at R & G Lounge is $7.
author: John N.

description:
Yum yum!! An awesome restaurant that delivers fast and delicious food every time. 

Super affordable for huge portions. I like their fish, chow mein, beef and broc, and fried rice.
author: Dee N.

description:
At first I was skeptical reading the reviews from yelp because it was coming from a majority of white people but I decided to give it a try because it has good reviews. When I came in, there were only white people. Sorry, not being racist or anything, but it's a known fact that a restaurant is good when it's crowded with its own kind of people.

We got the kung pao chicken, the dish where you get 2 kinds of prawns (the walnut and the other kind), and basil beef if i'm not mistaken. Everything was good and very tasty like how a hunan dishes are supposed to be.

I'm giving a 4 star because the girl didn't hear that we ordered a lunch menu, she brought out the dinner dish. Will be coming back again if we're around the area.
author: Inez J.

description:
Another great gwu meal. 
I'm not a vegetarian but I am cutting back on meat in my diet so this was a great addition to my many fall back Chinese places in the City. 

Some of the stand out dishes for me were: 
potstickers- damn those things were the size of a baby's fist
the eggplant - it was very flavorful with an amazing garlic sauce on top
the veg orange chicken- if I didn't know I could have sworn that was chicken
salt & pepper tufo - nice and crispy, I would have liked a little more pepper kick but it was still good
and the fried bananas - they're fried bananas come on now!

I didn't really care for the spinach & tofu soup - had a dirty water taste and the baby bok choy with shitake mushrooms was covered in glistening msg - no thank you. 

Our waitress seemed a little overwhelmed with the large group and didn't bring out standards like water, chopsticks and had a hard time keeping up with us. They weren't packed inside but there was steady flow of take-out going on. 

Otherwise as a meat eater I was pleasantly surprised and there was enough food to take some home (a gwu first!).
author: Jade W.

description:
Living in the neighborhood (6 blocks away), Yum Yum Hunan has become my regular for cheap, reliable Chinese takeout. Portions are large, prices are reasonable, speed is amazing, and consistency has been very solid. I've experimented with a few of the others but always come back to Yum Yum.

Personal favorites: five spice chicken, Hong Kong style crispy noodles with barbecue pork, and string beans with tofu.
author: Mike D.

description: Ordered Spicy Eggplant, Walnut Prawns and Chow Fun, all very good ! Large portions, fresh and non-greasy. Ordered delivery and food came in less than 30 mins.
author: Mitzy P.

description:
Delivery was quick and the price was right, but I have to admit that I had some pretty significant concerns over what I received.  The hot and sour and dumpling sauces were very high on vinegar, which wasn't the flavor I was expecting--I'm certainly up for different spicing and would have forgiven them this because the flavors were still good, just different (warranting 3 1/2 or 4 stars).  

What I can't forgive as easily was the total lack of rice with a sauce-based dish, the undercooked dumplings that tasted like dough, and the complete lack of chopsticks, soup spoon, or any other utensils.  If I weren't in a hotel with a kitchenette in the room--which was pure chance and not the norm when I stay in San Francisco--I would have been forced to slurp everything out of the dishes like a cat.  

Not quite what I expected for a place with high ratings from other customers.
author: Jennifer D K.

description:
Had this delivered today and I thought it was great!  They have a good variety of menu items and have some good lunch deals.  I got green onion pancakes, a small container of hot and sour soup, sweet and sour pork with rice, and two cans of 7-Up for around $17.

I was in need of some food to help out my hangover after a day of drinking at SantaCon yesterday, and this definitely did the trick.  Will be ordering from here again.
author: Annette E.

description:
Yum Yum is well...Yum Yum.


We headed here after a show at The Fillmore based on reviews on Yelp.

Very fresh and non greasy. The restaurant was empty but the phone was ringing of the hook and the delivery guys were in and out like crazy. I enjoyed hearing the old man answer the phone, "Hello, Yum Yum".

Everything was wonderful and fresh. When I walked by to use the bathroom I saw them cutting up a ton of fresh zucchini and carrots and onions. Nothing frozen. All super fresh vegetables.

We had the veggie egg rolls, sweet and sour pork, broccoli beef, grilled prawns and veggies, pork fried rice, and then we got fried wonton skins and wonton soup for our kids. 

So glad we stumbled upon this gem of a Chinese restaurant. Plus we got to end the night with a tour of Pac Heights with it's beautiful homes all decorated for Christmas.
author: Alexis M.

description:
Until this past Friday, in my almost 15 years here I had never found a Chinese delivery place that I would try again. So, basically, all this time I've been ordering once from here, once from there, etc. If only Hunan Homes delivered...that would have solved my problem a long time ago.

But, recently, my BFF started raving about Yum Yum Hunan. I checked out my fellow Yelpers' reviews and Friday evening I placed an order for:

Orange beef
Walnut prawns
Cream cheese crab wontons
Rice for two (to fool the delivery guy into thinking that all this food wasn't just for ME, which, of course, it was)

Surprise, surprise! When you order two entrees, you get a free FULL-SIZED order of fried rice or chow mein. Nice! Barbecued pork chow mein for me, please.

The food arrived, nice and hot, in about 30 minutes. The wontons blew me away...they were simply amazing. Cream cheese, scallions and real crab enveloped in a crispy fried wonton skin.

The chow mein was simple and satisfying.

The orange beef wasn't as good as Hunan Homes', but I liked that the breading wasn't too thick and that the chiles were ground up and distributed throughout the dish rather than thrown in whole.

The walnut prawns, again, weren't as good as Hunan Homes', but I would order them again. They give you a baker's dozen, by the way.

I expected the prawns to come on the usual bed of shredded lettuce, but the beef was served that way as well, which I don't care for because it reheats horribly. Next time I'll ask them to leave out the lettuce on everything so that I don't have to pick it off.

So, all told, for about $30 including tip, I got almost 5 meals. Yum Yum, indeed, and economical! Friendly service too.

Yum Yum is going on the speed-dial for sure!

P.S. I swear I didn't eat all 5 of those meals in one night.
author: Valeria R.

description:
This place has -surprisingly- flavorful Dim Sum (well, not real "dim sum" per se, but the popular dumpling styles from dim sum). The Pork Siu Mai and Ha Gao (shrimp dumplings) were absolutely delicious and reminiscent of my times eating in Roland Heights, Diamond Bar, and Westminster in southern California.

Got the combination fried rice here one night and it wasn't salty or sweet enough. They could have stood to use more soy sauce in the cooking or (since I'm Vietnamese) fish sauce. In general, it needed -just- a little more salt.

Definitely good, and extremely cheap. Oh, and they do delivery for free, so that's a bonus. Would definitely recommend for a casual lunch!
author: Skippy T.

description: Probably the worst Chinese food ever! CrAb rangoons were burned.  General Tsao was mushy and just plain nasty. The chow fun was nothing like the picture on site. DO NOT ever order from here!!
author: Kensy R.

description:
Yum Yum Hunan was anything but yummy...

This place is getting 3 stars because it was just OK. Not impressive but it got the job done.

I ordered delivery on a Friday and we got the food relatively quickly.(Plus)

We ordered hot and sour soup(BLAND, not spicy even though that was how we ordered 

Veggie Chow Mein(bland)

Kung Pao Chicken(can you guess where i'm going with this...BLAND!)

How this is possible is beyond me. Chinese Food SHOULD have flavor but alas, no.

They may delivery, but this place definitely won't deliver on the flavor
author: Whitney S.

description:
I came here twice. The first time, the food was pretty bland. I got the spare ribs, chicken wings, and mongolian beef.  While the food was edible, it wasn't very spectacular. 

The second time, I ordered the kung pao chicken fried rice and honey walnut shrimp.  This time, the food was surprisingly tasty. 

I suggest going around lunch time to get the lunch special.  Otherwise, the dinner prices can add up especially if you order a rice dish and a meat dish and a vegetable dish.
author: Le T.

description:
I almost feel like an a-hole giving this place two stars, especially since I actually thought the food was good and I wouldn't hesitate to get take-out/delivery from here in the future. However, that last forty minutes or so (which I'll get to) I was here definitely rubbed me the wrong way, and as a result I certainly won't dine in at Yum Yum again. 

Like I said, the food at this place is good. I came here for dinner with two other people on a Sunday & the place was pretty empty. We started with the combination platter which included veggie egg rolls, pork pot stickers, crab rag-goon, and fried shrimp (two pieces of each). Everything was good, but a little greasy. For the main course I got the sizzling basil beef, which was very good (my dining companions had general Tsao's chicken & meatless kung pao, which I didn't taste). 

The service was a little spotty, but nothing major to complain about (well, for now...keep reading the review though) & the prices were fine. I don't live too far from this place and they're always leaving delivery menus on my door. I noticed when I was eating here a big chunk of there business seems to be delivery/take-out. 

Sooo...here's where we had an issue: 

When our bill came one of our dining companion's ordered a bowl of won-ton soup to-go, to take to her boyfriend. Now the three of us were in a chipper mood, not necessarily in any kind of hurry, and enjoying playing catch-up, but after twenty minutes with no soup we figured something was up. My friend who ordered the soup got up and said something to our waitress. She then heard the waitress arguing with a chef, turn to my friend and said it will just be a couple more minutes (remember we're talking SOUP here...I think from the time we sat down looked over our menu, ordered, ate our appetizer, and then had main courses brought to our table was only about 20-25 min.) 

Over about ANOTHER twenty minute period of time, our waitress came by our table a couple of times to say our order will be right up and that they were very busy, pointing to the number of delivery orders that were being loaded into a car outside. 

Finally, a woman came into the restaurant holding a bag with a bowl of soup in it and we overheard her saying that this wasn't her order. We just laughed and figured she probably got our order. Sure enough, the waitress brought the soup right over to us and said our order was ready (I don't think she even realized that we witnessed the woman returning the soup). 

We could have made a fuss, but we just wanted to get out of there at this point. The girl who ordered the soup dropped me and our other friend off at home, and ten minutes later we get a phone call form her saying they had given her the wrong order (the gave her hot and sour soup instead of won-ton).  

I hate to give negative reviews, especially when I actually LIKED the food here and would consider doing delivery from this place (although the mixed up order even makes me skeptical of that), but the combination of a 40+ minute wait for the soup, getting the wrong order, and just giving us an order to-go that someone else had returned is just too much to overlook...
author: George A.

description:
OMG I miss really good Chinese food.  I can't seem to find anything good in San Diego!

So went home for the weekend and wanted to stay in and order food.  Had a pile of take out menus and finally decided on Chinese... then narrowed it down to Yum Yum Hunan.  I'm so happy with my choice!!

I ordered Pork Chow Fun and it was so good!!! Barbecued pork was amazingggg, but it was SLIGHTLY dry.  But it was still SOOO goodddd.  Ahhh. Not greasy at all!! =DD

The mongolian beef there is spicy for me, but it was still very good.  Usually my boyfriend picks out all of the meat and leaves all the veggies, but he actually started EATING the veggies cause of the sauce! It was amazing.  Then we had the brilliant idea of mixing the sauce with my chow fun to give it a little bit more flavor and I was so happy!!! Yummmmm.  Now I just need to find the suitable replacement in San DIego.... SO hard to find one that's reasonable in price and wonderful in taste =(.

The only thing that sucked was that it took like an hour to get it delivered, but I'm not sure what standard delivery time, so that was the only downside.

But it was SO worth the wait. I want more!!!
author: Bella C.

description:
This place is excellent for Chinese food.  One of my close friends has stated that she "would like to be buried here"

Even as a meat eater, the meatless chicken options are simply outstanding. I always get the hot and sour soup.  You will come back for more. 

The service is also very fast and as friendly as can be.
author: Patrick K.

description:
They should consider changing their name to So So Hunan.

The fried rice is more moist than average.  

String bean chicken shouldn't have sliced bell peppers in it... just my two cents.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Not bad Chinese food.  We always get 3 entrees because then you get either chow mein or fried rice for free!  We usually get it delivered and they are pretty quick about it.

THE FOOD

-spicy, salty, fried pork = good (MSG galore tho!)
-walnut prawns = good
-garlic eggplant = our favorite!
-pork chow mein = meh
-chicken fried rice = okay
-mongolian beef = good
-tofu mushrooms = love the black mushroom but the tofu tasted sour.  Lots of green peas and water chestnuts
author: Christy A.

description:
Does the fact that I have gone here once a week for the last few weeks say anything?

I LOVE their honey walnut prawns. SO delicious and they give you at least a dozen which is more than I can say for some *ahem* places where they charge you more and give you 5 prawns thinking they are doing you a favor.

I have had their Mongolian Beef (spicy!) and their Garlic Pork (holy deliciousness batman!) and their Hot and Sour Soup (ok, needs more sour).

But this place is clean, service is friendly and it is cheap.

I haven't done their delivery (I live a few blocks away but I have pizza delivered from 3 blocks away so go ahead judge me) but I hear it is quick and friendly from my neighbors.

Happy to find a local place to fulfill my Chinese food cravings!
author: Kathy K.

description: I ordered online, picked up my food, and when I arrived... SURPRISE! I ordered beef, it was absolutely not beef, with 2 sides of rice -I only got 1-. The food was correct, but the experience was bad for my 1st order there...
author: Tiffanie G.

description: Awesome dim sum / chinese food delivery. Don't miss the sesame chicken, orange chicken, crab rangoons or pork fried rice. Quick, cheap and easy - order from Yum Yum Hunan.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Yum Yum was my go-to spot when I lived a couple of blocks away from their old Mission location.  Now we've both moved.  This is YY's new location but they brought their delicious food with them.  As always, generous portions on the rice dishes and delicious war won ton soup.  A good selection of spicy dishes for those who like hot food.  The service is always quick and prompt and the location is clean and freshly painted.  
Parking is tough on nearby streets
author: Pablo R.

description: Got an order from Grub Hub. The food was only ok. The pork fried rice was very good however the Orange Chicken and the Sesame Chicken were soggy/inedible. The pork buns were ok.
author: Summer M.

description: One of the best hunan places in the city and I have tried a lot. Their orange chicken in particular is so bomb!
author: Naveen S.

description:
7:30 pm: Goes to Molly Stone's and buys 2 lbs USDA Choice Rib Eye Steak(s) , one big Cauliflower and one big Broccoli. [Gotta eat natural, follow yo' primal diet].  Gotta get me the 2006 Pino Noir for only $12.56. [Gotta drink something which has Reservetrol for brain health]

8:30 pm: Starts drinking Pinot Noir and cleaning the kitchen

9:00 pm: Pinot Noir kicks in, this is a good idea on an empty stomach. Hmm, fuck the steak and broccoli, could be/gotta be doing so many other things like watching some trash on Satellite TV.

9:20 pm: Calls Pizza Orgasmica Fillmore to order a large thin crust pepperoni + black olives goodness. "Hi, this is Orgasmica Fillmore... hold on a 'sec'..." [Waits 7 minutes to periodic beeping] . 

9:27 pm: "Hi, this is *new voice*, how can I help you?"... "Can I get a large thin crust... "... "Our wait times are 1.5 to 2 hrs right now, is that okay"... "You want me turn into a cannibal?"

9:28 pm: Finds the menu for Yum Yum, call. "Are you still delivering?" ... "Yes, what would you like?" Order: Combination Platter + Seafood Chow Fun. Special Instructions: Put that hot stuff in it. "Its cash"

9:31 pm: Enters the URL for Yelp.com, to share this story with anonymous Yelpers. Starts writing, sips Pinot Noir on the side.

9:46 pm: God's here. Interrupts writing to meet God downstairs. Finds a Chinese delivery boy. Hands over a fat tip.

9:47 pm: Resumes.

9:52 pm: Now, heaven.
author: D K.

description: The best Chinese food. I drive out to the city at least once a week to satisfy my cravings for some tasty Chinese food. One can never go wrong with the orange chicken. Once here one must try their spring rolls. The staff is very friendly.  I'm a regular here so they know exactly how I like my food. The best place around for good Chinese Food. Must try it !!!
author: Jazmine A.

description:
Omg, very poor service...can you imagine this...you walk in to order, are looking at the menu, they bring you a small sweet n sour soup and hot tea...you start having the soup, and place your order, that you wanted it packed to go...and **** they pick up your soup and tea from under your nose !!!

As if that is not enough, if you order from the lunch menu, your hunan chicken or whatever, you open your lunch at home...and again you feel screwed...the plate is all rice, with very little of the main course...you chose the option of fried rice for 50c extra, and you find you have only white rice, and that is 80% of your meal...you ask for the bill, you get a scribble in frickin Chinese, nothing is itemized, just a grand total...which is also way more than you expected...

The restaurant is usually empty, and now I can see why...NEVER AGAIN !!!
author: Raj D.

description:
I really love Divisadero; the atmosphere, the stores, the people... everything about it and around it reads "anti-big money, mom and pop neighborhood." I'm not hinting that there's an air of class about this neighborhood, but it is definitely more unique and delightful than most, thus you can imagine my surprise when I found out there was a Chinese restaurant on this block.

When you think of Chinese restaurants in America you usually think of places that serve up a quick fix of left-over-for-the-next-meal-bound pan-asian cuisine, but Yum Yum Hunan (despite their hilariously cheesy sounding name,) like the street and neighborhood in which it's situated, is more unique and delightful than most.

Now from past experience, there are only two types of Chinese restaurants that I usually find in semi-gentrified areas: those that are sort of shabby looking inside, serve horribly americanized chinese food for bargain prices; and those that are really well-decorated inside, serve horribly americanized "fusion" chinese food for ridiculous prices. Well guess what? YYH is neither of these.

My roommate and I came here for a late dinner and looking at the interior from the outside we immediately thought this place was the latter of the aforementioned "chinese restaurant stereotypes," but since we were pretty hungry we decided to sit down anyway. We were misinformed, probably due to lack of research, and thought that ordering any two entrees would entitle us to free fried rice or chow mein--this option is apparently only available when you order delivery/take out.

After about five minutes of scanning the menu we ordered General Tsao's Chicken and Spicy Garlic Eggplant. The General Tsao's Chicken was pretty standard, despite the fact that the chicken wasn't as spicy we'd hoped it'd be despite asking the waitress to make it extra spicy. But the real surprise/treat of the night was the Spicy Garlic Eggplant; usually when you order this dish at a Chinese restaurant it's usually bland and you don't really taste "garlic" or "spicy," but YYH's was full of flavor and the best part: their spicy garlic eggplant comes with shrimp, calamari and other assorted SEAFOOD! The best I've ever gotten with my spicy garlic eggplant in the past was maybe some shredded pork, but YYH serves theirs with a delicious mix of assorted seafood, and they even top it off with some basil for an extra depth of flavor.

Our bill for two entrees and rice came out to about 21 dollars which I thought was very sensibly priced for the amount/quality of food we were given--next time I will definitely order by phone and get my chow mein.
author: Scott S.

description:
I don't know what it is about me and writing reviews of restaurants with "Yum Yum" in their names, but hey...

So it is Chinese New Year, and I didn't even have that cross my mind prior to putting in my order at YYH. I called them up, and ordered the garlic pork, beef Hong Kong style noodles, steamed rice and some hot and sour soup. Quoted a 45 minute delivery time, and a price around $20 bucks. So far so good.

The food was here in about 30 minutes, +1. The portions were ridonculoid huge, +1. The dishes - particularly the garlic pork, were chock full of fresh veggies, while still having plentiful amounts of meat,  +1. And the last +1 goes to the taste and overall quality. The Hong Kong noodles were slightly crispy, with a bit of sauce getting them to just the right consistency. Everything tasted great, and the quantities were large enough to stock up the fridge for some lunch time action tomorrow. 

Yum Yum Hunan is my new go-to for delivery in the Western Addition. Would recommend - and the delivery minimums / credit card minimums are really reasonable - $15 and $10, respectively.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
They changed their deal. I'm so sad. Now you have to buy 3 entrees to get the free chow mein or fried rice...sighhhh. 

Still...$34 for 4 entrees isn't bad:
+ General Tsao Chicken - Decent. Not at all spicy though.
+ Mango Broccoli Prawn - My favorite. Going to order it every time.
+ Mu Shu Pork - Solid.
+ Chicken Fried Rice - Free!

Yum Yum, I may be a bit put off by your policy change, but your delivery is still speedy and you still taste delicious, so I will forgive and forget.
author: Talia G.

description:
I have not had terrific Chinese food in a long time, and never via home delivery, alas I live on the other coast... So imagine my surprise when we ordered from Yum Yum and our food arrived in 20 minutes.

What a treat!  Yum Yum's hot and sour soup was truly sour and spicy.  Everything arrived steaming.  I was impressed with their moo shoo pork, but sorry that the wrappers for it did not hold up when steamed the next day. For the price, and the swift delivery service, I can't remember any local meals arriving as tasty and hot as these dishes did.
author: Lynn S.

description:
My favorite go-to delivery/take-out Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. Delivery is free and pretty fast. The food satisfies every time. They do the standard dishes well. The best part about ordering from Yum Yum is when you call and they answer - "HELLO!! YUM YUM!!!"

Our favorites: Beef and broccoli, sweet and sour pork
Avoid: Hot and sour soup
Must do: Order 3 (used to be 2) entrees and get a free chow main or fried rice. Only available for delivery orders
author: Brian L.

description:
I feel like for the amount of times I order from these guys, I should at least give them another rating. 

It's a bit on the higher priced side, but they 

-Deliver fast and HOTTER THAN HELL
-Are polite (and I'll admit, the fact that they speak excellent English is a plus). 
-Have unique items on their menu

Try the walnut prawn! It's the most decadent thing in the world.
author: Jay C.

description:
I have to say I really like the food here a lot, but after they blew my order for the third time, I have to say i'll be saying farewell to yum yum. No one should have to wait for more than an hour and a half for delivery and certainly not twice and on the last order they didn't even deliver it! Such a shame as I really like there pot stickers! Fool me once, maybe twice, but not three times! Maybe I'll try picking it up, when the sour taste  
leaves my mouth.
author: campbell b.

description: I got food poisoning from their chicken. Some of the pieces were extremely hard and dried out, like the frier had never been cleaned out. Beware.
author: Dani A. C.

description:
This place is the shit (in the best way possible, and considering what it offers) I just moved to the area, and needed a sketchy "hole in the wall" place. Let me be clear this place was not "seedy" or "disgusting" it was clean...the décor is dated, and the service is meh. (Actually on second thought....not horrible but not 5 star dinning either) 

Given how many orders I saw picked up/ carried out, I would assume that is the money maker. Portions however were perfect, just enough to take home for an encore presentation. No cameo appearances here folks, unless you eat like a bear preparing for hibernation. (Which if that is the case .....Fine by me) Keeping it short: an appetizer and three dishes (if you count rice?) came to $40 with generous tip. 

Two people went in search for Chinese.... Two people left fulfilled and then some! I will likely be back most likely for carry out, however if my landlord continues to pry into my life under the guise of friendship this may become a retreat until dusk (thankfully youth isn't on her side and she has an early bed time.... But I digress)
author: Travis S.

description:
OVERALL: 3.4

FOOD: 3
SERVICE: 3.5
AMBIANCE: 3
VALUE: 4
Tataki, why must people like you so much, and why don't you take reservations, forcing nice hungry (and soon to be sad) people to settle for cheap mediocre Chinese down the street? :(

*sigh*
Yum yum in my tum tum...?  Please?...umm, maybe not so much.  Definitely americanized, hot, cheap, and unexciting.  But great for groups, since the entire place was empty at 8pm Friday (prob b/c everyone is eating or waiting @Tataki--BASTARDS).  Remarkably greasy, even by cheap americanized standards...but i guess it gets the job done, right?

Ugh, now i have that effing Bumblebee Tuna jingle in my head.  Damn you, Tataki.
author: Amy K.

description:
When I first called to order I thought, wow he didn't ask me for my name, my phone number or how to get in the building?! Anyway, delivery came pretty quick, my phone says I called around 1:43, they called me at 2:03.. not bad. apparently they found my number on the caller ID. and when I came outside to pay the guy was already outside of my part of the building, I wondered how he was able to get in... weird!!
I ordered chicken chowmein, and chicken fried rice.. shared with my toddler and I. like all kids, he loves the noodles!! anything pasta, he'll eat, and ask for more..
and for me I'll give the chowmein a 6.5 out of 10.. it's good. the rice, the same. it's edible. not the best out there, but good.. regular steamed rice, fried with soy sauce from what I can see.. chicken, eggs, peas, carrots, and onion..
so overal, I'd say a 6/10 experience with them.. I'm sure If I were drunk it'd be the best ever... lol.
but I like it, big noodles.. and big chunks of chicken in the rice :)
we'll probably order from here again.
and my total, was $15.50.

and now full, finished eating. and theres still enough for at least 2 or 3 people!!! I told them medium, but I doubt it, the sizes look like there's one size only.. I can't eat anymore.. so if you order, make sure to be specific, and say Over Rice, make it  as one. because they will send you TWO boxes, one chowmein, and once fried rice. we have left overs for tomorrows lunch and dinner! lol.
author: Mariana O.

description:
This place used to be an absolute favorite of mine, but in the past six months the service has become terrible.  For a long time I ordered the exact same dish, but recently changed it up and ordered something different.  Instead they brought me my old order, and when I called to tell them they told me "it is not possible that you could have ordered something different".  

They also don't serve rice with their entree dishes anymore which seems unreasonable.
author: Caroline K.

description: This is definitely my go-to Chinese delivery place, I love the orange chicken and the pork potstickers!
author: Meera A.

description: A lot of people phone in won ton soup, and that is not the case here! Super fresh, great flavor, and they arrived within 30 minutes both times I've ordered. Only $15 delivery minimum. Wor won ton soup and Mongolian beef are great as well.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Can someone say food poisoning?? Ouch, worst experience ever here.
After eating our way through central american villages, middle east street carts and everywhere in between, my teen daughter got her FIRST and HORRIBLE case of food poisoning after eating here. She had an egg dish, egg foo young I think. I had the salmon, which I told them not to make greasy, and though many Chinese restaurants comply, this was greassssssyyy. And so was my daughter's egg dish, absolutely saturated, but obviously that was overshadowed by how SICK she got after eating it. It was bad, real bad. Who cares about how cheap a place is if it doesn't stay in you? No thanks, I'll stick to my other Chinese hole in the walls where the food stays in my (and her) body without running out both ends.
author: Faina G.

description: I really like this place.  I've ordered two days in a row and the food was hot, tasty and on time.
author: Mary Ann J.

description:
Finally a Chinese food place that delivers and came recommended. I shall pass along the message. 

I tried: Chinese Mango Chicken (YUMMERS!)
            Chicken Chow Mein (Good.)
author: Kristy F.

description:
UGH! Been craving this since the last time I've had it which was last week. The bf and I decided to order  in since we need to study. Sadly when I called, the guy on the phone was SOOOOO RUDE! He was yelling at me and seem so angry at me. Even though I was just making a simple order and had a few misunderstanding about the free chow mein or whatever, he was yelling at me as if I was stupid. He hung up on me and didn't even tell me how long it would take for them to come. 

Usually whenever servers, waiters, ect at the restaurants are rude, the place won't get more than a 2 star from me, but since the food is so good, I guess I can give it 3 stars.
author: Cindy L.

description: Experience has always taught me to be wary of any restaurant with Yum or Yummy in the name.  Most of the time, it will be a case of false advertising.  Well, Yum Yum Hunan pretty much confirms my theory, as the food I had was just passable.  I ordered Singapore Rice Noodle with chicken and the flavor was just so-so, though the portion was pretty big.  I ate about a third of it and finished the rest for dinner.  The service provided was adequate and the food came out fast.  I just might give Yum Yum another chance and try one of their other dishes.  Will update my review if I do.
author: Danielle O.

description: Delivery was super fast. The food ws delivered hot and everything was fresh and tasted great. Will definetly order from them again.
author: Patricia S.

description: Yelp let me down on this one.  Was expecting better.  Chicken wings were not very good.  Order 2 rices and only received one.  General Tsao's chicken was not very spicy or as flavorful as most.  Delivery was fast.
author: Greg B.

description:
Yum Yum Hunan has become our go-to for Chinese Delivery. Although I hate to think of the calories and grams of fat consumed, my belly was quite satisfied both before and after NYE celebrations. (I've cursed myself for being such a fattie since, but oh my god- did it safe my life!)

We've never eaten at the restaurant itself but they're always timely and friendly when we call. (Which has only been twice, mind you.) 

We ordered:

Steamed Pot Stickers (Always better pan-fried, but this is the healthier option. Probably wouldn't order these again.)
Beef Broccoli (Yummy in my tummy!)
Kung Pao Prawns (Wasn't what I was expecting, but I do love my prawns.)
Sauteed String Beans (Good- but Betelnut's are still the best!)
Chicken Chow Mein (This was better than most Chow Mein I've had at comparable restaurants.)

I'm still searching for my Chinese Food Mecca in San Francisco....but this place shall do for now!
author: Annalise F.

description: Yay for being open late! Ordered the green beans, orange chicken, and mongolian? beef. Got white rice and fried rice. Could not help but devour the green beans and fried rice. The beef was good. Orange chicken was too much on the sweet side. However, I'd have to say the actual quality of the food was 5 star. Very fair quality of food to price ratio.
author: Mary P.

description:
Pretty awesome veggie food here!
Came here for a grubwithus, which is a really awesome group dining concept which you should definitely check out!!
Ate several kinds of tofu (some of them were called fake chicken, but were basically some type of soy variant) with rice, potstickers and eggrolls.. yum!!
The restaurant was quite empty other than our pretty animated and noisy group.. maybe we scared people off :D
Need to return here the next time I feel an insatiable urge to eat an gargantuan amount of reasonably good chinese food!!!
author: Aditya M.

description: The food is good here. When you eat in the restaurant, the portions are good, but take out portions are too small, and the prices have gone up. Good way to lose customers. Hope they are reading this, because to succeed in the biz, you must have good food, fair prices, and good portions. This will keep the customers coming back. If not, don't be surprised when your customers don't return.
author: Chester L.

description:
My go to Chinese place to order delivery from.

Seriously, the general's chicken and the five flavor chicken here are off the hook. It's not too expensive, the delivery is fast, and the food is good for what you want.

The reason it only has 4 stars is that the chicken isn't typically spicy enough for my taste. Also, I'm not a big fan of the eat-in experience here-- I don't really like the environment and it's always completely empty. The four star rating is for the delivery experience and the food.

Still going to remain my go to delivery place though! Yum.
author: Erica W.

description: I sometimes get take out orders from this place for lunch because it's close to work.  In terms of food quality, it's really not great, a bit too greasy for me... but the portion is good and the prices are reasonable.  They are very quick and efficient so it's a good option when you want fast Chinese food with good portions.
author: Sarah W.

description: My fave Chinese food in the Bay Area. I'm no expert but I love their sesame chicken. It's totally yum yum. How appropriate. Haha the service is mediocre but the food makes up for it!
author: Sherita P.

description:
The food is not as greasy as other Chinese places and still tastes really good.

I'd recommend the Magnolian beef with pot stickers. Total with tax + tip for delivery is around 18/19.
author: Abhi M.

description: This place was delicious clean and good service for a Chinese restaurant. They were easy to understand, easy to read menu and the food was fresh hot and came out quick. I am happy to have found it.
author: Alyssa J.

description: I'm a huuuuge sucker for a solid mu shu, and Yum Yum's got my back every time I ask.  I'm usually a dine-in patron, cuz this place is so far from my house.  Like many chinese restaurants that thrive on their delivery orders, the dine-in experience is a little weird ambiance-wise, but the grub's dependably delicious.
author: Rachel S.

description:
My great aunt loves this place because its close to our apartment and because they deliver. Delivery is super fast and the food is still hot. We usually order Mongolian beef and pork fried rice and broccoli a la carte (special request) I've gotten scallops. before. All in all the food is pretty tasty. 

Only complaint: One night, my aunt and I decided to place our order for pick up since they were 15 mins away from closing. My great aunt walked in ahead of me and told them how much she loved their food and how she's been coming for years and they completely ignored her comment and asked how they could help me since I walked in a little after her. I waited a minute to see if he would comment back to her but he didn't he just asked how he could help me. I told him I had an order for pick-up and as he turns to get it, my aunt asked for a cup of water (she was pretty winded by the walk there) and he glances at her then completely ignores her again. It wasn't until I asked again for her that he got the water for her... From the sink, at that! I guess the guy figured maybe my aunt wasn't spending any money, just coming in to make a comment but either way it was extremely rude. I would've considered giving another star but after that experience I just couldn't, plus the food is just OK anyway. What makes it even worse is I don't think My great aunt even noticed how rude they really were to her. Smh
author: Nia N.

description: Pretty bummed I have to do this because we've been ordering from Yum Yum regularly now (2-3 times a week) with a minimum of $40 an order. Tonight, we placed an order at 9:10pm, the restaurant closes at 10pm. We received the order confirmation, meaning they got it. We were quoted an arrival time 10:02pm. Well, 10:35 rolls around and I try calling the restaurant to see where our order is, but they're closed. So, I call Grubhub and they contact the owner who gives them the driver's #. They then call the driver, but he won't answer. I absolutely hope nothing bad happened to him on his way, but if that's the case, I would gladly retract this review. If he however just decided to head home or wherever instead of making his final delivery, then they've lost a loyal customer. It's now 11:10pm, no food, and we just ordered pizza instead.
author: Shawn K.

description: Great reliable neighborhood take out. A fairly standard chinese food place, but they are always super fast at delivery and very friendly.  The hot and sour soup is particularly good.
author: Ian B.

description: This is our new "go to" takeout place; it's within walking distance so we usually pick up but they also deliver to our area. Everything we've tried so far has been delicious, not to sweet or greasy as I have found a lot of Chinese food in the US. The dumplings are really nice and seem to be made on site, the green beans are a great side and *huge* easily serves 4. Shout out to the Szechuan Beef as my favourite so far. The spices aren't particularly hot though, so if you like it spicy ask for extra hot.
author: Amaya B.

description:
Here is where you can find their menu: http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurantdetails?restaurantid=7632

Last night we ordered dinner from here; wow! The phone service is the best that I have ever called when ordering delivery of any kind of food, he answered my questions nicely and didn't put me on hold or rush me. I even had a short conversation with him about how they recently moved from Valencia St. It was so obvious he had a smile in his voice. Because I have never been there before he said he will put a menu in my bag. Their new divisadero location was the home to my old Chinese delivery place. 

After I ordered our dinner he asked if I wanted free fried rice because we ordered 2 entrees. I was so surprised because usually when you are able to get something free you have to ask them for it by saying you have a coupon or tell them you see it on the menu. 

I placed my order at 6:48pm and it arrived at 7:00pm. Can you believe that, 12 minutes! I am not even lying because I knew that I would be giving them a yelp review while I was talking on the phone with him because he was so nice. I wanted my review to have all the information that mattered so I wrote down the times. Mind you, I live 7 blocks from this place so I can't guarantee you that you will be getting your order that fast. It could have also been that their delivery guy was there at the exact time my food was ready. However, I will say that the Chinese restaurant that used to be at this location never delivered my food this fast. 

Even though I am one fourth Chinese, my pallet for Chinese delivery food is pretty poor; so I have to say that the food quality is as good as any Chinese delivery I have ever had; possibly better because their Mongolian beef actually has lots of beef, unlike some places I have ordered from where there is more onion than anything else.
