This will now be the place where I buy my Chinese delivery from now on.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
We used to order from Ben Wa just down the street.  However, the declining quality of the meat and taste of the food has pushed us to Yum Yum.
I have to say their Mongolian beef is pretty good, as well as their combination fried rice, potstickers and green beans.  Extra stars for being one of the only Chinese restaurants I've ordered from that has Har Gow (shrimp dumplings) available all day!
Delivery is faster than almost anywhere (except Amici's of course), so it's a great option for a last-minute dinner.
author: Nancy O.

description: This place has quickly become my go to for chinese delivery.  Even when ordered through Grub Hub it arrives SO FAST! Fastest delivery I have experienced.  They also have tons of fake chicken options which is awesome!
author: Elyssa D.

description: hard to find good chinese in my hood. this place is the best of our delivery options. yum yum is right!
author: Tatum T.

description:
This place is clean, fast, cheap, and delicious! All things I would want at my local Chinese restaurant. 

For about $20 bucks you can get two entrees + a free Chow Mein (but make sure you ask the guy for it, they wont offer you the deal if you don't mention it). The amount of food usually lasts me about 3-4 meals .. which in my mind means this is an awesome deal. 

The basic Amercanized Chinese foods... general tso, orange chicken,  etc. all taste the way they should. But some of the less traditional dishes like the asian fried chicken are so addicting! 

Pick up and delivery are pretty speedy - but I usually go late at night when it's pretty dead.
author: Rona Y.

description:
Although I tottered between 4 and 5 stars, you should definitely go here.

It's all about who another reviewer described as 'Mr. Yum Yum'-- from his reassuringly melodic "HEllo yum YUM" answering the phone, to his (I'm sure meticulous) oversight of the kitchen, which ensures you get hot and fresh food as soon after you order as humanly possible. PLUS, his extreme organization and very fast walking to the door to meet the delivery boy are an entertaining bonus if you eat in. If you've had a drink or even just a long day it'll be enough to spice up your dining experience in the most wonderful way.

The other waitstaff are nice too, pleasant and courteous. If I eat in I try to order something fun; some of the dishes are served on a sizzling griddle to cook in front of you, etc. And if you eat at home there are special offers like free sides. It's all good!

The price is very fair for the quality dining experience (it is a restaurant with real tablecloths, personal and polite attention), accurate service, and good fresh and pretty healthy food.

I really couldn't ask for anything more, add me to the Mr. Yum Yum fan club!
author: Ashley L.

description:
Bad food and service.

They gave us a lot of fat on the chicken, it was more fat than chicken and when we showed it to them, instead of what we expected (for them to exchange it or give us a credit), they yelled at us. We couldn't believe it. 

We never went back.
author: Mariam M.

description: This place was great. My group of 8 strolled in at 7pm on a Sunday night and was seated right away. As others have noted, prices were reasonable (most entrees around $10) and portions were good to share. Mild is VERY mild, so I would definitely order at least medium next time. We had the garlic eggplant. It was great.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Great Chinese delivery for a couple reasons:
  - Tastes healthy. Not too much salt or msg.
  - Bigger portions than a lot of other places.
  - Lots of choices for vegetables.
author: Mike L.

description: The food was absolutely terrible. I ordered won ton soup and Szechuan string beans. Soup broth was tasteless. Pea pods were mush. The string beans were over cooked. They said 40 minutes for delivery. After an hour I called to see where the order was. No more Yum Yum for me.
author: Nel M.

description:
The food is delicious, the delivery is fast, and I can understand the person on the phone when he is taking my order. Once in a while I still try delivery from somewhere else, but I keep going back to Yum Yum. 
So far I haven't found a place that can match Yum Yum's proportions, which are very generous. I always have food for more than one meal. The prices are great. Also, if you purchase two entrees you get a FREE fried rice or chow mein. I have never been in the restaurant but I love the delivery.
author: Serene M.

description:
So I came here on a Sunday before church and was looking for a random place to eat.  Saw that this place had great ratings so I went in.

It was dead and I seated myself to a table. I seated myself to a table. Wait did I say I seated myself to a table twice, I'm sorry there must be a computer problem damn keyboard.

I ordered some Dim Sum and Duck with rice.

Low Down

Dim Sum....not so much. Had the shrimp dumplings and they started to be good then sadly it was really cold in the middle.  The Dumpling was not cooked thoroughly.  Thumbs down.

The Duck...delicious.  Boneless Duck pretty awesome.  I had better where the skin is nice and crispy.

Imma give this place another try but so far it was just OK.

I'll try delivery soon
author: Chris L.

description: I always order the mongolian beef with rice to go. Order arrives in 10 minutes or less. I'm not sure whats in the sause but Im addicted. A little disapointed that sometimes the fortune missing from the cookie !
author: Cup C.

description: Terrible, terrible quality. Kung pao chicken, specifically, is the worst I've ever had. Borderline spoiled food.
author: jameson s.

description:
Get - Any Lunch Special. I got the Sesame Chicken, and it came with hot and sour soup, an egg roll, fried rice, and a side salad. This was a big portioned meal for $7 with tax.

Avoid - No Complaints.

Service - Standard. Competent, but not very friendly. They take your order, bring your food, and fulfill your requests.

Space - Lots of light, nice and airy (unlike a lot of Chinese restaurants)

Would come back - If I am in the area for lunch and want Chinese food.
author: J C.

description: I wish I could give this place 3.5 stars...If I lived in the neighborhood I'd be ordering take-out from these folks weekly. Everything was fresh and well-prepared, flavorful without being too intense. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the dishes given the atmosphere of the dining room (a book by its cover, I seem to always forget). The pricing was also very reasonable and the service above average. I recommend the eggplant. But I judge all Hunan joints by their Kung-Pao, and Yum Yum's was a solid B+. I'd go back.
author: Vincent C.

description: I ordered delivery.  It was super fast and on time.  The portion sizes were great (american style).  The Mongolian Beef was tasty.  The Chicken Fried rice was decent as well (needed salt and pepper as per usual).  BUT the General Tsao's Chicken NOT GOOD, and NEEDS ALOT of improvement - it was deep fried until it was poofy, and then sogged down in a pile of thin watery sauce in the box (a puddle), and it was nearly flavorless.  Tell Chef Yum Yum to try PF Changs "Changs Chicken", or even Panda Express! Something a little more sticky, less water, and less deep friend - or change the deep fry recipe to include a sticky sauce mixture like bbq ribs.  I've had alot of General Chicken in my life and this was the worst, I'm not angry, just disappointed.  Please fix this Chef Yum Yum!
author: Jean P.

description:
My hubbie ordered here yesterday afternoon for delivery.  They told him the food would come in a half an hour.  It came in 20 minutes!  Impressive!  I gave the young teenager a good tip; he better remember us...LOL.
Anyways, I wasn't in the mood to cook and have been recovering from periodontal surgery.  Being on a liquid/soft diet sucks so I wanted so tofu at least and won ton soup.  We ordered brocolli beef; ma po tofu; a chicken dish w/water chestnuts, baby corn, snap/snow peas, mushrooms, and brocolli; & won ton soup.
Usually, if we order take out from a Chinese restaurant, we'd pay over $60.  We only paid $38.20 and the food was great - flavorful and cooked well!  Totally hit the spot with leftovers tonight.
author: Kekumukula N.

description:
Consistently good!  They always deliver food hot and a complete order.

My faves:  sesame chicken, garlic eggplant, chow fun veggie.

This place hits the spot!
author: Yelper H.

description:
Prompt delivery (usually faster than they say).  
Food... not EVERYthing is great, but nothing is bad, really.  The noodles never disappoint, and neither does the mongolian lamb.  
Service... well, I've never eaten IN the restaurant, so can't speak for the wait staff, but they waited 15 mins past the closing time for us to pick up an order once, so they've scored high in my book.
author: Vandana N.

description: i order a sweet and sour chicken . white rice and orange juice . it was delicious , the delivery was quite fast . Definitely my new chinese place! ,
author: Simon B.

description: Very good food and service.  Very resonable prices.  I feel you will like the restaurant.   They also have lunch specials.   Steve White
author: Steve W.

description:
Really good delivery options: the food comes fast and the portions are huge. I've tried most of their vegetarian options are they truly are delicious! Specifically, I recommend the Kung Fu Tofu, Garlic Eggplant, and Szechuan Broccoli. The (vegetarian) orange "chicken" is spectacular. Even my Mom who has a tendency to be a bit of a Chinese food snob thought the food was excellent. When she visits she is always happy to order from here. That's saying a lot.

Order your food, and then 20 minutes later or so the food will be at your doorstep, piping hot! Also, per other Yelp reviews, if you order two or more dishes, they'll give you a free chow mein for free. 

Love this place.
author: Rick P.

description: Really good Chinese food here. They don't use MSG for sure cause I didn't get any reaction after eating here. Worth coming back.
author: Hong Y.

description:
I was planning on getting bbq but after reading reviews of Da Pitt, I feared I was going to get food poisoning. So instead I got delivery from Yum Yum. 

Delivery was prompt, and we got everything we ordered.  The food tasted okay at the time.  Not very flavorful - pretty muted for chinese, but for the most part acceptable.  

Then the next day it hit me... food poisoning.  How ironic.  I've been confined to my bed for the past 3 days and only now have the energy to write something.  This comes from a guy who practically licked street carts in China.

I think I'm done with Chinese for a while.
author: Pat W.
Kelly B.

description: Edible; dim sum very doughy and the filling was incredibly thick with cartridge through out. Pot stickers were yummy but it's pretty hard to screw that up.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Stopped in for lunch on Sunday October 2nd, 2011 - around 4 PM to an empty restaurant. I ordered the orange chicken and hunan beef - and found both dishes to be ok at best. I found both dishes to be less than expected - especially when compared to other neighborhood spots.

The cream cheese wontons, another dish I ordered, were some of the best that I have eaten in town though.
author: Brian D.

description:
I was SO sad (like embarrassingly sad) when I found out that Yum Yum House was no longer on Valencia.  And what was so weird was that the phone number forwarded to the other restaurant around the corner.  

There was much speculation on what happened.  Did Yum Yum House move to the other restaurant?  Why did they change the name? On the hope that it was the case I ordered from there.  BIG disappointment.  *sigh* my beloved General Tso's Meatless Chicken was lost forever. 

But as of last night my hopes and happiness were restored.  Yum Yum House is alive!  They didn't go out of business.  They just moved (they lost the lease because someone bought out the building).  Anyway, they're now on Divisadero & Pine and the food is as good as it ever was!!!  The owner and all the chefs are the same.  The location is a bit nicer as well.  AND added bonus it's only 4 blocks from my house!  General Tso's Meatless Chicken and I are reunited again :)
author: Janice M.

description:
If you're looking for good Americanized chinese take-out, this place will not disappoint. They've got all the classics, and they give you a LOT of it. I don't expect places like this not to be filled with greasy goodness, but it was just a bit too oily for my [highly high brow] taste. 

Delivery was super fast (about 25 minutes to deliver to the inner richmond) and you get free chow mein or fried rice if you buy two entrees. Thanks for the advice, Yelp!
author: Ronald T.

description: The price is right, the portions are generous, the wait time for delivery is shorter than most places, but  none of that makes up for the fact that the food tastes as bland as it looks.
author: Angee R.

description:
Yum Yum Hunan is a name well deserved.  I have ordered delivery here twice now and both times have been pleasantly surprised.  I have ordered the kung pao tofu and chicken, mongolian beef, meatless chicken general tsao, hot and sour soup, and vegetable chow main.  Everything was yummy (with the exception of the hot sour soup, lacking in the flavor department)!  None of the dishes were greasy,  all the ingredients were fresh, especially the veggies, and the portions were generous.  My meat loving, i hate organic and vegan anything bf really liked the meatless chicken general tsao.  He couldn't tell it wasn't real chicken! 

Delivery was fast.  They pack their food in compostable containers(way to be green YYH). Yum Yum Hunan is my go to place now for Chinese delivery.
author: danielle l.

description: This place is amazing, I would suggest delivery though cause the restaurant itself is dead always.... but the food... OMG, GREAT!!!!! Always get the Gen Tsos spicy chicken and broccoli and its really good and good quality unlike other Chinese places with blubber like chicken!!! GO HERE!!!!!
author: Ben S.

description:
DINING IN- EXCELLENT service. the staff here are attentive and totally friendly. 

TAKE OUT- FAST DELIVERY and quality of food is just as good, like as if you were dining in.

QUAILITY- pretty "yummy" good portions and great prices..

I usually get the "HUNAN FISH" or the " WOR WON TON SOUP"
Prawns with scrambled eggs are pretty gooood here...and you get steamed bok choy on the side too.

Coworkers and I tend to order here for their good food and fast service.

One coworker raves about the chicken curry..and id have to agree that its pretty good.

The guy who takes the orders on the phone is super nice too!

"HELLO.....YUM YUM.."
author: Cali L.

description:
We are new to the Pac Hts neighborhood so I jumped on Yelp to figure out where to grab bomb Chinese food.  Yum Yum came highly recommended from the majority of Yelpers and STILL managed to exceed our expectations. The prices are surprisingly reasonable and the food is insanely flavorful and fresh.  Stand out menu items were the Crab Rangoon and Mongolian Beef.  Both did have an uncharacteristically peppery kick, but it actually enhanced the dishes without overwhelming them.  Follow that up with some delicious Moo Shu Pork, Sesame Chicken, crispy paper thin egg rolls, and complimentary fried rice (yep, it's free with EVERY multiple entree order!) and Yum Yum just added 4 devotees to their customer base. 

The service was also uber-friendly.  Since we placed our order during a World Series game (aka they were slammed with orders), they suggested that we pick up in 15 minutes rather than wait the 45-60 mins for delivery.  And, then, when we arrived at the restaurant, thanked us profusely for making the effort to come to them.
author: Megan J.

description: Decent meatless options when you're hungover. Thats the only time I would eat here though.
author: Dan H.

description:
I miss going to this place, when it was on Valencia Street in the mission. It's a bit of a hike to get to it now, though the food is just as good as it was ten years ago. They have vegetarian options (get the hot and sour soup and ask for no egg!).

I do make the effort to go here a few times a year. It's never crowded so you get your food quickly.  Beware the hot water in the restroom, however -- it's REALLY hot as soon as you turn the knob.

I'm happy that this place is still around.
author: Handsome Rick E.

description:
Ha! I have no affiliation with Yum Yum Hunan, just a coincidence we chose the same name!

I have been ordering delivery from this place for a couple years. Their service is lightning fast, always courteous, and the food is great!

I'm very picky about my Chinese food yet I'm the kind of person that will eat at the scary, dirty, hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurants my friends are too afraid to try. I usually shy away from Hunan style food because I think the sauces are too rich for me. I hate dishes where my food is swimming in gloppy sauce! But for some reason, Yum Yum's Hunan I find delicious and the sauces are not overwhelming.

They have all the classics but make them especially well. They also have a very long list of "Specials" with unique gourmet offerings such as Mongolian Lamb, Mango Broccoli Prawn and Pork-stuffed Eggplant and Tofu. This is probably the first time I've ever had orange chicken that was made using real orange and orange zest (no neon-orange flavorless goop!) They even garnished it! They make excellent Kung Pao and my favorite Chicken Fried Rice. 

I especially adore that they offer meatless chicken because then my vegetarian husband can eat with me. They offer 5 meatless chicken dishes and 11 vegetarian entree options! Wow!

They also have a special when you order delivery, if you order 2 or more entrees you get a free order of Chow Mein or Fried Rice.

The people who answer the phone speak English perfectly so there are never communication issues. They are always friendly and sweet. The delivery guys arrive at your door super fast and are always a pleasure to deal with. These people really *get* customer service!

I am always pleased with the food and service at Yum Yum. What is there not to love?
author: L. L.

description:
I enjoyed my spinach tofu soup--large portion too. The vegetarian chicken they use is similar to Quorn but juicier. Another reviewer mentioned being able to customize dishes but they were not able to add veggies to the orange chicken. I got a different chicken dish instead (I think Kung Pao) and it was great!

Service was pleasant and I enjoyed the tasteful ambiance. Would definitely return.
author: Victoria W.

description:
Yum Yum is right! My coworkers have been telling me to go and I thought it was one of those buffett places but I was wrong! I walked in, seated right away. It's a nice place with white table cloths. I ordered Mongolian beef which comes with soup of the day, salad, rice, and an egg roll. All for $7!!!! All was very tasty and I couldn't even finish it.
Awesome deal, the only thing is is that make sure you have cash. $10 minimum for credit cards. 
Ill definitely be back here.
P.S. If you are having lunch by yourself like I did, they do have a TV you can watch.
:)
author: Lana K.

description: Been here twice now and both times were great. For a vegetarian they have five fake chicken options which is awesome. Their food is cheap and fast when you're their. I'm sure there is probably better Chinese food in the city, but there is no reason not to give this one a try. So good.
author: Clayton S.

description:
Twice the yum.

The Sun Flower Chicken got me in the door. Sounded unique and amazing. Chicken. Sunflower seeds. Vegetables. Yes please.

Ended up being OK. Kind of salty. Kind of saucy. All other flavors were buried behind the two. Sunflowers seemed missing. Liked. Unique. But short of amazing.

However. The portion was enough for two meals. So three stars for the first one. Fourth star added as I was still indulging one night later.
author: Jason B.

description: It's hard to find a tasty decent Chinese food place in the city. I am so happy to find Yum Yum Hunan! The prices are reasonable and the food is very good. I highly recommend the Crab Rangoon appetizer(tasty bliss), Walnut Shrimp, Sesame Chicken and Szechuan String Beans(to die for), and Garlic Eggplant. The portions are wonderful and the service is excellent. I've always had a great experience.
author: Caroline N.

description:
On the whole, the food is A-OK.  The majority of their menu consists of pieces of chicken/beef/fish deep fried with a sticky sauce poured over them :( but there are a few gems like the vegetarian hong kong style noodle and string bean chicken that I totally love.

The service is what makes me a fan.  They are lightning fast, will deliver to your house if you're lazy, and offer a free container of tasty fried rice (I prefer vegetable) if you order 2 or more entrees (noodles, sadly, are not considered entrees).
author: Krystle S.

description:
This place is like VCU in the NCAA 2011 tournament, underrated and the cinderella team.

Come here and you will be pleasantly surprised. They cater towards americans a bit but you'll be able to find some dishes that are really solidly good.
author: Eric A.

description:
This is one of the places that deserved my being back on Yelp. 

This place is great and conveniently located near me. Portions are great for the price and quality, I often have enough to take home and make another meal from it. I've always gotten a fair ratio of meat to veggies in the entrees I've ordered. The rice has always been soft and just the right amount of moist, never undercooked nor too dry. The veggies in the dishes have always been perfectly stir fried it or however they do it back there in the kitchen. Nice and crisp, but piping hot and tender. I am partial to their prawn/shrimp dishes, they do them very well. Their hot and sour soup has tons of sea and land veggies, tofu, egg? and has a good flavor, nothing fighting too much to overpower anything else, rather balanced. The seaweed tastes great. 

Takeout is always fast, hot. 
I haven't experienced their delivery as I live so close. 
When I order takeout they invite me to sit. They don't offer tea or soup unless you eat in because takeout doesn't take that long! They are very fast. 
When eating in you are brought tea and soup. The tea is nice and feels very relaxing, but maybe that's just the atmosphere. Although sometimes the teenagers or younger adults that work their are loud, they are just talking and laughing amongst themselves, and seem to be happy....I don't mind chatter while I'm eating. 
They've forgotten to bring water a few times but when I went to the counter and asked it was no problem at all for the girl to give me two glasses. She was very nice. 
I love this place.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
I didn't think I'd like this chinese restaurant, but surprise! Very nice. Very affordable and high quality. 

Walnut prawns - juicy succulent prawns, nicely breaded, not oily or heavy tasting. Tons of candied walnuts.

General Tso's chicken - nicely breaded, very tasty, tender and juicy chicken places.
author: Carol L.

description:
Looking for a Chinese place that delivers (for free) I called up Yum Yum Hunan.  Delivery took a full hour (minus one star) and when I called to inquire about the delivery (after 45 mins)  the man on the phone was rather short with me.  However, when the food finally came, it was really yummy.

I had the general chicken (really good), the vegetables (decent, not great), and the veggie chow mein (very yummy).  Also, since I ordered two entrees the chow mein was free.  This was a fantastic deal.  

I was very happy with this place.  I will definitely order from here again.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
MSG galore

Pass on another poor yelp recommendation.

Service is good however.
author: Bobby B.

description: Just ordered for delivery through iPhone yelp app.  Food was here within 20 mins.  Very fast.  I ordered fried rice and peking duck.  Taste was okay. not too bad.  But there is definitely room for improvement.  Very fast though!
author: Julian C.

description:
Yum Yum! 

This is my go to place for delivery. The orange meatless chicken is a favorite of mine, but everything I've had has been pretty tasty. 

Add in free delivery and chow mein with two entrees and I'm a fan!
author: Murphy O.

description: Ive been going to Yum-yum ever since they were at the Valencia location and since then, them moving I've followed them like a stalker, lol... I always get their walnut prawns, orange chicken, combination chow mein and fried rice, and every time they make it, its great!!!. Heavenly perhaps... their service is always friendly and never disappointing. Great place for Chinese food.
author: Mario C.

description: I ordered the Sun Flower Chicken special to go-- chicken white meat sautéed with julienned vegetables.  It tasted weird.  The white meat didn't look like white meat.  I washed pieces of it off-- I have no idea what it was, but it looked like shreds of chicken skin.  Never eating there again.
author: Alan B.

description: Good for lunch specials.  It's called a Hunan restaurant but they carry a handful of hunan dishes and a lot more typical American-Chinese favorites. I tried the chicken w/ green beans for lunch and it's fine.   Was busy right around noon, but quiets down later.
author: Dan C.

description:
My husband are in town to hang out with a family member who is recovering from surgery at the Kaiser hospital a few blocks away. Of course, I don't want hospital food, so I turn to Yelp to guide me to the best in local cuisine.

Being close to the Chinese New Year, I looked for Chinese food and find wonderful reviews for Yum Yum Hunan. Could there really be THIS MANY good reviews? Yes, there are. 

Thank you to whomever said this place was "clean," and used "fresh vegetables." These are always key terms for me deciding where to go when it comes to Chinese food.

After walking just a few blocks (in the rain, no less) we find Yum Yum's--which is a cute, well decorated, modern-looking establishment. Sitting just a food tables away was an employee shelling peas from pods in the main room. Immediately I was sold on this place.

My husband and I both ordered lunch specials. Me: sweet and sour chicken. Him: Mongolian beef. We also split an order of vegetable egg rolls. Hot tea was complimentary, and the ice water was slightly lemon flavored.

Here's what sold me on this place for a 4-star review...

You know when you order an appetizer for two people, but it comes served in an odd number (in our case, three egg rolls for two people)? It is always weird when you get down to remaining rolls. "Oh, you can have it." "No, you have it!" "No you, I insist!"

Whether this was on purpose or not, I don't know, but the Yum Yum staff cut our egg rolls in half--essentially leaving us with six mini-egg rolls. This was perfect for the two of us to share.

Score!
author: Liz S.

description: Excellent vegetarian 'meatless' dishes delivered fast.
author: tom w.

description: The customer service in here is pretty bad. They scold you/ make you feel like crap if you try to use a card instead of cash, and once didnt let me pay with card at all. Foods okay but i've gotten sick a couple times off of it so i dont touch it anymore. I used to really love the sesame chicken, but the inconcistency of their meals combined with their questionable customer service made them recently lose me as a customer
author: Nikko J.

description:
Smaller place with friendly staff. We were the only ones in the place so cooks came out to watch the NBA playoffs with us lol! Walnut shrimp, garlic pork, hongkong style chow mein was tasty and traditional. Soup was below satisfactory.

Pricing $7-10 per dish for dinner. Standard Chinese delivery, good value for the price.
author: J K.

description:
Until further notice, I am sticking by this five star review. For the past month and a half, I have ordered from this Chinese restaurant every Sunday at exactly 11AM (when they start delivery). And no, I'm not some fat, greasy slob. I am young, I am fit, and I like to think that I know good food.

My gf and I always share General Tsao's Chicken, 1 brown rice, and 1 veggie potstickers. Once we also ordered Orange Fake Meat Chicken (or whatever more appealing name they have for it) and got a free fried rice, and they were good enough to stuff our faces with until we thought we were going to explode, but it was way way way too much food for the two of us.

So let's break it down.
General Tsao's: Arrives hot, doesn't leave grease marks on the packaging. Broccoli has been well cooked every time, except once when it was a bit overdone, but still pretty good. Also, tasty.
Brown rice: Too often restaurant undercook brown rice thinking it cooks like white rice. Yum Yum gets it right. Simply steamed.
Veggie Potstickers: Like the others, comes hot, tastes fresh. Good by themselves, without any extra sauce. Although I do like to rub the last one in the General Tsao's sauce once the take-out thing is empty.
Speed: 20-40 minutes. Again, I order when they just start delivery, so there's no back-up from a bunch of other people ordering unless they're just like me.
Service: Always nice on the phone, never had to be on hold. The delivery guy is always nice, and always has change.
Price: With tip, I think we pay $19 for this meal for two. Not bad, eh?

Don't listen to the haters: this place is definitely worth the cash you just found in that coat you haven't worn for months.
author: Shaina 'Occasionally Rahn' K.

description:
I get delivery from here constantly. They pick up the phone quick, usually have a tough time deciphering addresses, but are always friendly and super quick to arrive.

The food has never let me down. Not once. Always fantastic, and just what I expect. Routine is usually stuff yourself until you feel like puking, then be set for the rest of the day. Wonderful experience, in it's own really weird way.
author: Brendan M.

description:
My favorite local Chinese delivery spot.

Order two entrees and get a free order of fried rice (veggie, chicken, beef) OR chow mein.  I always get the veggie fried rice. 

They give you hearty portions!  My husband and I always get their sesame chicken w/ broccoli. This dish doesn't have broccoli on the menu but, just ask for it w/ broccoli. You can balance the fried sweet chicken pieces with some steamed veggies. 

Other dishes tried that we liked was the drunken beef and basil beef...both very good.
author: Mina B.

description:
One of the best Chinese Food delivery experiences you'll ever have.

1.  The guy who answers the phone is what I would want my grandfather to be like if I had a Chinese grandpa.  He's extremely helpful and tries his best to accommodate your every whim.  Eg: One day I really wanted Jasmine tea with my food and I was ballsy enough to ask if they would deliver tea.  He apologized that they didn't have a takeout tea container so he packed me a (free) bag full of amazing Jasmine tea bags so that I could make my own.  How sweet - and totally NOT neccessary!  Most Chinese restaurants would just say "no" but he made an attempt to make his customer happy.  That's the way to do business people... Outstanding.

2.  Delivery is fast.  Ok sometimes it really is 30-45 minutes like they say, but I've gotten used to hearing that and suddenly having the Yum Yum guy at my door 15 minutes later.  How does he DO that?!!

3.  FREE Chicken Chow Mein with every order of two entrees.  Ok so I totally don't need the third entree, and I'm probably fatter because of this deal, but show me the person who can say no to free Yum Yum Chicken Chow Mein and I'll show you a person with no soul.

Ok so maybe I've eaten enough Yum Yum that I'm starting to resemble an over-stuffed egg roll, but I don't care.  I'll yell it from the rooftops:  I LOVE YUM YUM!!!
author: Mariko H.

description: Nice neighborhood Chinese restaurant. Large portions - good Kung Pao chicken. Wait staff friendly and food quickly prepared. Recommended.
author: Richard D.

description:
I'm a bit surprised seeing so many low ratings for this place over the past few months! For me, Yum Yum has been the best Chinese delivery I've experienced in the city, hands down...and I've been looking for a "go to" spot for a looooooooooong time. The only thing that has gone wrong for me: they have forgotten items a couple times and brought the wrong order once, but they always make it up to me, so it's all good.

I consistently order the hot and sour soup, the kung pao tofu, and the brown rice. Always solid, and generally not too greasy (though once the tofu was REALLY greasy...but still oh sooooo tasty & flavorful). I've also tried the chicken salad (good, but doesn't keep as left overs, so what's the point?), some dish with fake chicken that I don't remember, and the veggie chow mein...and probably the egg rolls and some other apps at some point. I've yet to have a bad experience with the food or delivery time. It has all made many a hangover day bearable to me, and thank christ for that.
author: Jasmine F.

description:
I've walked by here so many times without noticing this place. It wasn't until one of my co-workers kept ordering their singapore noodles that I learned of this place. 

When I couldn't decide what to have for dinner one night and was craving for singapore noodles, I decided to drive out here for some, to-go. So my review is solely based on just their singapore noodles.... it's LOVE!
author: Eugenia G.

description: bomb ass good won ton soup...cant wait to try some of their fried prawns
author: Aldo C.

description: AMAZING. Yum Yum has the best Chinese food that i have ever had. We moved from the city to the burbs a few years ago when we found out we were having a baby and I can honestly say that we still miss Yum Yum and dream about it at least once a month. Everyone I refer here loves it and become repeat customers. They deliver their insanely delicious food pretty much all over the city - which makes this call a total no-brainer. Every time we go to the city for pretty much anything, we stop in for take out to bring back with us. Call them - now!
author: Jessi B.

description: Can I give this a place a Zero. What shitty service!!!!!!!!!!  Started the order on yelp, chose to just call. Thought that would be easier and faster. Ordered some egg rolls, and a couple of entrees. My husband and I always ask for HOT MUSTARD keep the SWEET AND SOUR. Got SWEET AND SOUR NO HOT MUSTARD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! To start, order was easy, thought everything was fine. Got a call on my cell phone, you have to come down here and get your food, WHAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thought delivery meant to your room????  Went down, didn't know how much the food was going to be, as we didn't get a price on the phone?? (You would think they would tell you how much cash you need if you have to meet them on the street!!!!!! for delivery??????????) Wish I had used my credit card, could have stopped payment!!! I can't believe I paid $45 plus tip, and when we called back and asked for hot mustard (after we requested it to begin with) they told us we couldn't have it. After 3 more calls asking for hot mustard (and 30 minutes later asking for HOT egg rolls) still didn't get any  hot mustard, any hot eggrolls, and they just HUNG UP ON US!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We were trying to be nice, but after the second call, were getting a little irritated (wouldn't you be) By the third call, VERY IRRITATED, AND THEYJUST HUNG UP ON US!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! DIDN'T CARE, Will take the food back to them in the morning, see if we get our money back. I BET NOT, DON'T GIVE THEM CASH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Tanya D.

description:
Very disappointing. The quality of the chicken was very poor. It had the consistency of tofu. That's fine for tofu but not for chicken. It usually speaks of sodium pumped solution. Barely edible. We didn't eat the chow mein that we ordered and they graciously took it off our bill. 

I really wanted to like this place.  I hope they read this and improve their quality.

It's true that they have a lot of vegetarian options so it might be okay if that's a requirement.
author: Fareed R.

description:
I remember this place when it was back on Valencia: so so so delicious! Thank you for moving! Thank you for remaining in business!

Their food is extremely fresh and has a vibrancy of flavors. Their sauces are so well spiced and delicious without bordering on the "tastes right out of a bottle!" that more mediocre Chinese restaurants seem to specialize in. Also, there's a surprising lack of "oh, wonder what kind of mystery meat that is?!" situation going on. And finally, they have several dishes that deviate from your standard Chinese take-out menus that we've all come to memorize, unfortunately...

They're definitely a cut above the standard Chinese food in SF but I like them just a little less than the California Chinese that Eric's  http://www.yelp.com/biz/erics-restaurant-san-francisco and Alice's made famous.



Good to know:

Spicy Mandarin Eggplant is fabulous as is the real-orange Orange Chicken

Drunken Beef is meh

If you order 2 entrees, you can get a free fried rice (try the brown rice veggie) or chow mein for free. Sometimes you have to ask for it though.


Unfortunately, I can tell by my frenetic eating, putting away, returning, nibbling, yearning, wanting of Yum Yum's food that they almost certainly use MSG. And there's no large font denials of it on their menus, so it's safe to say, they use MSG. With great success. And probably a lot of it. My hands are actually shaking right now...just a little bit....after eating almost half of the entire order of Orange Chicken...and still....wanting .....more......

So that's minus 1 star. For my MSG hangover from eating waaaay too much good Yum Yum.

I am going to try to ask them to make my order without MSG next time. I'l let you know how it goes.
author: Yasi S.

description:
After moving to a new neighborhood the first thing to do is to find the closest GOOD Chinese restaurant. Done and done.
Being a vegetarian, it is hard to find Chinese food that is more than just tofu and veggies. Yum Yum Hunan has filled that void with a "meatless chicken" section of the menu! The lemon and orange "chicken" dishes are amazing! I think even voracious carnivores would love these dishes. 
Their standard vegetarian section also boasts more than 10 entrees. 
The prices here are really good for the large portions you get. Rice is extra, but cheap: $1 for white $1.25 for brown.
The best part is that if you order two entrees, you get a FREE order of chow mein or fried rice!
Service is always great and call in orders are ready to pick up in 15-20 minutes. I have never tried the delivery service because I live so close.
Best Chinese food in the area!
author: Bobby J.

description: Best chinese food delivery! Prices are cheap, delivery is quick, and the food is delicious. If you order two entrees, you get a free chow mein or fried rice... the FREE chicken fried is awesome!! i also love, LOVE the prawns lobster sauce - lots of shrimp and veggies. the five spice beef and the general tsao's chicken are just okay, but the other stuff makes up for it. also tried the combo noodle soup - very fat noodles (-) but  a lot of great meats and veggies in it (++). for the two entree delivery/free fried rice deal, it ends up being about $24.00..... i'm throwing out the other menu's we have for Chinese takeout :)
author: Kimberly S.

description:
A friend and I were up studying late and called in to order Chinese delivery here; I was worried that we'd get DENIED because it was probably ten minutes before the closing time listed on their website. 

However, the guy who took our order (and I second the reviewer on here who compared him to a Chinese Grandpa!) was extremely accommodating and friendly.

I was expecting the delivery in probably half an hour or something, but I got a call from the delivery guy less than fifteen minutes later. 

Now, if I'd known about the FREE RICE that would've come with ordering two entrees for delivery, I might've saved myself some money. As it was, though, I ordered fried rice, kung pao chicken and the combination platter, and all of that was almost too much food, thanks to their generous servings. I think even the fried rice alone could've fed two amply.

Not only was the food plentiful, but it was RIDICU-LICIOUSLY NOMSOME. It wasn't too greasy, the fried rice tasted pretty much heavenly, and the chicken was great too.

I'm almost certainly going to call Yum Yum Hunan again when I want Chinese food delivered....and next time I'm going to take advantage of the free rice/chow mein. ;D
author: Daniela R.

description: I ordered a chicken noodle dish and it was just terrible. I can't even explain it, I just hated it so much that i only ate about a handfuls worth and then warmed up something in my kitchen.
author: Rohan S.

description:
This was some good Chinese Delivery.  The guy on the phone was really nice and helpful and we got our food in the time that he specified.  Huge portions and fresh vegetables - not overcooked!

We ordered:

Orange Chicken: If this is all I had ordered, Yum Yum would be getting at least 4 stars!  Lightly fried (not greasy) and very tasty!  Obviously made with real orange.  I ordered this for me, but my boyfriend ate most of it!

Kung Pao Chicken: The veggies in this were amazing!  So perfectly cooked and tons of them!  The chicken, however, was a bit rubbery and fatty...thus the boyfriend eating my chicken!

Kung Pao Fried Rice: I know, I know - Why more Kung Pao?  I don't know.  But the rice was great!  So tasty and the seasoning added that extra kick of spice to the rice.  Alas, the chicken in this was the same as the chicken in the previous dish.

I will order from Yum Yum again, just not the Kung Pao Chickens.
author: R D.

description:
In a nutshell: very friendly service, lightning fast delivery, and decent food at decent prices. I wouldn't say this is the finest chinese takeout in the city. In the grand scheme of things it's actually probably middle of the road. But it's definitely one of your better options if you live in the Lower Pac Heights/Laurel Heights/Western Addition area.

And they're so cool they hooked me up with a free chicken chow mein for no apparent reason. :)
author: Don W.

description:
I may have found a new hot spot for the new neighborhood I am living in.

We stopped by, hungry after moving furniture due to the high recommendation that came from a friend.  

It was early for dinner time and we were one of two tables full.  

The staff was very pleasant and the food was great!

The portions we very big and i noticed quite a few things that were exciting to me on the menu:

The first is free delivery, very handy even if you're right across the way.  I was also happy to see that they have lunch specials and free fried rice or chow mein with any two entrees.  There was quite a lot of seafood as well as veggie options, which even included seitan/soy meat or "meatless chicken"  

We had the Dry Garlic Calamari, Veggie Chow Mein and brown rice.  This was plenty for two, plus leftovers.

I willl definitly be back to try more of the menu :)
author: Therese H.

description:
Yum Yum Hunan is Chinese American food delivery, moderate grease. I think we received our food within 30 min.

What we ordered:
Pork Pot Stickers
Hot & Sour Soup
Mongolian Beef
Walnut Shrimp
Chicken Chow Mein (free since I ordered 2 entrees!)

Pot Stickers - tasty - not the best I have had, but not the worst. Good ratio of meat to wrapper. Wrapper was not too thick.

Hot & Sour Soup - meh. but nourishing.

Mongolian Beef - spicy and tasty

Walnut Shrimp - delicious - fried and the sauce was perfect!

Chicken Chow Mein - I love noodles and these were free, am a fan

Looking forward to the leftovers for dinner tonight!
author: Janine L.

description:
Prompt, yummy, and you can understand what they say over the phone!

Never actually been, but when in need of a Chinese food fix, Yum Yum is who we call.

Our staple:  Everything fried rice (w/out shrimp), Mongolian Beef, and Chicken Chow Fun.    Enough for dinner  for 2 and lunch the next day.
author: Alexis M.

description:
This is for the delivery only; I've never been to the restaurant.

It's your standard delivery.  I've never had to wait too long for their driver and they always get the order right.  They seem a little expensive, but I don't order too many take-outs, so I don't have much of a market-comparison on this.

The great thing is they have the meatless chicken options which is fantastic.  One of my friends who eats meat said it tastes the same, if not better, than their meat.

The downside is that the last order I got the boc choy with mushrooms.  the greens were great, the mushrooms tasted as if they were soaked in powdered cheese.  not a fan.  Moreover, all the food was shiny from soaking in oil.  Also not a fan. Some may say, it's chinese take-out, what do you expect?  Just a little better than food that comes with your oil.

But all in all I will certainly order from them again.  The orange meatless chicken is still my favorite of all time and every once in a while you need a good-greasy-chinese-food-night-in.
author: N F.

description:
My Chinese food palate is quite extensive, especially living in San Francisco, growing up Chinese and constantly being surrounded by Chinese food.

I got delivery from this place last night and it wasn't horribly bad nor was it excellent either. The delivery time was standard, about 40 minutes. The food came warm which is always a plus in my book.

FOOD:
Green onion pancake: SKIP! This dish is definitely not worth the caloric intake nor is it worth your money. They only put the tasty green onion mixture in the middle of the pancake and it only covered approximately 25% of the pancake innards. Therefore, when they fry it up and serve it to you, you eat mostly fried batter without the yummy insides.

Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings: Not bad. I am a huge chicken wing enthusiast, especially salt and pepper wings, so I may be a bit critical when it comes to this dish. I've definitely had much tastier salt and pepper wings, but it isn't the worst I've had. It's fairly average and I would order it again if ordering from this place.

Chicken Chow Fun: Meh. Honestly, I don't think there was enough soy or sauce on it because the noodles were not brown but a tan color, which is an indication that there isn't enough soy. When tasting, it was a bit bland for what the dish could have been. I would skip this dish or maybe try the beef chow fun next time.

Bok Choy and Shiitake mushrooms: It's hard to ruin this dish so this dish gets my thumbs up especially if you're trying to eat healthy.

Wor Won Ton Soup: The broth was a bit plain and everything in it was just meh. Nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. 


In conclusion: just a "meh" restaurant. If I am craving Chinese, I might order from here again but I'd probably be more inclined to trying another place just because their food is just average. I'm not really sure why they have such a high rating. Is it the neighborhood they are in? If they were in the sunset or a more Chinese populated neighborhood, I have a feeling they wouldn't have such a high rating. If I were you, I'd skip on this place and try somewhere else.
author: Christina B.

description: Pretty good food! I always order take out and it's always hot and delicious. I recently went against better judgement and tried a place that had better ratings than yum yum... We were totally disappointed, this is my official Chinese takeout place!
author: SF M.

description:
Momma needed a break from playing good Chinese housewife after having to go into the office the entire weekend. Seemed like Yum Yum Hunan had some good reviews, so we decided to call for delivery. We got the salt & pepper shrimp, veggie delight, salt & pepper pork chops, walnut shrimp, and the free veggie chow mein. 

I really had high hopes for this place especially since it was a good deal ($40 for all the food) and it seems like everyone else has had a good experience. However, the food we received was sub-par. The salt & pepper shrimp was terrible--actually nothing like I've ever had before; same with the salt and pepper pork. Maybe it's because we got delivery or maybe because a lot of bai ren partake in this place so they think they can skimp on the quality, but either way it was unsatisfying.

The service was nice, but I don't know if I would try this place again :(
author: Angela L.

description:
Need cheap chinese food delivered quick in Pac Heights? This is the place to go/order from.

The restaurant itself is very clean and nicely done, but most people order togo so its usually pretty empty.

Food is yum... I'd love for this place to not use plastic bags, forks etc. That added touch (even if prices go up 50 cents) might make it stand out of the rest of the chinese restaurants? Just a thought!
author: Sumit C.

description:
Good but not great. If I could I would rate 3.5, but will round up because of the awesome service. Clean and reasonable dine in experience, above all its cheap. 

Food was good, but not AMAZING.

If I was in the neighborhood I would give this a try, but wouldn't venture too far, especially when there are better/cheaper options in Chinatown.
author: Dave N.

description:
The dinner started off nicely with wonton soup that had an excellent broth and veggies that were so fresh they still crunched, and good-sized wontons. Our entrees included combo chow fun noodles that was standard but full of flavor and assorted meats and veggies, a seafood on sizzling rice dish that didn't really need the sizzling rice, and the "Yum Yum Delicatessen" that had nearly the same ingredients (sans celery and plus calamari) as the former but seemed to be the consensus favorite.

Definite minus was the brown rice, that tasted like it had been left out in the open for way too long. It was pretty much wasn't edible.

Overall, a pleasant experience, cloth napkins (always appreciated), fast service, nice decor. Bonus: they had NBA games on the TV... which suspiciously looked like it was taken from a kid's bedroom...
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Yum Yum is back! I was afraid I'd lost you forever! That day when I found out you were no longer open at your Valencia St. location, I felt truly alone for the first time. I didn't know what I would do. And then a miracle happened. As I walked past your window on Divisadero and saw that familiar Yum Yum name, I felt a my skin start tingling with anxious anticipation. I opened the door and there you all were, the wonderful staff of Yum Yum House. You may have changed your name and address but your Mongolian beef is still fantastic and the five flavored chicken, wow... I have no idea what the five flavors are but they sure are good! 

4 stars for the food, 1 star lost for the service.
author: Alex S.

description: This is our Chinese delivery go-to place.  Food is good, decent portions, and consistent.  Delivery is typically very quick also.
author: Marianne W.

description:
Heck YES!! Yum yum is YUM YUMS!! (so cheesy) So incredibly THRILLED to give a two thumbs up review to a Chinese food delivery spot. So many times I have ordered Chinese delivery and the food for the most part has been has been nasty, mushy, mystery meat. C avarage food at BEST. BLECH! The last place we called before yum yum even forgot to put the chicken in our CHICKEN and eggplant dish! Whaaaat? What is that?! 

Yum Yum is amazing. High quality chicken and beef, amazing flavors and no soggy veggies! And get this...they give a FREE side of chow main or fried rice with two entrees, and the side is the size of a whole dish, and its delicious. 

They even have "meatless" options for your lovely vegan and veggie freinds. Yay! 

We were so pleased and now Yum Yum's menu is on the fridge and all the MILLION others that get put on our front door handle with a rubber band are goin in the T-R-A-S-H. Thanks Yum Yum for doing it RIGHT and at a great price.
author: Jenn T.

description:
After multiple attempts of trying to eat at Food Inc (a block or two away from Yum Yum), we were disappointed as we found ourselves in front of a closed Food Inc which is not open on Sundays. Then he said he was craving chinese food for some reason, so we looked on yelp and made our way to Yum Yum. Upon entering, there was only one other lady eating there and I got a little worried. However, the place was clean and more spacious than it seemed from the numerous times I've passed by. 

We sat down and spotted a section with lunch deals on the menu, ranging from $6-8 each. We ordered a sesame chicken and a eggplant, shrimp and garlic dish. Both were great deals, but the eggplant, shrimp and garlic dish was definitely better. I was surprised at how authentic it was. Before the dishes come out, they give you a cup of soup which is good too. Also, did I mention how much rice they give you??? I love rice and was still having a hard time finishing all of it. On each plate, they also give you a few salty chips on the side. All in all, Yum Yum's lunch deals were cheap and satisfying.
author: Angela S.

description: Need delivery for your first night in a new apartment?  Yum Yum Hunan is your place. Tylical chinese menu selections, but executed well.  The spicy fried rice and lo mein hit the spot and weren't too greasy.
author: Kim K.

description:
This is our delivery place of the moment when we're craving Chinese food. I always judge a Chinese restaurant based on its hot and sour soup and I was pleasantly surprised that when I tasted Yum Yum's soup, it was just that, yum yum. 

We've gotten delivery here twice now and its always tasty and delivered quickly. Most recently we ordered the orange chicken, which was good, but nothing special as some of the reviews here rave. Usually I'm not a huge fan of deep fried anything , but I was hoping this would be more impressive. Egg rolls were very greasy, would definitely skip these next time, but that hot and sour soup was good, see above. We've also gotten the chow mein in the past which I liked, not too greasy. 

Delivery is ridiculously fast, the hot and sour soup is yummy, and the food satisfies that Chinese takeout craving. 3 stars it is!
author: Carolyn K.

description:
Probably one of the best Hunan places in the city. Food is flavorful and rich. Extra points for having really good fake chicken. Fried rice is free with a delivery order and delivery is very fast.

I especially love the Kung Pao Meatless Chicken and Singapore noodles.

Their dim sum stinks, though. The spring rolls and pot stickers are inedible, but the entrees are sooooo good that it doesn't loose them stars in my book.
author: Mark F.

description: This place is underwhelming. I really love hot and sour soup but this place really doesn't have a great version of it. I find it has a ratio that's low in terms of soup to tofu and veggies. Spice II is far far better in my opinion. Also, I've order mooshu pork from this place at least 8 times and they've forgotten plum sauce on at least 2 of those occasions. Mooshu without plum sauce sucks. I haven't been impressed by this place and I've moved on. Sorry folks.
author: Michael S.

description: quick n tasty. Didn't expect it from a random small place like this.  The meatless kungpao was better than most meat kungpao I've had
author: Terry B.

description:
Very good - perfect grease factor. 

The service was average, and the pricing was a little higher than average, but hey, it's Pac Heights, what are you going to do?

I ordered Crab Rangoon, and Sesame Chicken. My friend ordered Garlic Chicken. They both came with an egg roll - it was very reminiscent of generic Chinese food from home, but altogether, a nice place to eat.
author: Edwin M.

description: Eh, I can't really knock this place too bad.  But San Francisco I am surprised other reviewers call this excellent.  I ate here a couple times because it was convenience with good reviews.  But while nothing was bad and I would rank this Yum Yum better than "food court" Chinese, however the dishes I had were bland and greasy.  Service was acceptable, but fairly unremarkable.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
This is our go-to Chinese Delivery place.

It's not amazing & it's not the best chinese we've ever had.. But it's super fast, cheap, tasty, and it doesn't give us stomach problems like so many other Chinese places in the city.

We can have dinner delivered, and have leftovers for lunch for under $25. That's not bad at all.
author: Tamara B.

description: ordered from here a few times during my lunch break, only phone orders for pick up and once for delivery. These were both very convenient and orders are ready pretty fast! a big variety of choices to choose from esp. with lunch. Lunch orders comes with a small soup :).
author: Christie M.

description: This place is pretty good, Usually me an my boys order food from there and get it delivered sinced its close to work it usually gets there pretty fast. There chow mein is really flavorful. One of my Favs is there salt and pepper crispy spareribs its delicious. There fried rice is pretty good too. prices got a lil high recently and if u pay with your ATM it has to be a minimun of $10 ...weak
author: Rene L.

description:
Pretty good not great.  Delivery was relatively quick - 40 minutes into the presidio.  Food was a mixed bag.  The kung pao chicken was excellent (very fresh veggies) and the chicken chow fun and mushu pork were good.  The mongolian beef was not good - overcooked and poor quality beef.  Won ton soup also good.

I might try this again but will look for other places in the neighborhood to try first.
author: Evan M.

description: This is our GO-TO Chinese food spot. Our order usually consists of: 5 flavor chicken (like orange chicken consistency, way different and BETTER taste), chicken chow mein, pork fried rice. AND if we're having company or feel like having a food festival, add the onion pancakes(BOMB), Mongolian beef  and crab rangoon(ALSO BOMB). Enjoy! - We always Do! Oh, by the way, it's ALWAYS take out, I've never eaten there.
author: Tara M.

description:
We went all out, excited to try a new chinese place: we ordered Hong Kong style noodles, Chicken and Broccoli, Sweet & Sour Pork, and fried prawns appetizer.  
The appetizer was over the top fried: very little prawn wrapped in tons of fried batter.
The Chicken in the Chicken and Broccoli had that funny texture that many Chinese restaurants. You know, like it has some slimy shell around the meat.
The Sweet and Sour Park was also had a funny texture to it.  
The two stars are because their sauces are pretty good.  Maybe just cook the meat and veggies at home and order the sauce for delivery?  I'm not gonna order here again.
author: Jenna H.

description:
Standard chinese food.  Fast delivery.  String bean with beef was very good (no weird chewy pieces that you often get in beef dishes)  Flavor was good, not to salty, and I didnt sense any MSG.
Pot stickers - got good, not bad
Crab Rangoon - very flavorful, lots of crab, pretty good overall

The reason that I gave it only 3 stars, and not 4, was because of the lunch menu.  The menu advertised soup and appetizer...but you dont get to chose.  Only hot and sour, and fried wonton skins (yes the cheapest item, and I dont like hot and sour)  It is still affordable at $6, BUT they wont deliver for under $15.  So you have to order more than the just lunch, so you might as well order off the regular menu.  
The fact that they make this slightly difficult, they lost a star.

Besides that, solid basic chinese food
author: Anya W.

description:
Super fast delivery.

Everything was fresh and delicious. They use real chicken... not that sketchy stuff that they call "chicken" at other takeout Chinese restaurants.

We loved:
General Tso's
Orange Chicken
Veggie Fried Rice
Crab Rangoons

We were also happy with the free Chicken Chow Mein. That was a nice surprise.  So why not 5 stars?

The egg drop soup was a big thumbs down. It tasted fishy. We bought a big container of it and tossed the whole thing. ick.

I won't hold it against them though - everything else was excellent!
author: Melissa J.

description: FAST, PIPING HOT DELIVERY! First time here. Food was good, especially the mu shu pork. It  arrived when they said it would and was really affordable.  It was really hot temperature wise which is not always the case with delivery so that was impressive. HUGE portions. I had 2 medium sized portions and I had only made a small dent in the container. Dishes do not come in standard folded boxes, they come in full huge square containers. Would definitely recommend!
author: Deja B.

description:
Two of the best possible combinations ... Kung Pao, and Fried Rice can be had here. 

I wanted some Kung Pao Chicken and Fried Rice, but that would have been too much. So while at work, trying to decide what to have, I came across Yum Yum. They deliver too, which was another reason to try. I also tried the Mongolian Beef and Pot Stickers to get a feel for it. I had plenty for lunch the next day. 

The Pot Stickers were OK, and not filled very much with pork and cabbage goodness, but the sauce that came with it, was very good. The Mongolian Beef didn't have much of the rice noodles that come as a filler, which is a good thing. It was spicy, and not too full of green onions which I have a hard time chewing. 

The Kung Pao Chicken Fried Rice was really good. You get all the things that's in Kung Pao, (chile, peanuts, and veggies) all in one dish. You can get this with Beef, Pork, or Vegetable. Try it! It's not as spicy as it could be, but throw in some chile sauce if you want.

Delivery was quick. I think I'll order Kung Pao Beef this time!
author: Michael M.

description:
Szechuan String Beans:  Excellent!
Wor Wonton Soup:  Excellent.  I'd like more shrimp, though.
Yum Yum Hunan Pork:  Good.

Very friendly and efficient service.  :)
author: Ally C.

description:
I already ate here earlier today and I want to eat there again. This happens to me every time I eat here, this place is my crack. I would rather put their General Tsao's meatless chicken in a glass pipe and smoke it til I third degree burn myself like I'm Richard Pryor in the 80s than eat at any other middle of the road Chinese place in the city. Most people don't have such a boner for this place as I do but that's because they probably aren't vegetarians who love meatless meat like I do. This brings their probably 4.5 to a 5 in my book, and everyone should try the meatless meat because eating dead animal carcasses makes you an asshole! JK dudes, before someone gets the idea that all vegetarians are militant pro-PETA types, we are so fuck you!

This place is never packed, possibly due to the fact that this place has quick delivery of large quantities of food almost custom made for secret-eating fatty binges. Seriously, get take out from here and they will immediately deliver your fix to you and even hook up a soy sauce IV drip to your arm!* You can find a table as soon as you walk in and sit wherever you'd like, preferably near the small tv they have hooked up near the ceiling so you have something to pretend to be interested in in case you come with someone you absolutely hate, or someone you are simply using as a cover so you don't have to eat alone in public like a loser. The waitresses are nice and greet you with a free pot of tea and say "Hi enjoy tea please." To me that just screams authentic Chinese restaurant. They take your order and within 5 minutes bring you plate fulls of fresh vegetables and awesome food that I want to eat right now! The waitresses rarely bug you, like they'll never ask you how the food is when your mouth is full because they don't give a shit and that's the way I like it! They are, however, easy to flag down in case you have a problem or need something they didn't bring (but you won't, it's impossible to be an asshole customer here, even for you!). You will then get a fortune cookie that almost always is not funnier by adding "in bed!" to the end.

*No they won't, calm down Fatty (aka me).
author: Joe T.

description:
located 3 stoplights from the Kaiser on Divis next to a burrito joint and a liquor store...

first thought, boring little hole in the wall place maybe ya boi SHOUlDA just gotten a burriti...clean, organized layout and their dining area has plenty of seating.
i was seated promptly and given a menu and poured a glass of water...seems like they know their shiet...
i looked over their menu, asked for a recommendation for chicken and the guy said...spicy? i say, ya..he ask beep, cheekin? i say chicken, he tell the others...hunan cheekin!  i say, ya make that...
hot/sour soup followed by a descent presentation in under 8 min...  ao far so good...till i start to eat this shit!   mannn, i shoulda gotten me a burrito!  but since it's on MY dolla...whatever! 
maybe it was the way the staff handled takin my order that i got my hopes up, i dunno... soup was bland, salad was boring, hunan chicken was actually tasty and SPICY!!!  no booshet!  but the fuccin rice was hard, dayyuuuummmm  wtf?! and the grease underneath it all, dayuuummm...
i got my check during the home stretch and get this..minimum 10 DOLLA, dayummm! ching!  fucc it..charge 10 and bring me another fortune cookie!!  like i said...shulda gotten me a BURRITO!
author: Omar N.

description:
I'm still partial to Ken's Kitchen when I'm craving meatless chicken due to their proximity and quick delivery, but Yum Yum has a slight edge in quality.  Perfect for two, they have a great deal of tossing in free fried rice or chow mein with an order of two entrees.

I've always done take out, but their dining area is bigger and brighter than what I remember from when they were in the Mission.  Aside from Tataki, I'm not a huge fan of any of the restaurants on this side of Divis, so I'm glad Yum Yum provides another option of good food to the area.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
This was one of the first search results for "Pac Heights," "Chinese food," and "delivery."  The food came in less than 30 minutes, which was awesome.  The delivery guy was friendly enough.  

BUT...The orange chicken tasted like slimy McDonalds chicken nuggets and the green beans were way too heavily salted. 

All in all, if I'm going to hoover MSG down the hatch at 9 pm on a Wednesday night, it should taste better than this.
author: Katie H.

description: I normally get take-out from here.  They're fast.  The food is normally ready within 10 minutes.  Like almost all Chinese restaurants, their food is made with lots of oil.  Everything is tasty.  I particularly like the string bean chicken lunch special.
author: STEVE L.

description:
My 1st time...I had their Mongolian beef lunch special. It came w/ an eggroll, nothing special, a hot n sour soup, bleh... yuk...patuwee! The beef was alright. I like the fact that you have the option of brown or white rice; the brown rice needed more water. I'd give the beef 3 stars, but overall it's a 2.
Extra credit:
Whenever the guy answers the phone, it sounds like he was hoping that it was "Yum Yum" on the other end, "Hello...Yum Yum?"  Lol.
author: Jay M.

description: Got Delivery. It was really great! Food was good and delivery was prompt.
author: Briggs S.

description:
A group of 11 of us ate at Yum Yum last night and it was great!
The sesame scallops are amazing and the basil beef was nice too.

The staff was very accommodating for such a large group and the food came out fast and tasted fresh. We all ate and had a few drinks for about $20 per person. Not bad for group dinners that tend to get out of hand ($$)!!

I miss not having this place nearby in the Mission anymore, but it was worth the trip to their new location.
author: Bam B.

description:
Yay!  A solid, high quality Chinese restaurant that delivers.

I'm in the Inner Richmond.  Surrounded by Chinese food... practically none of it delivered.  Sure - I love screeching my wheels around a 90* turn into a rare Clement Street parking spot to grab BBQ duck, dim sum and fluffy fried rice.  

But when it's pouring outside...  When it's really raining in buckets...  When I've got two kids in tow (ack, it's sleepover night and I'm low on groceries)... plus a bf who wants something tasty and meaty, and I'm pooped and all I reeeeally want to do is watch a cheesy Sci Fi flick next to the man on the couch while some fresh-faced dude brings us good eats...  THEN you need delivery.  Actually need it, mind you...  As a sanity tool.

Yum Yum is now my official Sanity Tool for
1. Chinese food cravings at odd hours
2. Delivery food need - any hour
3.  Pot stickers for the afficionado and kid-diner alike
4. String beans with anything.

Dude, the string beans rocked.  And I got to watch a whole movie AND the rain slamming down on the cars outside from my toasty livingroom where I watched my cheesy flick with my lovely man.  (The kids wrought havoc in the bedroom - the result being something a bit Midwestern on the Weather Channel - This used to be my daughter's room..." Etc.).

Smiling, very wet delivery guy took my signature.  And did NOT ask for my card (Which typically requires my screaming around to find it  - oh here it is, now hold it up and scribble all over my nicely painted walls please).  Yay.

You have no idea how much I love them for not insisting on seeing my card. :)  You mean you actually trust me to pay my bill?  Awesome.

Did I mention the food is 4 Stars?  Absolutely 4 Stars.

And as a non-Chinese speaker with a fairly well developed palate for Chinese food - including the regional specialties... yes I do, in fact, appreciate that they speak intelligible English on the phone.

Oh - and I ordered with no menu.  Just asking if they had "something like this, or that... and maybe String beans."  I got polite help, and no attitude. 

Lovely.  I'm a fan.
author: Juliana C.

description:
Pristine. Barren. Yucky.

Yum Yum has me confused.  Hear the name and you think potentially good greasy Chinese joint.  Walk into the simple, elegant interior and expect high quality gourmet Chinese.  Eat the food and wonder what the hell happened.

Eating my pork bun was a task: tasteless, semi-stale buns with a pinch of meat.  The hot and sour soup tasted more like egg soup gone bad.  

I appreciated the fast take out and the friendly service, but would rather wait an hour for quality than quickly offend my taste buds.
author: Jane L.

description:
Best Chinese delivery in SF. 

I've been ordering from Yum Yum for at least 10 years and when i compare it to anywhere else, quality is always great, huge portions, and extremely fast delivery. 

I used to order from them when they were on Valencia and 16th, they closed (i just found out they lost thier lease there), and just realized they've been open the whole time on Divisadero. 

So happy i found them again.
author: Adam X.

description: Ordered delivery. Food wasn't greasy (good), but it wasn't that great. On the plus side, it's quite cheap so you can try several dishes.
author: Noah J.

description:
Got delivery from here after an epic Halloween nights involving broken teeth, crashing Mexican parties, and passing out on the streets.

The sesame and General's chicken tasted exactly the same, except one was mildy spicy and the other had sesame seeds on it. Also, the chicken was breaded, and not a little breaded, but rather like there was a clearance on bread crumbs (do Chinese people use bread crumbs?)

Hot and sour soup was nice, but I love that stuff, so you can douse some shit with hot and sour soup and I'll still love it.

The chicken fried rice was greasy but good and cure those hangover hungers. And no the chicken wasn't breaded.

The delivery guy was a champ though. Found where we were in an alley and put up with me answering the door wearing just underwear and a sailor's cap. I wonder what he thinks we we're doing in there. Haha.

Yum Yum is at best, so-so. Unless you're in desperate need of hangover food.
author: Rocky K.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to eat! It is amazing. The service is great. We have never gotten it as take out, but it would probably be the best take out ever. The restaurant is very clean and calm. A great minimalist feeling.  

We really like the chow mein and the scallops and vegetables. Personally, you are safe with whatever you order!
author: Rheannia H.

description: Possibly the best chinese takeout I've had in San Francisco so far.  I got sesame chicken and there was a lot of chicken and not too much breading!  the rice also had a great texture and wasn't over or under done.  The food even tasted great reheated as leftovers.
author: Chase H.

description:
Not Yum Yum!

Ordered delivery.  Quoted 1 hour, came in 25 min!  Love it when businesses do that - underpromise and overdeliver always makes me happy.

Wor Wonton Soup - broth is just okay.  Shrimps floating around were overcooked, chicken tasteless.  Wontons had large grounded chunks of meat inside - didn't like the taste or texture.  The meat floating around (like the pork and chicken) tasted like they cooked it a while ago separate from the soup and just threw it in there last minute before packaging it for delivery.  Soup doesn't have any form of yummy smell to it either.

Chicken with mixed vegetables in light sauce - dissapointing.  Chicken was rubbery chunks of dark meat - my fault for not specifying/asking if i could get white meat in my starving rage when ordering.  Sauce was alright, but had a distinct chemical taste to it which ruined the flavor - i suspect msg overload, esp now w/ my stomach not so happy.  Half the veggies were good, half were too soggy in the sauce.

Nothing terrible to mention, just that I was dissapointed with both dishes I ordered since you can get these things elsewhere that actually taste yummy!  And the fact that I am seriously considering throwing out my leftovers really says that I do not like this food enough to eat it again when I'm hungry.  So I will not be getting food from here again, and wouldn't recommend this place.

Try Wok Shop cafe for delivery/take out - I ordered pick up from them for chicken and vegetables not too long ago, and it was really, really good!  So as of now they are my go-to for chinese in pac heights.
author: Ali G.

description:
This place gets five stars not because it is the most spectacular Chinese food ever (it isn't) but because it does exactly what it is supposed to... deliver hot, tasty American-Chinese food promptly and for a reasonable price, with no screwups.  

Egg rolls?  Crispy and delicious, check, ample sweet and sour, check.
Orange chicken?  Neither sticky nor soggy, good quality meat, actual orange peel in the sauce.
Hot and sour soup?  Above average, delivered in generous quantity and still hot.  We were glad we ordered two.....mmm leftovers.
Noodles? Buttery and just greasy enough, crunchy fresh veggies mixed in.
Free side of chow mein or fried rice with two entrees?  BONUS.
Sweet, geeky teenage delivery boy? BONUS.
Chinese feast for three (with enough leftovers for three days) plus delivery?  $40

We'll be back... well actually, geeky delivery boy will be back to our apartment.
author: Marie K.

description:
Holy crap.  A giant 80 pound bag of Chinese food delivered to my door TWENTY MINUTES after I call for less than $40?
What the hell is this place?  
Even Round Table pizza takes 45 damn minutes.
It makes me think it must be sitting back there hanging out, but you know what, who cares?!
In fact, they were TOO fast.  I ordered early thinking it would take ages and if I timed it just right the food would get here right around the time my sweetie did, but the food showed up long before he did.
All that and the food is good to boot.  I have a new go to!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I don't know about this place. It's pretty convienent as a good friend of mine lives down the street. The hot and sour soup was pretty quality and I was enjoying my chicken until I found like some sort of piece of plastic in it (WHAT?).  The chicken fried rice is good and the egg rolls are pretty tasty as well.  

The service was friendly and fast, too.  Sadly, I probably won't be back, but am sure there's tons of other good Chinese food in the city.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Disclaimer: this is a review of a Chinese restaurant, not of an AA meeting.

I don't mix beer and hard alcohol.
I don't do happy hours with my coworkers.
I never, ever do anything that's called ___bombs (at least since 2002). 
I never drink without putting some food in my stomach first.
I never drink any mixed drinks made of non-top shelf liquer. 

....All this wisdom was obtained through close to a couple of decades of solid drinking experiences (we start drinking very young in my home country, OK? I mean, very young) to avoid the unbearable pain called hangover the morning after.

But why, why, why, did I do all of the above this Friday??? 

Didn't I learn never to do anything out of my style/character?

WTF was I thinking, killing car bombs with 20 somethings?

Needless to say, I woke up with a horrific hangover. In an attempt to put something in my stomach to ease the pain, I opened the fridge just to find a bottle of Thai chili sauce, milk, butter, 1/2 onions, and rockfort cheese....

I miserably crawled towards my laptop and logged on to Yelp. I clicked "Find Reviewes" to identify any restaurant that would deliver me a bowl of soup at 11:12 in the morning. 

Yum Yum Hunan, that is. They, together with Yelp's sophisticated search functions, saved my life this Saturday. Within half an hour, 20lbs of warm Chinese food was delivered to my apartment before noon. ----Priceless. 

I almost wept sucking down the warm seaweed soup. Seriously. As for the food quality - I mean, this is your typical delivery Chinese food, and it tasted like one. If I were to rate this place solely based on the food quality, it would have gotten a lower rating. But the point here is, they accomodate your very desperate and selfish needs for a very reasonable price. For those who place more importance on quantity over quality, this place will deliver. They gave me a free Chow Main. As I said earlier, the bag weighted almost 20 lbs...that's a lot of food for about $30. The service is courteous and efficient. 

Bookmark now. I know you will have one of these painful mornings that will require a warm soup.
author: Nana N.

description: I've ordered delivery from them at least five times in the past five weeks. Addicted? Possibly. And now that I've mentioned it, I'm craving chicken chow fun. I would give them five stars but I've peeped at my husband's order and they've overdone it with filler ingredients on some of the pricier dishes (tons of peanuts, sprouts, watercrests, etc.). But the cheap prices, the quick delivery and the delicious chow fun that lasts me for three days keeps me coming back.
author: Teal C.

description:
I have been a fan of this place since the kitchen staff was over at Yum Yums on Valencia. I drive the extra distance and it is so worth it. 

This is the best chinese food ever!!!
author: Jonathan S.

description:
