The man who (as far as I can tell) owns/runs this place is incredibly kind, and cares a lot about keeping you and your table happy. On top of his cordial service, YYH offers close to 100 dishes, many of which are vegetarian, and vegan.

The portions are huge! Two dishes could easily feed three or four people depending on your appetites. Even the appetizers are generously plated - to reiterate Bri L's review, the potstickers alone could serve as a meal if you're looking to save a couple bucks. In fact, I did just that yesterday.
author: Alex C.

description:
I loved Hunan China and I loved Yum Yum House. I was sorry to see them disappear. Have the two restaurants merged? Yum Yum Hunan is the best of both restaurants! I don't know who was the genius behind this but I am so happy they are nearby. 

I have eaten in once and had delivery twice. Everything is delicious and inexpensive. THEY HAVE BROWN RICE! Delivery is fast. 

Hooray!
author: Mitsi M.

description:
Yum Yum's name is a perfect fit. Consistent good quality, fast delivery and great price. 

Possibly the best Chinese delivery we have had. We live in the Inner Richmond and have tried MANY different Chinese restaurants. More than I can recall.  

They do all the traditional dishes, plus many original creations. Try the Lovers Shrimp or the Yum Yum Delicatessen, both winners. Good egg roll, pork fried rice (not oily), broccoli beef is tender.

And we like that you get free chow mein or fried rice when ordering only 2 entrees for delivery. Makes it easy and less expensive to please the whole family, kids and neighbors.

With so many for-to-go options, it's nice to find one I have no qualms about calling again & again.

Glad we "found" out about Yum Yum. Now you know about them too.
author: Matthew C.

description: Amazing food. I have tried take out which only took 6 minutes to prepare and dine in which came out almost instantly . There mongolian chicken off the chain. As well as sesame chicken. I really really enjoy there lover and cashew walnut prawns and they have a new take on crab rangoon. I love it as well as my dog who I feed to her for treats. GREAT FOOD FAST AND AMAZING PRICES. Portions are big. Friendly staff
author: Jen L.

description: "Great place! Was looking for Chinese and came after reading yelp reviews. Great taste and value!"
author: M B.

description: 5-stars for this being my go-to place for typical,"im craving greasy unhealthy chinese food and don't care bad it is for me" nights. That being said, the seczhuan beef is amazing. the orange chicken is amazing. the chow main is amazing. hell, i actually dont think i've had anything bad here! My all time favorite thing though is the mongolian chicken. i will not order from here unless that's included in my order haha. They are SO FAST on the delivery and its always piping hot!
author: Danielle R.

description:
Thanks Yelp for getting us to try Yum Yum. We had walked past this restaurant a thousand time because for walking-distance Chinese we would just go to Eliza's. We are so glad we now know because their food feels very healthy and fresh. And they deliver!!!!!!
Our last delivery order was spot on: Buddha's delight claypot, general tsao chicken and vegetable fried rice. $20.
The décor is nice with white table cloth but is nothing special unlike Eliza's. However so far we haven't had to wait at lunchtime.
author: Elsa T.

description:
We ordered from Yum Yum last night, and I'd say for delivery, these folks live up to their name. The guy who took our order was almost excited to hear from me, service with a smile through that phone, I tell you.

Since this was my first time with them, I played it standard -- Hot 'n' Sour Soup, General Tso's, Shrimp Fried Rice, Moo Shu Pork, and they even threw in some free Chicken Chow Mein.

The Tso's wasn't the best I've had, but everything arrived in under 45 minutes, pretty hot, and for a little shy of forty bucks. Will definitely order from them again, giving them the potsticker test... 3.5 stars for now!
author: Nish N.

description:
Irritated as hell. Was starving, and called to confirm that they delivered to our house.  They took our address, said "wait, let me check" and then came back on the line and said "yes, we deliver to your house".  We placed the order and did a happy dance for chinese food.  twenty minutes later, they call again "what's the address?"  we repeat it. "oh, we don't deliver there."

WTF? I called specifically to confirm, but no - they refused.

So yeah, if you're planning on delivery, call first, and be sure to confirm and triple-confirm your address.  I didn't think PacHeights to SOMA was a dealbreaker, but apparently it is.
author: Lis W.

description:
Oh Nuh Uh!

I had just today told my Sweetie that finally I was learning to like Chinese food (a special shout out & a thx to Nan King Road Bistro for making that possible). We like to occasionally order in on Sunday nights & got flyered by YYH. Their menu was appealing so we thought to give them a try.
Note: they have free chow mein or fried rice with a purchase of 2 entrees. The man who took my order was nice. The food came fast too.
We ordered: dim sum sampler (I give it 1 out of 5 stars), apps sampler (the Crab Rangoon and potstickers were a 3 out of 5, but the fried shrimp and the egg roll were beyond greasy, with an aftertaste.. negative two stars). The chow mein was decent, though bland. The Peking duck was overcooked, I couldn't even eat it. The veggie delight had a good selection but was then drenched in that nebulous Chinese cornstarch sauce, a viscous phlegmy mess.. 
After dinner (which neither of us finished), I realized that it's Chinese food like This that made me despise it in the first place. We didn't even keep the leftovers, which made me sad- I hate to waste. However, the fortunes in the cookies were auspicious.

Pros: Free chow mein, nice guy on phone, fast delivery, good fortunes.
Cons: The food.

Yuk Yuk Hunan- good for diet, bad for me.
author: Rachel D.

description:
YES This is the same Yum Yum's that was on Valencia...and YES the chef is the same!!! 
I live in the mission and would order delivery from Yum Yum's at least once a week. When Yum Yum's in the Mission closed I ordered from the place that took their number. Not the same, Not the same chef, and Not the same quality. 
Well tonight I was driving on Divisadero and we passed Yum Yum's!!!! It was so great to see James and the gang. 

Ordered: String Beans, Five Flavored Chicken, and Walnut Prawns.
Unbelievable...

There is no better chinese in the city.
author: Teresa J.

description:
Rather bland, if you ask me.

We ordered from here because we decided to try other places in the neighborhood before picking a favorite delivery spot, and this was a huge disappointment.

I'm a vegetarian so I love meatless chicken options and we tried the General Tsao's dish, which though decent in flavor arrived a bit cold and on a bed of overcooked broccoli with no additional sauce apart from what clung to the squishy soggy breading on the "chicken" and was overall blah. Tried the Veggie Delight - bland as can be! Tried the Veggie Chow Mein - bland as can be. Tried the Hot and Sour soup - SO oily! Tried the Veggie Egg Rolls - okay fine, these were passable but this isn't hard to get right.

Though it arrived quickly, I may have preferred if it hadn't arrived at all so that I could have had an excuse to make a call to the best delivery place we have tried: Tai Chi. Now THAT's good delivery!
author: Abby Z.

description: I ordered from Yum Yum tonight for delivery. I ordered the mongolian beef and kung pao chicken. Both entrees are in the trash. I took one bite of both and had to spit it out in the sink.  Even the chicken fried rice was bad - the chicken was chewy and again, I had to spit it out. I will not be ordering from here again.
author: Allison S.

description:
Come here for some super bomb and apparently really healthy Chinese food.  Especially if you are a vegetarian.  

My girl got the meatless chicken cause she doesn't eat real chicken and when she tried it she thought she had accidentally been served real chicken cause nothing fake could taste that good.  I had to verify that her chicken was indeed fake although I must admit was pretty delicious.

My meal however was the Five Flavor Real Chicken and it was amazing.  Haven't tried anything else but after these two entrees I'm not sure how anyone could say this place was bland.

Bonus points:
Quantitiy:  Filled me up for dinner and then again for lunch the next day.
Price: Two entrees, chow mein and rice for under $25.
Name: Who doesn't like saying Yum Yum Hunan.
Came in a biodegradable container.

So why not five stars.  Both my girl and I got the exact same fortune.  Such a let down after such a great meal.
author: Ryan C.

description: Yum Yum Hunan has some pretty good Shangai noodles. I haven't tried much of their other plates but I'll be sure to check out their other items. The night I came here it was pretty dead but there were a ton of phone orders. Maybe this place is good for to-go orders?
author: Edgar G.

description:
I wish I could give this a slightly higher rating just for service and cleanliness, but alas I'm unable to award half a star to bring it up to a 3.5.

The peking duck was nicely done and flavorful, accompanied by four fluffy buns, but we were a little disappointed by how little scallion they sent us away with.  The drunken beef with celery, mushrooms and snow peas tasted fairly healthy, but the sauce wasn't spectacular.  I slathered the soft pieces of beef in sriracha, as is my custom with mild foods.  The complimentary noodle dish was a winner!  For dinner, you either receive a free fried rice or chow mein with the purchase of two entrees.  They were nice enough to accomodate a change to chow fun.

All in all, I think this is a fine establishment and definitely a bargain for this area!
author: Janet L.

description: This place rulz. Their walnut prawn, is like Tony Montana in your MOUTH
author: Stephen B.

description:
This is THE BEST Chinese food in San Francisco.  
We mourned the loss of Yum Yum when their lease ran out on Valencia.  We celebrated madly when we found them at their new location on Divisadero.  The new place is more commodious and WAY nicer than any other decent Chinese restaurant in the city -- save Brandy Ho's North Beach location.  I prefer Yum Yum to B.H., though.

Vegetarians and veggie friendly/open types -- RUN here!!!  Every time we go we have to order Kung Pao Tofu, Szechuan String Beans, Garlic Eggplant and several more purely vegie dishes.  Even the meat-lovers we bring sing the praises of the vegetarian fare.  Vegans and Vegetarians get this strange look on their faces....one that I've seen on people who get their first view of Yosemite valley from atop half dome, taste gandiua gelato in Florence for the first time, and come home from one of those rare and magical first dates....ah! yeah, that's it...they get stars in their eyes.

Fish lovers rejoice -- the whole fish is to die for.  The lightly breaded and perfectly deep fried fish can reach near-orgasmic heights of intensity --no grease, just light, crunchy bites of cloud-like heaven ;-)

I can't speak to pork/beef dishes, but they've gotta' be great.  

Even though they do a brisk take-out biz, I highly recommend eating in.  Nothing beats fresh hot Yum Yum....but do order enough for left-overs....even day-old, microwaved Yum Yum is nice and comforting...especially if accompanied by an old Woody Allen flick?!? ...besides, it reminds one of the ethereal experiences of the previous night.
author: Scott C.

description:
Formerly known as Hunan China, it feels as if there's been a lot of revamping.

From:
-a new green awning with white font
-the interior (now a mustard yellow type color with white trim)
-more indoor plants
-perhaps new tables and chairs
-new tea pots
I could go on...but...AN ALTOGETHER CLEANER FEEL. 

A new menu item I did see: Mango Chicken (decent). 

Lunch is only served until 3pm. I believe the lunch special is only for weekdays.

What you get for SIX BUCKS: soup of the day (today was sweet and sour), entree with your choice of side (steamed rice, fried rice, brown rice or chow mein), eggroll, some sort of frumpy salad, and hot tea.

I did spot that they do serve Sierra Nevada for $3. Awesome.
author: Ileana H.

description:
The name really says it all.

Not sure if "yum yum" means something else in Chinese language, but here in America it is a bold assertion that people will instinctively want to disbelieve. But believe they shall in one visit or less--in case someone happens to be sidewalking by and catch the savory scent on one of the afternoons they have the door open.

The place is cute, a warm and inviting little spot that is easy to miss if you're not paying close attention on Divisadero. Always liberal on available seating, I hope their deliveries are enough to support this restaurant; it would be a foul shame on us as residents to let it wither.

Anyway, the food is what counts, and after 4 visits, I have never left hungry, disappointed, nor broke. So many selections offer meatless versions of traditionally meat-centric dishes that carnivores and herbivores can be fed in about equal measure. Honestly, some of the meatless numbers, such as the Sesame 'Meatless Chicken', taste as good or better than their mimicked counterpart, and have had me questioning if in fact it really is meatless (which it is).

Of note should be their lunch specials, which are fantastic deals. Five and a half dollars will net you a giant plate of entree, rice, egg roll, and a soup that is so good, my mouth waters so profusely it interferes with my blowing the heat from it, or at least has me fear for blowing 98.6 degree saliva into the spoon and cup. Amazing food and value, that's what I'm saying.

So be sure to stop by and support this lovely little house of Yum, or at least call to have it delivered, but know that you're missing half the charm.
author: Aaron H.

description: Very good. And its easeir and less busy than Eliza's, but just as good!
author: Adrian B.

description:
As far as Americanized Chinese foods go, this place is...here.  It has some lovely things that I would never have ordered were it not for the reviews on this site, and then it had some things that I craved which were also mentioned on this site.  Let's start off with the good news, shall we?

Crab Rangoon - 5 stars, delicious, star shaped generous filling.  I would never have order this except one of the reviews here talked about it and I am very very glad I did.  It's a good execution of Crab Rangoon even if it may be crab-less.

Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings Entree - 5 Stars.  Came on a bed of shredded lettuce with jalapeno, peppers, some other stuff.  Batter was tasty and seasoned.  A bit heavy, but that's like saying the cone shape of carrots detracts from the taste.  

Ma Po ToFu - 3 stars.  Ths sauce was not undelicious, and the flavor was not offensive.  My preferance is for it to be made with soft tofu whereas this was made with medium or firm.

Buddha's Delight Vegetable Clay Pot - 3 stars.  The taste was rather fresh.  I enjoyed the thin glass noodles at the bottom and the pleasing array of veg, wood ear mushroom, and tofu.  Again, I would have like soft tofu, not medium or firm.  

Pork Chow Mein - 5 stars because it was FREE!!  I ordered so much food that my tummy is groaning right now.  Maybe tomorrow after the laxative eat works its magic, I'll have some.  But for now, Chinese food:1, Christina:0.

Let's talk about the lovely young man who delivered it.  He was so considerate and concerned that my apartment door would close and lock me out (it does and did), he voiced his concern.  Ah.  What a nice young man.

Final thoughts: I've come to the conclusion that ordering chinese food as a chinese person who does not live in NYC is like eating at a cafeteria (maybe even a public school cafeteria) after having grown up on home cooking, on the farm, grandmother makes her own bread, cooks her own jellies.  I'm not disappointed because that would be like being disappointed that watermelons are not poisonous.  I am merely...enlightened.  And I know that for $36 I have enough food to last me the rest of the week through finals, if only I can bring myself to eat it.
author: Christina C.

description:
Look. I am just.. way too stoked about this to be funny right now.. 

I guess they've been open now for ten days and nobody's noticed yet, but according to the manager here, THE WHOLE kitchen staff from Yum Yum House on Valencia came over to this new Divisadero location..

Same cute font! Same menu! Same free delivery.. They even do the free fried rice or chow mein deal for dinner delivery.. 

This is.. just.. awesome.. I have to go get some water and calm down..
author: Missy B.

description:
Friday night.  Hungry. Lazy.  Needed a little help from Yelp to get me some Chinese delivery.

Staff was courteous on the phone & our order was delivered quickly.  For the price, we were surprised at the amount of food we had.  Things were looking good...

The food was edible, but not good by any means.  We had the crab rangoon which was good, not the best I've had but okay.  We had two dishes, the Garlic Chicken and the Kung Pao Chicken, both having similar issues.  Aside from the peanuts in the Kung Pao, the dishes were virtually indistinguishable.  Both lacked in flavor and had a very watery sauce, very watery.  They were also a little on the greasy side.  I finished about a quarter of mine and the man of the house (who eats like a machine) finished about half.  Hoping to find a go-to Chinese delivery place in the city, but this is not the one.
author: Erin H.

description:
The spot to eat if your craving a relatively healthy, hearty, and great priced Chinese lunch. The plates come with sides of soup,  a small salad and even an egg roll all for under $8. You can even ask to substitute the white rice for yummy brown rice. This place serves great guilt free food that'll leave you saying "yum yum." 

Being a hop, skip, and jump away from my work deserves 4 solid stars.
author: John S.

description: Got the Garlic Chicken lunch special.  Hot and Sour soup was good, though not the best I've ever had.  Came with some fried won tons (no meat) which were nice, though a bit salty.  Sauce was very good and nice amount and quality of chicken.  Vegetables consisted of zucchini, red onion, green onion, and mushrooms (which I would ask to leave off next time.)  Place is very clean, water refill service was attentive, service fast, nice classy square plates.  Fairly uncrowded at 11:30 on a Wednesday.  I would return to try some of their other items.  Good fortune cookie and nice toothpick quality.
author: Marc S.

description:
"07/19/08 (Saturday):

YUM YUM YUMMY get in my tummy!  

I ordered the "Garlic Chicken."  My girlfriend ordered the "Beef with Tofu."  Both were lunch specials, which was great especially since it was a Saturday.

We both got complimentary hot-and-sour soup to start off the meals.  They were okay.  I thought the soup was a little watered down, but it surprisingly was still spicy.

When our meals came out, we each had a full plate that came with a side of rice, egg roll, side salad and our main entree.

I really liked my Garlic Chicken.  The chicken itself was pretty good.  The thing I liked MOST was the fact that the Garlic Chicken came with fresh vegetables.  

Let me emphasize the fresh vegetables.  These weren't your pre-packaged, frozen, perfectly cut vegetables.  These were definitely freshly cut and cooked today.  It included green onions, mushrooms, zucchini and carrots.  It was a very colorful meal.  I actually came here on Friday too for my first time and ordered their "Cashew Chicken."  Their Cashew Chicken was just as good, but also came with heads of broccoli mixed in as part of the vegetables.

Totally enjoyable meal.  My girlfriend liked her Beef with Tofu, but couldn't finish it so brought the leftovers home.  Honestly, the portions are very large.

Best part...the price.  With tax, each entree came out to $6 even.  So lunch for the both of us today came out to be an even $12.

Amazing.  I will definitely be back for lunch again soon.

Positives:
1.  Lunch specials (even on Saturday)
2.  Large Portions
3.  Fresh vegetables in meal
4.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating
5.  Interior is decorated well and appears very clean
6.  They deliver

Negatives:
To be honest, I can't think of any as of now.  If I find some later, I'll update this, but so far so good.
author: Ben W.

description:
Finally, I try somewhere I have had bookmarked forever. I would like to Holla at Rita C. for suggesting this place weeks ago. I wish I would have heeded her advice earlier because this place is really good. 

The food was yum, yum and then some. And on top of that it was Hunan. The name really does sum the place up. I went with a friend after happy hour at Fishbowl and we couldn't have been happier. We ordered the appetizer platter that came with pot stickers, egg rolls, crab ragoon, and some shrimp thing. We also got sesame chicken, Mongolian beef and Kung Pao fried rice. All of it was amazing. I want to come back and try more of their menu. It was so damn good. 

Yum Yum is up there on my list of favorite Chinese places for sure. Thanks Rita!
author: Bobby P.

description: This place was wonderful! Amazing atmosphere, fast and friendly service as well as delicious food! The vegetable rolls are the best I've had and the chicken was fresh and tasted great.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Wish we had one in L.A.! 

For a late lunch, we drove by and found this spot. We decided to try the The Five Flavor chicken - it  was delicious! We had the fried rice and basil beef - so good! We also ordered the sesame scallops and some appetizers. We had leftovers for a party of four,  and took the rest to go (asked for some forks & they even gave us more fortune cookies!) After hanging out at the Exploratorium for a while we scarfed the rest down before leaving to catch our flight home. 

Good food, and not at all oily. Will be back next time we are in town!
author: Leslie K.

description:
I used their takeout and have eaten at the restaurant. Food comes out  fairly quick and the servers are nice.

Things I crave from Yum Yum:
Lemon chicken
Walnut shrimp
Hunan shrimp
drunken beef
fried rice
veggie chow mein

the list goes on...

Almost anything I order is great. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the green onion pancake.
author: Kris B.

description: This is my go-to delivery Chinee foo spot. I live down the street and around the corner from this place and I have never been inside there. I just order their food for delivery whenever I am craving some deliciously piping hot Chinese food for my lazy, tired ass. In 30 minutes or less, I have lived here for 17 years and I must say that I always get the best Chinee foo delivery experience I have ever had in SF from this place! Not only is the food tasty but they put tons of fresh, not overly cooked vegetables in each dish. My msg radar doesn't go off so I don't have cotton mouth afterwards and the portions are insanely huge--all huge pluses. Yum Yum Hunan is the best Chinee foo delivery in SF.
author: M L.

description:
Same great Yum Yum's that was loved on Valencia St.

I ate fried food for dinner with white rice and LOVED every bite!  
Last night, I was reunited with their Crab Rangoon, Sesame Chicken and Walnut Prawns ($25 check).

I also recommend their Basil Tofu and Mango Chicken.

Extremely friendly service!  Nice to see some of the same familiar faces.
author: TC C.

description:
I've been shopping around since being appalled at Big Lantern's (complete lack of) customer service, and this is the first delivery place I gave a try.  Not amazingly impressed.

I have to agree with the perspective that this is Panda Express style food.  I give them serious props about the veggie options and they were friendly and fast.

My search continues.
author: Nelson A.

description: You know when you are watching Blade Runner and you see Deckard eating noodles and you think...damn I want some Chinese food? Well...this place gets the job done. It's yummy, cheap, and the staff is super friendly. I personally couldn't ask for a whole lot more.
author: Cassandra S.

description:
Fast delivery... 
Kungo Pao Fried Rice (too many peanuts)
Great meatless orange chicken!  
Spoke English, yeah!
author: Kindra W.

description:
This place is one of my top 3 lunch places when I'm at work, and number 1 for takeout.

The hunan fish ($6.50) is my standbye, but I'm all about exploring their options too.
author: Gopal R.

description:
Its between this place and Tai Chi for chinese delivery for me.  (I haven't actually ever been there)  

As many others have said, the mongolian lamb is amazing; it has great flavor.  They also do the classic dishes great such as their crab rangoon or sesame chicken.
author: King D M.

description:
Szechuan broccoli $7.95 fantastic.  I love the sauce.  I drizzle it on my rice.
Walnut prawns $10 not too bad.  First time having this dish.  I didn't know it was deep fried AND had mayo.  Wouldn't order it next time.  13 prawns.  
Free vegie fried rice.  $23 with delivery and tip.  Same nice young man in glasses.

Solid place and just as good second time around.  Very happy I have a Chinese place I can count on time and again and hopefully for many more years to come.
author: Mrs F.

description:
Yummy food, slummy service... 

The vegetarian chicken I ordered was delicious and the prices were reasonable. I would definitely say this is a lunch place disguised as a dinner place. 

The service was terrible. The waiter practically ignored me and walked away while was still trying to communicate that I wanted chop stix. He then threw the chop stix on the table.
author: Brian K.

description: Ever since I lost my favorite General Cho's Chicken place, Fu Wah on Haight, I've been searching for a replacement (the sit-down part, not the take-away at the front). In fact, every time I try a new Chinese Food place, I go straight for "the General" only to be served soggy lumps of disappointment. Fu Wah deserves mentioning because the General's chicken always came out crispy, with a tangy, spicy sauce that couldn't be beat. The closest I've had is the spicy chicken at San Tungs, but my other favorite is Yum Yum. Here, it comes in the form of Sesame Chicken, but that's just fine. The sauce isn't the same (it's good), but the chicken is crispy, and that seems to be the challenge. Add to that some sesame seeds, the fact that it's remarkably cheap and has excellent, friendly service and you've got a winner. (I'll always miss you Fu Wah)
author: Rich M.

description: Good lunch spot. I love that their food comes out piping hot. Mongolian beef and szechuan broccoli were yum!
author: Jessica P.

description:
I only tasted one dish, so I can't really judge the food overall. The mongolian beef was decent, though. 
Big portions, timely service, decent prices. 
But what I really like about this place is how nice the people are! I visited this restaurant with a huge group of people: 13ish, maybe? That's much more than they have room for [without splitting us up.] But it was maybe 5pm-ish, so before any dinner rush, and the place was pretty empty. They actually rearranged the tables and allowed us to squeeze as many chairs in as we wanted. And then they carried out as many sets of dishes/chopsticks as we needed, patiently waited for all of us to decide what to order, and took our orders without missing a single one. The staff was very courteous and pleasant the whole time, even with a crowd of teenagers who ended up paying the bill with a stack of rumpled bills. I definitely think this is a good place to return to!
author: Delia Z.

description: I don't know why my boyfriend keeps ordering from here...everything is brown, soaking in cornstarch and way greasier than "real" authentic Chinese food. The food is also far from fresh and barely recognizable. Moving on!
author: Keira R.

description: GARBAGE would be too nice in describing this place.  Seriously, unreal bad. Not only did the food taste horrible, but it took over 2 hours to be delivered.  What a joke.
author: josh g.

description:
That episode of "Curb your Enthusiasm" where Larry gets shorted on his Kung pao Shrimp was on and had me jonesing for some KPS of my own. So I busted out iPhone yelp and in the stats for best kungpao based on my location. Abacas looks good but yum yum had the single "$" and you knoww. I was surprised the quality because single "$" places can be a gamble. In the end I'm not much of Kung pao guy but the ingredients were top quality. I got the veggie delight which was full of broccoli and zuchini and tomatos (love it when I get Tomatos in my veggies) and SnowPeas leeks lightly oiled and seasoned with garlic. 

So great 1st experience. The menu looks really interesting. With fake chicken and brown rice. I'll be back.

Damn -getting rehungry just writing this review. Luckily there are plenty of leftovers
 Oh. and P.S. 11prawns
No lies just love
author: Jacky J.

description: I work a couple of doors down and I first came here when it was still Hunan China.  I mainly only order the soups here.  The food here is pretty good and their lunch specials are CHEAP.  Under the new ownership I don't know if anything has changed.. except that some of the large soups are 55 cents more expensive and they're not as salty.. which is good for most people but I like my food insanely salty.. and this is my only go-to place for soup when I'm working.  Also there's some new staff and they are very friendly.. definitely friendlier than the previous staff.  OH!  Also there's no more annoying $10 minimum charge!  (Soups only go up to $6.50).  Instead it's a "six to seven dollar minimum charge."
author: Vivian H.

description:
THANK THE LORD!!! yum yums is back. i was never able to find a chinese delivery that came to par with these guys. i went chinese-less since they closed up shop in the mission. 

I ordered delivery last week  @ 10:30pm and they came in 30 min! whoo hoo.

i order......
potstickers- my favorite!
sesame chicken- great 
vege fried rice!

yum yum is DOUBLE YUM!
author: SF Blondie B.

description:
Yum Yum, you had me at 'Meatless General Tso's Chicken.'

I have always loved General Tso's Chicken, but since I decided to stop eating meat, I've had few vegetarian alternatives at Chinese restaurants that can really measure up.  But Yum Yum Hunan has come through for me ... and I actually prefer the meatless version to the original because it has a much more consistent and less questionable texture.

It's possible this restaurant may not have the most authentic Chinese cuisine, but I'm okay with that ... what's important to me is that it tastes yummy, as the name suggests.  And if you can make it during the day, the lunch specials are an undeniable value, starting with really delicious hot and sour soup and a healthy portion of whatever entree you choose.

On top of that, the interior is actually quite pleasant and comfortable, the service is incredibly friendly and efficient, and I always get fantastic fortunes at the end of the meal.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Arguably, this could be the healthiest Chinese joint around. How convenient since that healthy bit could suck in the lunch crowd from UCSF-Mt ZION, a mere two blocks away. What can you say about a Chinese restaurant where most popular dish mentioned is Meatless Chicken? It's not very old school, and the dinner prices are moderate at best. The non-seafood stuff averages $8. Lunch specials are $6, not a bad hook.

Dinner order:
Wor Won Ton soup - won tons were so-so, lots of veggies, could use more meat & shrimp, broth was awesome!

Sauteed veggies with salmon - salmon cut into small hunks, wked with various veggies, onions, celery, zucchini, snow peas. Sauce was basically black bean, very flavorful, but just enough to coat the veggies & fish... leaving your helping of rice on its own.

Seafood Mix with Veggies: Scallops & Shrimp, sauteed with water chestnuts, black mushrooms, snow peas, others, in a sparse, bland, translucent sauce. Pass the soy sauce & hot oil.

Salted Spicey Spareribs: Thinly sliced pork chop pieces lightly coated with flour & fried. Served with sliced hot peppers and salted. Tasted excellent, but just not very generous.

The food is very good. The service is very good and friendly, that's a big plus. You can't mess with $6 lunch specials. They deliver in the morning. Dinner portions could be larger. Hunan is not my personal preference. I like sauces that can flavor my portion of rice.

Would I return? It's in my old hood, my old stomping grounds... Mom likes the place... sure I would.
author: Rick V.

description:
I had become a fan of this restaurant, my fav. Crab rangoon and my undying love of anything soupy particularly seafood. 

It's cheap, fast, yummy, clean and the service is good. Trust me when you are working in the hospital, every minute counts.

I feel bad though, coz I always drag my Secretary to come eat with me. I have a tiny stomache, & she helps me finished what I order. No wonder, Mr gain weight :(
author: jubi l.

description: Went with the STARS and was not dissappointed! The free fried rice with big slices of zucchini rocks! Salt & Pepper prawns, perfect, 5-Spice Chicken ... flavorful. The Hot & Sour Soup ... not very impressed.
author: CatherineLouise A.

description:
Quality of food is very high, clean, a little too casual. I'm not a big fan of  staff having loud conversations while I'm eating. Am I at the fish market?

The food is crisp and well executed, not the typical Cantonese plate of saucy corn starch.

I know... I'm a pompous bitch.
author: Pandora B.

description: Best Kung Pao Tofu in Pac Heights! Has a really great balance if fresh veggies, tofu, and peanuts. All the other dishes I've tried have also been great! Less greasy than most places and TONS of meatless options! They deliver in under 30 minutes!
author: Lizzie L.

description: They serve a decent chow fun and their sunflower chicken is what i would call a hot salad (not the good hot). Overall I HAD A Ho Hum experience.
author: Akshay K.

description:
Some friends and I ordered take out from Yum Yum last night and we were not disappointed. It was moderately priced with huge portions. I ordered a shrimp dish with vegetarian rice and they both were very tasteful. They delivery guy was fast and friendly. 

I highly recommend Yum Yum Hunan, especially if you want something quick and affordable for a large group. 

You'll have leftovers.
author: Shel Z.

description: What kind of chinese food place doesn't include rice with an entree? It's not listed on their site or on Grubhub either. Never in my life have I encountered this. So now I have to a) wait and cook my own, b) still not eat, go back and buy some? Likely not going back, was not very impressed with the orange chicken I ordered either.
author: Eric B.

description:
Yummy for Your Tummy.

The name fits the food. Great Mix Veggies, house fried rice, and chow mein.  The delivery time is quick and the price is reasonable, if not unpriced. The only thing I disliked is the hot sauce they mix in their food to create hot dishes. It is kinda yucky! I opted to just add my own hot sauce later. Good Food.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description:
Yum Yum is my "eating my feelings" food favorite. On those awful days at work, I come home and my husband just sees the look on my face and hands me the Yum Yum Hunan menu.  I already know exactly what i'm going to order, but look at it again anyway.

The food is SO tasty and cheap-- and FAST that its a no brainer. Tons of food in each entree-- so much so there is always leftovers. Their meatless chicken is effing awesome for quality/texture and so delicious! With 2 entrees, you can get free fried rice or lo mein. My husband loves that.

Its seriously cheaper to eat here than to cook at home, if you can believe it. So my guilt for eating out is at least diminished.
author: maranda w.

description: ehh, if you're idea of Chinesse food is greasy Americanize, this is your spot. I was hoping for something a bit fresher. My hot and sour soup was tasteless, neither hot or sour. Luckily I dinned take-out so I could add a little sesame chile oil to it at home. The egg rolls were perfect fried yumminess though and they were generous with their portions. The restaurant looked clean, but empty on a Tuesday night at 6pm. Okay neighborhood take-out, especially if you're hungover or making your way home from a bar, but I wouldn't make a special trip here.
author: Jacqueline S.

description: I was surprised by this place, since it looks so non-descript. It's one of the best Chinese take-out joints I've had in San Francisco, and a great place for a low-key sit-down meal too. I especially love the soups and the specials. Everything spicy, especially the Hunan staples, is great. A great find for us!
author: Tian H.

description:
Ordered take-out from Yum Yum last night.  I called at 930pm and when I got there at 9:45pm, the food was ready to go.  They don't ask for your name or number or anything, but that's OK as they have call-ID, and identify your order using that.  Their restaurant smelled great and the dining atmosphere was very nice.

I ordered americanized staple food: Chow Mein, Sweet&Sour Chicken, and Broccoli Beef for $24.  I know: boring, but I wasn't feeling adventurous.  The Chow Mein was excellent and the S&S chicken was actually quite good.  They use large pieces that are heavily fried, but are more meat than dough, which is good.  The broccoli was delish' as well.  Plenty of food, I'll be eating this for at least 3 meals.

All in all the food was super quick, sorta cheap, hot, and tasty.  Would eat there again.
author: T. M. B.

description:
combo dim sum: good, shrimp dumplings, pork balls, were the best, pork buns were ok 
mandarin eggplant: not spicy like it said it would be :) 
combo chow main: not that great 
combo fried rice: much better than the noodles 
fresh OJ: goood! 
40$ish 
quick delivery 
call in order, i found the menu here, awesome app! 
http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/yum-yum-hunan/menu
author: Sataya B.

description: This place is on the short list of our go-to neighborhood takeout options, in no small measure because of their delicious faux meat entrees and the amazing veggie chow mein (which you get gratis if you order two or more entrees - yay!) I thought I'd given up lemon chicken when I became a vegetarian, but Yum Yum Hunan ensures I get my fix more often than I probably ever should.
author: Lindsay J.

description:
This review is based on the lunch special I had recently. I live nearby and had been curious to try this restaurant for a while. 

I was seated during the lunch rush. I ordered the lunch special of garlic scallops and broccoli. I was very disappointed by the food. I was almost immediately served some hot and sour soup and a pot of tea. The soup was lukewarm and bland. As for the entree, the portion size was very satisfying: a hearty serving of steamed or fried rice with a small bit of iceberg lettuce salad, a spring roll, and a large portion of the scallops and broccoli. While I felt there was a good amount of scallop in my dish, it was saturated in a cloyingly sweet, heavy sauce and was not garlicky. The spring roll was good but the salad was kind of pointless and dressed in a very sweet dressing that tasted similar to the scallop dish sauce. I wanted lunch not dessert!

The restaurant was really busy so the server took some time to clear my soup bowl, bring me my entree, and get me the check. 

Given the generally positive reviews for Yum Yum, I feel like I should give this place another chance. I at least know never to order the garlic scallops and broccoli again.
author: Jenny K.

description:
OK peeps...

I've tried this place several times now because friends have insisted that it's good.

Go for the $6 lunch specials because it is SIX DOLLARS.

Go because you want a LOT of food for six dollars.

Go because they are FAST during lunch.  And friendly.

Don't go because you're looking for authentic Chinese food.  

Because it's really not...  

It really belongs in the Panda Express category.  Actually, come to think of it, I prefer Panda over this place.  That is, if I'm in the mood for non-Chinese Chinese food...

p.s. - I don't know who started the rumor that they don't put MSG in their food.  They most definitely do.  Enough to give an asian gal who has never felt symptoms of MSG a really, really weird headache...
author: Linda C.

description: Another Yelp discovery that paid off in deliciousness.  This restaurant concocts fine examples of yummy central Chinese dishes.  The ambience is simple but more contemporary and thoughtful than you get at most Chinatown digs.  Therefore, the lack of harsh fluorescent lighting and dingy walls will leave you forgetting you are in a moderately priced Chinese restaurant and remind you that you are actually in Pac Heights without the price tag.  Nothing out of the ordinary on the menu - but expect some good, reliable, well crafted, Chinese comfort food.
author: Randy C.

description: Horrible food by Sf standards.  Totally insipid.
author: Praveen P.

description:
so... I hate to have to demote this place, but I've sort of moved on. I think I was just so elated by the friendly staff, quick delivery, and seemingly fresh nature of the food that I forgot about the drawbacks. Just two stand out- 
1. I don't understand where the "chicken" comes from that makes it so bizarrely shaped, fatty, and not that tasty. I wish it were more affordable for places like this to impliment the use of local, free-range, healthy animals. 
2. I found a few... hairs... in my food that were... well, let's just put it this way. I've worked in kitchens, I get that not everyone wears a hairnet and it's only natural to loose hair. But, this wasn't that kind of hair... hrm.
author: R J.

description: Decent Chinese delivery. Good chicken corn soup, reckless use of brown sauce on cooked dishes.
author: Janie W.

description: Big portions and the Orange Chicken was awesome.
author: Travis S.

description: Best Chinese restaurant in the city! Delicious, inexpensive, huge servings... May seem like brusk service but it's just super efficient.
author: Andrea P.

description:
oh Yum Yum Gods! I found you. It only took 1 YEAR and 1 MONTH. 
I've been busy over the past year. Sampling Orange Chicken near and far. Why does everyone insist on making this with soy sauce. or deep frying it til the chicken ceases to exist?

At least 10 Chinese Restaurants later, many plea's on facebook for help in finding my addiction, I discover the Valencia St. Yum Yum cooks and staff have been over on Diviz for a year! 

But I can't be mad for the delay. I found you and I can now live happily ever after with a belly full of Orange Chicken. 

The end.
author: Ty M.

description: This is my go-to Chinese Food restaurant. I usually order for delivery and my food always arrives hot and in a timely fashion. The prices are very decent and the dishes are never too greasy like most local Chinese food restaurants. I always order the Mongolian beef (which has a bit of a kick to it), Sweet and sour chicken, and wonton soup. Don't waste your time with the pot stickers or the crab rangoons.
author: Jenee Y.

description: This place is freakin delicious. I went here a few years ago, it was delicious, but I forgot about them. 2 weeks ago I was at a job site in Pacific Heights and was craving chinese. I used the Yelp app and searched chinese and this place was the closest. I called, placed my order and within 5 minutes it was ready. The mongolian beef is the second best I have ever had. Probably the best chinese food I have had in the city.
author: Darius A.

description: I feel bad because I generally will not update to go lower, but unfortunately I feel I have no choice.  I don't know if i just had a freak incident where my food was pretty decent the first time, but it is just not working anymore.  I have gone back several times in hopes that it would be as good as the first and no luck!  Everytime I eat it for lunch I feel sick afterwards and then I have to kick myself in the butt reminding myself to not go back there again.  The vegetables in the dishes are not tastey, the meat is chewey and the food is too salty.  Hopefully it does get better, but I think I have finally given up, too bad because it is so close to my work.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Was craving some healthy Chinese food and actually searched "healthy chinese" in Yelp and this place popped up.  I'm a vegetarian but also eat seafood and they had a nice selection of seafood and veggie/tofu dishes.  I went with the prawns with vegetables, miso soup and veggie dumplings.  Overall, I was happy with my order and would definitely call them up again for another I-don't-feel-like-cooking kind of night.
author: Audrey L.

description: This place has great chinese food! Apart from the constant phone ringing, due to high demand for yummy take-out it is great! I am picky about Chinese and find it is usually too bland. This food was very tasty and not oily. I will definitely order food from here and maybe come back to enjoy it at the restaurant, the ambiance isn't great, it's so so, but the food makes it worth it and they are very nice!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Tasty, cheap American-Chinese food that hits the spot.  Pretty big, too, so it can handle a big group.
author: Corey C.

description: I didn't like my dish. I ordered the sesame chicken. The chunks of "chicken" were mostly fried batter. It gave me a bit of a stomach ache, however I don't eat fried food too often. On the bright side, their service was great.
author: Daniel Y.

description: iv been to this restaurant maybe about 3 times now.. my workplace is just a couple blocks away so everytime my coworkers and I need to eat and can't think of anywhere else to go, we usually end up here. my first BAD experience was when me and my coworker called to order a pick up. we go to lunch at 12:30 so we decided to call in our order at 11:30 because if you call around 12 it gets busy. so we place our order and we tell them to have it ready by 12:30 and the guy said ok. when we get there, the owner looks at us like we were aliens from outerspace. so we tell him we ordered since 11:30 and 5 minutes later he tells us that they "forgotten" about our order.. so we decided to wait for them to cook our food..  20 minutes later they still haven't made our food but instead people were coming in (after we came) and they would receive their order within 5-10 minutes...  so we wonder why we haven't gotten our order yet.. 10 minutes later we ask them bout our order and the manager goes back to the kitchen and comes out telling us they have not started yet. my coworker and I just left there's no point in wasting our lunch time.. as we left the owner was saying sorry to us which I think was retarded because he didn't put our order on priority the first time they fucked up. one good thing bout this restaurant I's that they have a cheap lunch menu and the food is awesome! I just don't like the hot & sour soup they serve, it is tasteless!!! it seems they just added water, soy sauce and vinegar!
author: Steve S.

description: Our new favorite place for weekday "I don't wanna cook' food. It's absolutely delicious!
author: Michael D.

description: I went here because the sustainable sushi restaurant around the corner was super busy. I like their food--I've eaten there a couple of times and I would go again. It's not gourmet, but it's darn good, and the prices are very decent. I might go again the next time I'm in town!
author: Melissa S.

description: Divisadero is not a renowned street for Chinese food but Yum Yum beats expectations. With solid lunch meals on the menu, that ranged from $6-8 each, you get soup, entree, rice and fried wontons (just wrapper actually). Pretty good deal for a place around Pac Heights. I had a taste of sesame chicken and a eggplant shrimp plate, both of which were tasty and freshly made. Although it is tailored slightly to American Chinese, it still offers some traditional dishes and cooks with quality. This place will have you saying yum-yum in your tum-tum for under $10 bones!
author: Ed L.

description: Really great! We're always hard critiques when it comes to trying new places in San Francisco. This place is very good. Big fan of the hong kong chow mein. Potstickers are real good too.
author: Laureto R.

description:
So I don't know if its me or Yum Yum, but the past two times I went here, I felt sick afterward. It could be me over-eating because they do give you a LOT of food or it could be the food.

I know they have gotten a lot sloppier lately. My plate looks like someone just threw a lot of stuff on it. The rice also feels a bit old....

I keep telling myself not to go here so I won't feel sick, but sometimes I can't help it.
author: Karen B.

description:
i wanted to like this place because when we picked up our takeout, i peeked inside and the restaurant looked unusually clean and bright.

all i got was the crab meat rangoons, and they were BLECH!  way too much pepper and tasted old.  i ate around the cheese and consumed the fried won ton skin

but it was no use!  i got a horrible stomach ache anyway! 

bf got mu shu pork and he said it was ok.
author: Josie M.

description: I just ordered for my office, and everyone loved what they got. So did I . Will go back again.
author: Dalia C.

description:
cheap cheap cheap.

good good good.

I might even have to go rerate this to 5 stars after i try once again. i was very impressed, overall. the food didn't seem to greasy. the mushu pork was our fav and we will defineezles be comin back
author: Victor B.

description: Had an order of the Basil Tofu lunch special ($7) in between appointments at UCSF: fried tofu, carrot, & red pepper with brown rice, a little salad, vegetarian hot & sour soup and an egg roll.  Food was delicious, staff was attentive, and an the ambiance was augmented with CNBC!
author: Rishi C.

description:
Never again.  I ate here one time and that was enough for me.  I couldn't finish the dishes that I ordered because they were slimy, hardly edible concoctions.  I will admit that the food was to go, but I live close enough that the time from pan to fork could not possibly explain away the quality of the food.  This was also a few month ago, so I guess they could have since turned it around, but I doubt it.

The restaurant is nearly always empty and the smells that permeate the store front never beckon me in to give it another try.  I couldn't even tell you what I ordered off the menu even though I can vividly remember the dish in front of me.  The place is either a front or they rely almost entirely on take-out and delivery business.

Overall, you're better off saving yourself some money and disappointment by going home and having a PB&J instead of eating here.  The restaurant itself is a nice and simple decor, if they could get the food to at least that quality they might get me back, but for not it's a no-go.
author: Thomas J.

description: still my favorite chinese delivery in sf... lots of veggies in dishes, mongolian beef, potstickers, chow mein, all great.  my favorite is the garlic eggplant. fast delivery
author: Laura M.

description: Definitely one of the better Chinese restaurants that I've been to in San Francisco. We had the Sun Flower Chicken and Basil Chicken, both of which were quite good. The chicken was VERY tender. The hot and sour soup was much better than most others I've had: nice and peppery (but not too hot), not turned into jello with cornstarch, and had some delicious little mushrooms (enoki I think). The potstickers were good, not great, but hey, they're potstickers. Over all, very reasonably priced, clean, good atmosphere, and good service too.
author: John M.

description: There is no Chinese food delivery place that is more delectable, timely, or as comforting as Yum Yum.  I can't remember the last time it was a Sunday morning when my roommates and I weren't sitting on the couch waiting for it to finally be 11am so that we could put in our order.  My waistline hasn't appreciated the foor per se, but my belly sure has!  The Wor Won Ton Soup/Szechuan green beans is my go-to if I'm leaning toward the healthy side, but the Sweet n Sour Chicken/Chicken Chowmein is what I REALLY love when I'm not giving a sh*t.  In a city full of incredible Chinese food - this is the delivery way to go.
author: Daniella S.

description: Ok really good chinese take out/delivery.  The food was really good, we got the general tso's chicken and the drunken beef.  i'm a big fan of having fresh and crisp veggies in my chinese food.  and i have to say the veggies looked fresh and tasted just right.  not crazy salty and drenched in thick sauce.  and the shrimp fried rice was great too.  and i have i to say these guys were incredibly quick in getting this stuff delivered considering that the weather was awful and that it was 5 o'clock.  i would definitely order from here again!
author: Jubi N.

description: This is the best chinese food delivery I have had in SF. They have a huge affordable menu and serve a large variety of dishes. Delivery is very fast and food comes hot hot hot! The seafood and veggies are always very fresh. I recommend the eggrolls, and shrimp with eggplant and basil- its thai inspired. I also like the chow fun and kung pao fried rice. They close earlier than most places so order before 10. Im gonna miss this place when I move!
author: M K.

description: I've worked 3 blocks away from this place for the last 3 years. How the hell have I not eaten here yet?  1 star for me for being lame and 4 stars for Yum Yum for being indeed, yummy.
author: Michelle C.

description: I ordered delivery - and the service was great... very prompt, but the food was just ok.  I found the won ton soup to be way too salty (and I love salt), and the pork fried rice was just so-so.  As for the kung pao chicken, that was pretty good but nothing special. I probably won't order from Yum Yum again.
author: J D.

description: In-Goddamn-Credible. I haven't had better Chinese food since birth. AND, my waitress was AMAZING. I DARE someone to say something bad about this place.
author: Patrick M.

description: With a name like Yum Yum I wouldn't think twice before ordering. But it's recently become my #1 delivery place. Relatively healthy with its meatless chicken options, all white chicken and tofu dishes,  fried brown rice and copious amounts of veggies. It's fresh, cheap and tasty. Everything I love on plate.
author: Alex H.

description: I like the food here for the most part. It's well priced, quick, and yummy. I feel there could be a bit more to quality in the food. I had their orange chicken once and it was good, and a lot. My favorite thing is that at night, if you order 2 meals, you get free fried rice or chow mein, for 2! I recently had their kung pao fried rice and it was good, but for some reason, i didn't like the way the chicken was chopped. It's a silly preferance but it was like... almost finely chopped that it almost didn't resemble chicken. They have delivery available, the atmosphere is nice, and they give you free tea. Good food.
author: Alex E.

description: The menu is a bit overwhelming but everything I've tried is fairly good.  Chow mein and Spicy eggplant are delicious, as well as the green beans and chicken.  You may want to ask for light sauce as many of the dishes are drenched.  Super quick delivery! A great neighborhood spot!
author: S. V.

description:
Took a shot at Yum Yum for the first time today based on the reviews and because it is closer then my regular haunts on Clement. I have to say, I was very pleased. First off, this place is clean, bright and friendly. Service was real quick and the staff had a cup of Hot and Sour soup, fresh tea w/pot and water in front of me within a minute of seating. I went for the lunch special which was a great value at $5.50. I decided on the staple of Kung Pao Chicken and w/ fried rice, but you do have a choice of steamed and even brown rice (which is great)! 

The food plate arrived piping hot and extremely quick. Yes, they weren't that busy now at 2:30, but still, very impressive. It was a generous lunch portion and even came with a nice side salad with a light sweet dressing and a free egg roll. Now we are talking. The dish was pleasantly spiced, great sauce (NO MSG) and everything was extremely fresh and the veggies were all properly cooked and retained their natural flavor. I was getting full about 1/2 to 3/4's of the way through the dish and that generally never happens with Chinese lunch specials. However, I couldn't put down the fork. It definitely hit the spot. 

I will be going here again for dinner with friends to order more of my favorites and continue to sample the menu. Btw - even the bathroom was extremely clean, well decorated, stocked and nice hand soap :) That is a good sign of the overall attention to detail and cleanliness of a restaurant.
author: Eric R.

description: Solid Hunan-style chinese food and has great lunch take-out dishes for $6.50.  They give you enough that if you're like me, you get hungry around 4pm and need another mini-meal.  Pork dumplings are very tasty and for some reason, I'm obsessed with their vinegary and spicy dumpling sauce- I want to eat more stuff just to dip it into that sauce!
author: Maxine S.

description: They have fast service, that is why they get the one star. The spring roll that was part of my dish was mediocre, pretty much the typical crunch. As for the lunch entree I ordered, thinking this place was SO PACKED during lunch hour I must try it, it was DISGUSTING. The salad is definitely from the large packages from Costco, nothing original and not fresh because it was brown. The brown rice was decent but the Hunan Beef was plastic-tasting, couldn't even cut the large pieces so I chewed and chewed and chewed to get through the piece of beef. After I did that twice, I stopped eating. They start off with a lemon-y tofu soup which is extremely tart and distasteful. Then they are anxious to get your order like 1 minute after they put down the HOT soup. The server did not even bother to place the lunch entree in front of me but semi-half off the table, which was extremely rude for a sit down restaurant where you have to wait in line to be seated. C'mon people, I know you are trying to make money and feed all those that come through your door, but better up your service otherwise YOU WILL LOSE CUSTOMERS LIKE ME.
author: Manu M.

description: This place is great. The service is fast and efficient. I usually order take out and have eaten their once. I have ordered the beef broccoli, sweet and sour chicken, vegetable fried rice, beef chow mein,  sizzling rice soup, and mushroom chicken. I wasn't a big fan of the mushroom chicken but everything else has been great here. Very flavorful and inexpensive.
author: Marissa Z.

description:
I dig this place, great food, not too greasy, ordered the orange meatless chicken and for someone who's not a huge fan of tofu i was blown away. taste real, real good. 
i have to say i'm disappointed that when i called the guy back to confirm the price and see how much everything way (i was going from the top of my head what i had previously ordered) he didn't tell me that it was buy 2 entrees and receive free chow mein or fried rice. that pisses me off. he was nice but didn't tell me that deal, so i paid for my own chow mein and really would have appreciated his honesty. the front of the menu tells you FREE chow mein/rice with 2 entrees.
author: A F.

description: this place is good for a chinese food place, really really fast service.  Its very american, not authentic at all.  Also there chicken tastes a tiny bit different, but still good.
author: christopher h.

description:
not good.

it was delivered in only 20 minutes, but i wish they had taken a little more time and prepared something edible.
author: Amanda S.

description: Overall the food was tasty- but pretty standard Chinese food. We live kind of far away and they delivered, which was pretty cool. I would say that we'd order again. We ordered hot n sour soup, which was delicious, the sweet and sour chicken was OK, not too saucy. There was a good amount of food and veggies as well! :) Mongolian beef, semi spicy and tender too.
author: Katherine B.

description: Just ordered lunch specials for delivery to office.  Our usual place is closed for the holidays; so we decided to try Yum Yum Hunan.  We were so happy that we wanted Yelpers to know.  The delivery time was very quick; food arrived pipping hot; and a special request that we were told over phone could not be done--actually was!  Most importantly, though, the food was just great--everything looked and tasted fresh; vegetables cooked al dente, brown rice steamed perfectly (but not dry); spicy means spicy (which I like--my co-worker asked  to "hold the spice" on his lunch, which was done).  Our lunches were very reasonably priced, and true to its name Yum Yum!  We will be ordering from this restaurant again!
author: C B.

description: The food is good for the most part. I live across the street and the only issue i have had was when I ordered the pork sui mai and it was cooked all the way through. Their won ton soup is pretty good. Walnut prawn is definitely up to par if not a little above. Their dim sum is worth passing on, but I feel that way because there are so many good dim sum places in the city and its definitely not their specialty.  service is good but they do kind of hurry you to order they dont seem to like my style of ordering one thing at a time.
author: Joshua D.

description: I've only ordered takeout and only peking duck about 3 times, so this is more of a compliment for fast delivery on a sunday evening at 8 p.m. and having a dish that's not always available. The duck is good. Not the best peking style duck I've had in SF.. (it's slightly fatty) but I kinda like it that way. It's my go-to for peking duck by delivery.
author: Jason G.

description: Again, I owe this review to my co-worker.  She came into work yesterday with this box that was just oozing this wonderful aroma.  She opened her box and the food practically exploded onto her desk, like it was trying to escape the box.  Wide-eyed, I wheeled my chair over to her and never making eye contact w/ her but molesting her food w/ my eyes, asked her where she got her food from.  She told me about this place and I was even more impressed that they had brown rice.  She ordered off of their lunch menu and I was really amazed at the amount of food she had for a relatively decent price ($7).  A sweet and sour wonton like soup w/ tofu is included with every lunch.  She gave the soup to me because she knew she wouldn't be able to eat everything.  This soup was so so so good.  I don't even like tofu.  Usually tastes like marinated sponge, but this was really good.  I proceeded to eat her leftovers because I'm a pig like that, and lo and behold, more tofu!  Apparently she got the veggie combo.  Again, the tofu was really really good.  Everything was really well seasoned.  I found myself even drooling over their fried wonton crisps.  I decided to go there today since I was craving it.  I probably only waited 5 minutes for my food to come out.  I ordered the garlic chicken w/ brown rice lunch combo and a side of egg rolls.  Silly me, I didn't think I'd be able to finish it all in one sitting.  I did.  Oh!  I DID bring the soup home....which I promptly inhaled in 2 minutes.  The garlic chicken was really good and mixed in w/ it were onions and zucchini.  The egg rolls were killer and again the soup was amazing.  Can't wait to eat here again!
author: Andrea B.

description: We were in the city to visit a friend and went to have lunch in Yum Yum Hunan based on the yelp recommendation.  We ordered from the lunch menu but both of us were really disappointed at the food.  The hot and sour soup was too sour.  Both dishes was way too salty.  We could hardly eat it, even with the rice. Service was good, however.
author: Elena H.

description:
Just moved to the neighborhood and was hoping to find a great Chinese take out.... Yum Yum hit the spot!  Tried the Hong Kong Chow Mein for the first time... with chicken.  Chicken was just ok but I would order again with just the veggies...great flavor and fun to eat.  I would recommend highly the Dry Garlic Shrimp... nice spice, really great... loved the fried rice as well.  Tried the spicy crispy pork... not a fan but thats ok... I have tried it before other places and its just me. 

Food was fresh and hot...delivered fast... service was friendly
author: Carol F.

description: Delicious food and great service. Took less than 30 minutes to get to my door, and the guy apologized for taking so long! You really get your money's worth, and the food is not greasy.
author: Maria D.

description:
Great service, polite, fast (under 20 mins from the time I picked up the phone to the time the food was in my kitchen).  I loved the garlic eggplant the most, and the won ton soup was full of white meat chicken and fresh vegetables.  I rarely get soup but just felt like it for some reason so I don't know how won ton soup usually looks, but this one seemed more packed with meat, veggies, and won tons than I remember most places having.  Oh, and I liked the fortune cookies .. they were funny.  "Try a new hat for a change in looks.  Be creative!"  Wow, that is good advice.  How did they know I love hats and need an excuse to buy another one?  "Your choices at the moment will be good ones.  Trust yourself."  Aaaw, that's sweet.  Just the pick-me-up I needed!
Oh thanks to the yelper who posted where you can find their menu.  I'll re-post that:
http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/yum-yum-hunan/menu
author: Muriel D.

description: Pretty good place. They give tons of food and usually throw in something extra - in my case, a giant dish of lo mein. The food itself isn't overly spectacular, but it's a great deal and probably the best in the area that delivers. 5 stars for the value and service. 3 for the food.
author: Tim I.

description: Had some food delivered. They were fast, everything we ordered was there, even a special request or extra sauce. The food was warm and delicious. No left overs :). I wish the curry chicken was a bit spicier tho.
author: Linda S.

description: good chinese.  Fast delivery.  Great Hot & Sour Soup (very strong).  I had the shrimp and brocoli lunch special and it was very tasty for just 6.75 and included soup, salad, rice, and tea.
author: Sage S.

description: REALLY GOOD chinese food.  I can say the best I've had.  Fresh veggies (not cooked too much but just right), delicious sauces and amazing prices for what you get.
author: R A.

description: Exceptional. Clean restaurant, fast and friendly service, excellent dishes. We tried the Mongolian Beef, Kung Pao Tofu and Vegetable Delight. Each lunch special was only $6 a pop, and was served with rice, soup, a spring roll, and hot tea. A shining star in cheap, but tasty, Chinese cuisine.
author: Brandi W.

description: My son and I wandered in here one afternoon on our way to check out the Yoda Fountain. We were greeted, seated and given a hot pot of tea. I'm a sucker for little touches. I don't eat meat so I was thrilled to see some of my old favorites in meatless form like General Tsao Meatless Chicken and vegetable pot stickers. My son ordered a chicken and noodle dish I forget which one. We were thrilled with the presentation and taste of everything and of course lunch was filled with Yum Yum jokes. If you are in the area or live nearby I would definitely check it out. Our total for two entrees and an appetizer was $22.
author: heather b.

description:
I really love this place, although I've never actually been to their restaurant. 
I've had delivery a couple of times, the food is always great and really reasonably-priced. Even better, I've never had to wait more than 25 minutes and the delivery guys are super-nice. Of all the places I've tried for delivery, this is my favorite.
author: Nat W.

description: GREAT chinese delivery - just ordered this tonight for the first time. Super quick service and the food is fresh and hot and not too greasy. Love the free fried rice with two entrees...this is definitely my new go-to delivery.
author: Kate S.

description:
It was love at first sight when i first walked into yum yum. 
three reasons this place rules: 

#1: its name is YUM YUM for gods sake

#2: when i walked in one night, hungover as no other, the sexy dance scene from "True Lies" was playing on their "big screen"  tv. If you haven't seen this clip. you haven't lived. Jamie Lee Curtis + 1994 + Our current governor = heaven.  Youtube it immediately

#3: Their potstickers are delicious and can be eaten for a whole meal they give you so many. Their huge portions and tasty food = an alcoholic's dream come true
author: Bri L.

description: Yum Yum Hunan is great!!  The meatless chicken general tso and kung pow tofu is great, healthy, light - great vegetarian options!  Spring rolls are also pretty tasty.  For 3 people, we ordered 2 entrees, an order of spring rolls (3), order of crab rangoon (6), and a large egg drop soup (which has yummy mushrooms and veggies in it), all for $35 and delivered in 45 min.  And we still had enough for a seconds.  I won't be getting delivery chinese from anywhere else.  I'm sold!
author: Meg G.

description: They deliver to your hospital room at kaiser. They have great meatless chicken (general tsao's is awesome). When my daughter was born and we were in the hospital for a few days, this place was a lifesaver.
author: Jeff W.

description: Good if you're looking for in-authentic, fast and somewhat greasy (in a good way) chinese food. The crab rangoon appetizer was bomb... it's like a deep fried wonton with crab and cream cheese inside.
author: Melissa D.

description: This is our go to neighborhood delivery spot... we admittedly always get the generic Chinese menu options like broccoli beef, garlic chicken and chow mien, but it's reliably yummy and very reasonably priced. It's a cheaper alternative to Eliza's just a few blocks away, but the food quality reflects the lower price. Still a good neighborhood Chinese food option though.
author: Adriana P.

description: Everything Ive tried here has been very tasty and well priced. Especially my newfound favorite the Kung Pao Chicken. Really good portions to
author: Anastasia K.

description:
I walked in and the place was very clean and quaint. Before I had a chance to order, tea and soup were placed in front of me and once I ordered, my lunch was there with in 5 minutes. Very quick place to grab food and it was very cheep. My dish came with rice, a small salad and an egg roll all for under 7 dollars which included the tea and soup. 

The only issues I had is the initial waiter forgot to bring me water and sugar for my tea. And it made me feel even more uncomfortable when they didn't bring it because by then I wanted some sweet/sour sauce and mustard with my egg roll and I wanted some more chili pepper to add spice to my Mongolian beef which was really good except for a bit to much black pepper. I settled for the sugar and sweet/sour sauce because I didn't want to be a bother but I really wish they would have asked if I needed anything else. I started feeling like I was on some conveyor belt.
author: Kalifornia S.

description: This is a great lunch spot.  It has a bunch of lunch specials for about $6.  This include sweet and sour soup, an egg roll and white or brown rice.  I ordered the cashew chicken which tasted pretty standard.  For the size of the portion and the price, this is a great deal.
author: Ginny M.

description:
I think there is like only 3 chinese restaurants on Divisadero St and since we(I) didn't want to lose my parking spot, we walked the 7 blocks to Yum Yum in the awful rain.
The place is pleasantly well light with a decent modern decor(for a chinese restaurant).
Hunan cuisine is spicy hot. Think Brandy Ho.

The mongolian beef is to die for! 

Definitely will come back again, might even try the take-out option as it seems to be very popular!
author: Rod A.

description: Came here on a Saturday night around 8:30, and although there were relatively few people in the restaurant, they were doing a busy delivery business.  I shared the Appetizer Platter and vegetable chow mein with my boyfriend and the two others shared the meatless general tsao's chicken and the sauteed green beans. Everything was delicious, fresh, not greasy at all, flavorful, and cooked well.  We will definitely be back again or order delivery soon.
author: kate m.

description: This is surprisingly decent Chinese delivery food. While it's not the best in SF, this place earns props due to the overall experience. The guy was extremely friendly and efficient on the phone. He even told me that the rice was free after I declined it. They also happily take credit cards. I didn't even have to ask. The food arrived in less than twenty minutes. The hot and sour soup hit the spot, and the salt and pepper chicken wings weren't too bad. The garlic chicken, however, was rather bland, though it did have fresh vegetables, as someone else pointed out. All in all, I'll probably be ordering from them often.
author: Michael G.

description: We tried this place because we heard they had "veggie"chicken from some other reviews. Well they did so I had the lemon veggie chicken and he had the prawn chow fun. We got the lunch special with both which includes soup. You just pay for the price of the entree-about 7-8$. Both were delicious and we were stuffed but happy. The portions are pretty big for lunch. Would definitely go back if we lived in San Fran. But really hate the city. They charge for card payments under 10.00$ btw.
author: Sam L.

description: I thought that I would try somewhere new to get some takeout. This food was so gross that I ended up throwing it away and ordering from my usual spot. I hate wasting food, but their soups were inedible.
author: Michelle R.

description: Great lunch specials!  This place has a new owner and look. I highly recommend the String Bean Salmon.  Beware that a lot of there stuff is deep fried.
author: Kate J.

description: The lunch specials are great deals! The food here is so delicious too! I ordered the Mongolian beef, my friend ordered the garlic prawns. Everything was so good. But the prawns came out late, when we were already finished with the Mongolian beef dish! If you're patient, then go for it!
author: Lady E.

description:
10,000 stars.

But seriously.....their meatless chicken is AMAZING. meat lovers out there, I know you doubt that....but you really cant judge till you try it.

Does it take like tofu? No. Like soy? bean curd? vegetables? No.

It's freaking delish. And if you order 2 entrees you get a free chow mein.

So....order some meatless chicken, and if you don't like it...well, **** me.

Not like typical greasy Chinese...its yummmmmmmm
author: N S.

description: I thought this was pretty good chinese food for the price. The fried food was excellent (walnut shrimp, fried bananas) because it wasn't greasy and it was crispy on the outside. I thought the red sauce shrimp was kind of gross because it was bright red and way too sweet (this coming from someone who liked the walnut shrimp) I might have given it 4 stars but I was really annoyed that the fried bananas and ice cream were sold separately when fried bananas should totally come with ice cream or they are USELESS. The dessert ended up being $8 and the ice cream had freezer burn. If you're going to charge me $3.80 for ice cream (that should come with the bananas for free) then you should make it yourself.
author: mazzy s.

description:
Very speedy delivery.

Their string beans are amazing, and their hot-and-sour soup is close to perfection.

Overall, great chinese-delievery place.
author: Anna B.

description:
I've only had their delivery, that's what my comments are based on.

The quality of the food was very good.  The best parts were: (1) nice cuts of meat, (2) the vegetables were fresh, well cooked, good ratio to meat and not saturated in sauce.  Service was quick and polite.  

I will certainly order from them again.  Personally, I like more bold and spicy flavors, so I will ask for my order to be made "spicy" next time.
author: Mandii S.

description:
We ate here the other day and it was a bad experience. 

i ordered Mongolian Beef Lunch Special, way too much pepper, and MSG! I can normally tolerate MSG, but here my jaw stiffened and i started getting chest pains. Luckily i stopped and after drinking lots of water i was ok.  I think you can not see the MSG, but I could see the extreme amount of pepper in the beef. 

Today when looking at our credit card account online, we found that they added money on our credit card. They charged us more than we approved. We feel that we gave a good tip (30%) and no business should overcharge on people's credit cards. 

If you eat here, dont eat the mongolian beef and check that the amount on your credit card is correct.
author: Shane J.

description:
i wasn't a fan of hunan china at all.  in fact, my co-worker and i used to refer to it as "dirty chinese" as opposed to "clean chinese" which is eliza's around the corner.

what a delight when yum yum replaced hunan china.  the food is just as cheap but infinitely better.  i'm a big fan of the sesame chicken with brown rice, and also have good things to say about the sweet and sour chicken, and the sesame beef.  some of my co-workers swear by the string bean salmon.

the lunch special, for most items, is a mere $6 including tax for an entree, rice (white or brown), soup, and an appetizer of their selection.  great lunch spot if you work in the neighborhood.
author: Roshni R.

description: Good food, affordable, quick service. Dining area is modern with great lighting. Friendly staff. Definitely worth a shot if you are looking for quick, delicious Chinese food.
author: Scott T.

description: This place is very close to where I work at, UCSF, so it's a common place for all my co workers and I to head out to for a quick lunch of good solid chinese food. For about 6  bucks, you get an entree, with your choice of white rice, fried rice OR brown rice. I love that they have brown rice, and it doens't come at an extra cost either. Maybe they know that there are serveral hospitals in the area, and they smartly want to cater to the health conscoius crowd. Personal faves are the mango chicken, kung pao chicken, hunan chicken, general tso chicken, and mongolian beef. You really can't go wrong with their lunch portions and prices. Now if only they would servce BBQ pork - it would be the bomb hizzle.
author: Jerry C.

description: Outstanding!  Good food to say the least and even better, friendlier service than I expected.  Get the shanghai chicken. MMMMM MMMM
author: Amir B.

description: I tried this place once and it was alright. So I thought I would give it another chance. AWFUL!!!! I enjoyed the steamed rice more than the main dish!!!
