And when the check came with a fortune cookie there was a piece of METAL baked into the cookie. The waitress saw I was looking at it in my hand took it from me showed her manager and that was it!!! No apology or free meal or even another cookie (not that I would have eaten it after that)!! NOTHING!! THIS PLACE SUCKS!! I'm not picky about where I eat and I like everything so this just blew my mind!! Save your money and go to Clement to get some real great tasting Chinese food for cheaper!!
author: MAC A.

description: Solid delivery place.  The people are really nice on the phone, and the delivery comes in a reasonable amount of time.  I didn't like the Basil Tofu dish much but that's only because there's a lot of water chestnuts in it.  The Lover's Prawns are great half honey walnut prawns and half prawns in a sweet slightly spicy sauce (if the sauce were spicier it'd be even better).  With two entrees, you get a free fried rice or noodle and you can get "chow fun" as the noodle entree.  Anytime we order from here we can eat the leftovers for at least 2 more meals.
author: Joann C.

description:
So our Hunan cravings had led us to Eliza's, but sadly, they were closed by the time we got there (around 945pm ish).  We headed down divisadero, knowing there were was another Hunan joint there.  We discovered Yum Yum Hunan, formerly known as Hunan China Restaurant.  It was already 950pm by the time we arrived and they were happy to accomodate our prompt lateness.  We were ecstatic and ordered the usual, sweet & sour pork, orange chicken, singapore noodles, garlic eggplant.  To my delight they announced that we get free fried rice or chow mien with 2 entree orders!!!  Ooh...free food, I'm not the one to be complaining.  So, the order was taken and their ferocious wok skills dished out our take out in 5 minutes!  Amazing! (I guess they wanted to close by 10)  20 minutes later, as we were unpacking our food on our Ikea coffee table, we discovered...*dramatic pause*....THERE WAS NO GARLIC EGGPLANT!  WHAT THE HELL!!!  With tears running down our faces, we ate our tasty but yet incomplete dinner.  Although the dishes we had were satisfying, it was still lacking the garlicy eggplant.  Yum Yum Hunan would have easily gotten 4.5 shiny red stars from us, but instead, we gave them 3 slightly tarnished yellow stars.  

*Sniff...sniff*...till this very second, as I am typing this review, my discouraged palate is still searching for the hint of eggplant that should be present between the cracks of my teeth.   *SIGH*...
author: LittleBird 8.

description: I'm addicted to Hunan...not just because it was in the neighborhood.  Like any small Asian restaurant, they always welcomed me when I ate there.  Green Beans (spicy), and General Tso chicken which might be related to another General's chicken which is drenched in sauce but still stays crunchy texture.  How could you not like that?  Even though I haven't been there in like 3 years (I live in Milpitas now...gosh), I could still remember that saucy taste when I mix my chicken, beans, and rice....YUM.  I would order over the phone, and within walking two blocks, it was ready.  I think the price was suitable since I was stretched for cash back then.
author: Joey H.

description: so, many years ago, when I still lived in the magical land of Chicago, I worked in a Chinese restaurant.  Because I worked full-time, I wound up eating the food there quite often, and got so acclimated to the flavors they used that for many years I could not eat any other Chinese food.  However, after a good long break, Yum Yum Hunan has brought me back into the fold - and their food is even better than I remember!  I'm personally a fan of the Sizzling Basil Beef, and my boyfriend quite enjoyed the Peking Duck.  the restaurant loses a little for me because they have those fat plastic chop sticks, and I find them hard to use - I prefer the thin kind that allow me to pick up single grains of rice that have gotten all slippery because of the sauce.  but 5 stars for the food and the fast delivery!
author: Katie P.

description: Love this place even when it was over in the mission. I think they have the best meatless chicken stuff anywhere. I eat meat but the lady doesn't but and this places  meatless chicken taste better than the real thing. The five flavor fake chicken is the best thing they have, and the basil fake chicken is also really good. Super friendly , fast delivery and if you get 2 entrees you get a free fried rice or chow mein.
author: Matthew R.

description: I am patient at UCSF Hellen Diller cancer center (1600 Divisadero). I went for lunch on 5/26 around 1PM. It was fairly busy but I was seated immediately. I do not eat red meat. The owner/server came and gave me a cup of soup. I wanted to know if it has any red meat it. So, even before I asked him what is in the soup, he said it is soup and walked away. Duh, I know that is is soup. Then he came back took the soup away. My Shrimp fried rice was delightful. However, I am knocking off 2 stars because (1) why should we give a pass for poor service, irrespective of the cuisine? I have seen lot of reviews where they say poor service but what do you expect from Chinese place. Why is that? (2) why minimum charge of $10 to accept credit card? I ordered a soft drink and fried rice. Am i supposed to stuff myself to meet $10 minimum. Isn't a fried rice and soft drink enough to fill up a normal person? I probably go again if I have my family with but not super happy experience.
author: Ram G.

description:
Taking away a star because they truly screwed up my last order. We got someone else's order entirely. When I called to complain the best that they could do was get the delivery guy to swap the orders back. It was after they closed so they would make me a new order. By the time our food arrived it was an hour and a half from when we originally ordered it and it was ice cold. 
I don't want to take more stars away because they've always been good before, but this was really annoying. They should have at least comped the meal.
author: chicka d.

description: Okay I'm full blooded Chinese and I really love this place! For the longest time there we're no Chinese restaurants on Divisadero. We always liked Yum Yum House in the Mission. When they closed it was a sad sad day. So when we got a take out menu on our door, we freaked out because not only was it Yum Yum but delivery too!! And boy do they deliver fast. We always get our order in about 1/2 hour even through they say 45 minutes. And the food is hot!! That's amazing on it's own! And free fried rice or chow mein when you get two entrees! Chinese people never have chow mein for dinner but if it's free it's okay. I highly recommend the Yum Yum combo clay pot- you get a little bit of everything and the flavors are amazing. Lots of leftovers too. Me and my husband can stretch it out for three days. That's a lot of food! Highly recommended!
author: Karen C.

description:
yum yum in my tum tum.

the best chinese food i've had delivered in this city so far.

five stars goes to it if it's as good the next time.  i had all veggie dishes. 

very good!
author: Anya L.

description:
i love yum yum.  i loved yum yum on valencia...unfortunately it moved to divisadero, but luckily, i work close by there!  
my favorites: hot and sour soup. it's vegetarian and delicious and will clear up any stuffed nose you have.
onion pancake:  light, scallion-ey and good peanut dip.
basil tofu, comes with jalepenos, yum.
any meatless chicken dish.  my husband eats meat, he couldn't tell!
veggie fried rice.  mmmmmm
oh, i could go on and on. prices are cheeeeeeeeaaaap.  hooray!
lunch special is where it's at though, you get the perfect portions and a bit of everything.  
yum yum for my tum tum.
author: Little P.

description:
Ok, so I read someone else's review about how they got their food in like 20 minutes or something so I was pretty excited about that when I ordered last night.However, our order took over an hour to arrive. Maybe it was the rain. 
On to the food. When it finally arrived there was quite a bit in exchange for not too much money which is always a pretty pleasant suprise. The food itself was pretty good, HOWEVER, when I was eating the chow mein, what did I find? A little peice of metal nestled within the noodles and hidden just enough to make it into my mouth. Repulsive. If that didn't happen I (and I'm sure anyone else) would have been much happier. The Kung Pao Tofu was ok, but not what I was expecting. Not the fault of the restaurant as I was trying it for the first time. The veggie potstickers were great and less greasy  than other places, but the green onion pancakes were pretty greasy and made me feel like I had to take a shower after I ate one. Im going to give this place another chance and hope for speedier delivery and metal free food next time.
author: reina t.

description: The best way to describe their food is it is shows up at your door as soon as you hang up the phone for delivery.  My mom used to always says good food is not fast and fast food is not good. Mom was right.
author: John W.

description:
I created a Yelp account, JUST so I could write a review about this place. The guy on the phone was sooo mean! I was home sick and the only thing I thought would make me better was some wonton soup and mongolian beef.

The soup was perfect and soothing, and the mongolian beef fresh and exactly what I wanted. The guy was mean.. but I will put up with it to get the food.
author: Sam A.

description:
This isn't the greatest Chinese food in town, but it is good and very reasonable.  One person can have lunch and leave a tip for $10.  The average lunch special includes soup, rice, fried or steamed, an egg roll, a small salad, and a choice of entrees, as well as tea and a fortune cookie.

They offer a whole choice of entrees, and I haven't had a bad one.  I certainly recommend their Singapore style noodles, if you like a light curry.  The hot and sour soup is tasty, though certainly not hot or sour.

Still, I keep going back to the place, because the food is tasty, the price reasonable, and the service fairly friendly.
author: Richard C.

description:
i have a soft spot for yum yum house.  they have always been the best of the chinese delivery spots in the mission, msg free, nice staff, familiar with regulars, not to mention that "yum yum" is an understatement.  but most of all i love them because once when i  was very sick with the flu and bronchitis off and on for three weeks and i was ordering their hot and sour for lunch every day.  eventually the guy who usually answered the phone joked that i must really like their soup to order so often and i told him my predicament.  to my surprise, when my delivery guy came to the door, i suddenly had a giant container of hot and sour-same price as the smaller size and he told me to get well soon.  how f***ing rad is that???

sadly, i moved away from the mission in december and the chinese food in my new hood just wasn't the same.  then i heard that they were closed down in april and my heart was broken . . . until one day when i was walking down divisidero and to my amazement-we're neighbors again!!!  i went right in and ordered up some mandarin meatless chicken, chatted with them about the closure, how big lantern stole their identity, and the new location.  two words-hells yeah!!!
author: Wendolyn A.

description: For the low price its very good. As good as it gets. Everything is so flavorful. The sauces all sink in deep into the meat and veggies. Though it is OILY food but fat is what makes food tasty.
author: Robert S.

description:
YEA!! A very nice yelper messaged me to let me know that Yum Yum house was not gone, just moved.  I'm going today!
UPDATE:  My boss and I ordered from here twice in the last two weeks.  EXACTLY the same as Yum Yum on Valencia.  I really like their vegetarian hot and sour soup, their fake chicken kung pao, and their fried rice.  She really likes the sizzling rice soup.  Super nice guy on the phone, however the first time we ordered it took FOREVER to get to us but the second time it was quick, so we'll soon find out if the long wait was just a fluke.  However the food made it worth it.  Also, if you call before 3pm, they will deliver the lunch special.  Excellent.
author: nicole p.

description: Took Yelp's advice and ordered take out by phone - without a menu. Person was SO NICE! Helpful, patient, very co-operative. Delivery person also excellent. Food very good - Will order again.
author: Linda K.

description: Hard to find good chinese food in this city, which seems crazy, but it is true. Yum Yum Hunan is the perfect blend of fresh, quality, flavorful food at reasonable prices... It is my new favorite place...
author: rachel s.

description: This place was absolutely amazing! My family and I had been driving around for some time looking for a good place to eat. (We are not from the area) We finally decided to park somewhere and just walk around. We stumbled across YUM YUM Hunan and walked in to find a very clean looking place. I am not sure if they just opened or if they always have such a spotless place, but I was impressed. The restroom was even immaculate! My husband, my two children, and myself decided this restaurant is much better than our local favorite and we will definitely be dining here again. Not to mention... we stuffed ourselves for about $30.
author: Veronica M.

description: Yum Yum Hunan was recommended to me by my half Asian friend who is super picky about Asian cuisine of any kind.  She also has very expensive taste so I was surprised to find that Yum Yum (as we now affectionately refer to it) is very reasonable (cheap actually).  I have loved everything I have ever ordered.  And for nights spent in, ordering Yum Yum Hunan delivery is the best thing in the entire world.  It's hot, fresh, tasty, and even when I eat a lot of it (which I do quite often) I don't feel like I overdid it as I normally do with inexpensive Chinese food restaurants in the city.   For delivery and to-go orders they offer an order of free Chow Mein or Fried Rice with the purchase of two entrees.  Translation:  For under $20 you can get a LOT of food.  Good food too.  Seriously.  I love this place.  I'm a fan of the Shanghai Chicken, Basil Tofu and MuShu Pork (to name a few).  I have a delivery order en route to me as I write this.
author: Annalise V.

description: When I'm looking for delivery Chinese, this is my go to restaurant.   The food is tasty, fresh, and delivered fast (even though I'm not right around the corner).   I've never been disappointed by them.   They're great with the customer service, too...  always very friendly, both on the phone and at the door.   As for value, no tiny helpings here.   You're almost guaranteed to have leftovers.   Love it.
author: Victor S.

description:
I love this place! I found it through yelp and I have now I got about twice a month. Everything I have ordered has been delicious. The walnut prawns are especially delicious. 

Price: affordable
Time: very quick 
atmosphere: quiet and relaxed

I recommend this place for a date because it is so quiet and relaxed.
author: MARIA Q.

description: So this place is OK.  It's not nearly as good as Henry's Hunan on Sansome & Broadway, but it's alright.  The people there are super nice and they deliver, so it can do the trick if you need it to.  But if you're blazed and looking for the perfect meal, just get a Philly Cheesesteak.
author: Charles T.

description: ordering delivery from here is the best decision i have made in my entire life.  $15 minimum for deliv, great quality and food was still piping hot when it arrived.
author: Mimi X.

description: Awesome---I really like the pork pot stickers, the Spicy Mandarin eggplant, and the Mongolian Beef
author: Raman R.

description:
i was so happy when this place reopened where hunan china used to be.  why?  because yum yum hunan serves meatless chicken!  i am a huge tofu fan but sometimes your mouth just needs that extra chewiness.  it's so good even my husband orders it, and he is usually not very vegetarian-friendly.  it's great because now we can actually SHARE OUR DISHES!  this happened maybe twice a year previously.  now it can be a weekly event.  he always orders the same thing--the general tsao's meatless chicken--but that's okay because so far it's the best thing we've tried on the menu.  the lemon chicken is pretty good too, and they will make most regular meat dishes with meatless chicken--i had them made me basil meatless chicken and it was yummy.  however, this is not a health food place.  the tastiest meatless chicken is the kind that's fried.  the basil meatless chicken wasn't breaded and fried, and it looked like diced ham--while it tasted good, it was a bit strange.

also free chow mein (the least greasy i've ever had) or fried rice (they can even make it with no egg) when you order two dishes or more.  you get a ton of food--usually we have leftovers more than once.  i am finally happy to live in pacific heights.
author: kate s.

description: I ordered delivery from this place a week ago and paid with a debit card. BIG MISTAKE! My bank account number was used by one of their employees to purchase about 500 dollars in merchandise. I traced it back to the restaurant because of the address they were providing for their purchases was the same address I ordered the food from and never had affiliated with my credit card other than that time. So to make a long story short be careful if you order from this place, be sure to pay cash there is someone working there that is a thief!
author: t n.

description: It's a great place in the Pacific Hts area for good, cheap Chinese food. I've been living in the area for about 5 years, and aside from Eliza's cheap and tasty M-F lunches, good & cheap Chinese food in this area is hard to find. (I've done the research) I was so happy they moved here. Their old location was on Valencia. Unlike Eliza's, they even serve their cheap lunches on weekends! My favorite is the sauteed string beans. Any of their shrimp dishes are tasty too.
author: Lisa F.

description: yum yum, indeed!  Just finished stuffing my belly with super delicious and FRESH chinese food.  I ordered the veggie deluxe which came with broccoli, mushroom, snow peas, and baby corn that were still crispy and fresh, which is a huge surprise considering other take out places.  Also had the crispy deep fried chicken wings, which were amazingly tender.  Best part was the batter was still crispy.  And thank you fellow yelper for posting about the free chow mein with a 2 entree order.  I asked the guy on the phone (who was super friendly) if they still offered this special and he said yes without any hesitation.  The chicken chow mein was so good, I couldn't stop talking about how good it was while I was eating it.  Oh, and the craziest part was the food got to me in 15 minutes!  I had to check my call log to make sure that was right.  I felt like the guy was at my door the second I hung up.  I'm so deliriously happy right now, I wanted to call them up and tell them how good the food was and that they made my night.  So excited I found this place, I'm always wary of chinese delivery, but I'm happy to say I've found my go to chinese spot.  Woot!
author: Sophie P.
